articles.name: -fens-geese-seize-deserted-campus-begin-fortifying-defences
articles.title: FENS GEESE SEIZE DESERTED CAMPUS: BEGIN FORTIFYING DEFENCES
articles.brief: While Northeastern Administration originally planned to push the Geese out this upcoming fall, such an eventuality seems unlikely. Even if Northeastern can get their shit together, the Geese have begun setting up massive fortifications on the now-abandoned Campus...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – After the mass exodus of the student population on the fateful evening of March 17, the Northeastern University campus was left completely deserted. Within hours, the legendary sandwich shop Chicken Lou’s closed. Most establishments soon followed suit, even the religious individuals and the lady asking for a dollar in Ruggles station left the area and closed indefinitely. The only individuals who remained on campus were a couple of frat bros who apparently never bothered to read the eviction memo. With practically no one to inhabit and defend the campus the leaders of the Goose Liberation Army soon set their eyes on their lifelong goal, taking over campus.

It took no less than 10 minutes until the last of the frat bros surrendered campus to the leaders of the Goose Liberation Army. The power of two half-drunken White ClawsTM powering the frat bros was no match for the thousands of Geese who descended upon campus. An official surrender was signed and so the campus that had been a home to Northeastern Students for decades was now in the domain of the almighty Goose Liberation Army. 

While Northeastern Administration originally planned to push the Geese out this upcoming fall, such an eventuality seems unlikely. Even if, IF, Northeastern can get their shit together, the Geese have begun setting up massive fortifications on the now-abandoned Campus. Trench lines now run through campus connecting the Northeastern tunnel system, and Geese snipers patrol from the top of Northeastern’s 2 libraries (Fun Fact: Despite earning 1.4 Billion in total operating revenue over 2019, Northeastern only has 1 real library!)

In brighter news, we probably won’t even have to worry about this since there is a 75% chance Northeastern will just close the campus for fall anyway.
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21

articles.name: -taco-bell-announces-free-chalupa-virus-giveaway-if-coranavirus-spread-exceeds-2-million
articles.title: TACO BELL ANNOUNCES FREE "CHALUPA-VIRUS GIVEAWAY" IF CORANAVIRUS SPREAD EXCEEDS 2 MILLION
articles.brief: Taco Bell announced Monday a new promotional campaign directly linked to the spread of the coronavirus...
articles.text:
In lighter news, Taco Bell announced Monday a new promotional campaign directly linked to the spread of the coronavirus. Inspired by the traditional “100-Point Freebie Chalupa” campaign run for many Basketball organizations, Taco Bell has promoted an aggressive advertising campaign dubbed “The Chulapa-Virus Campaign” where the rapid spread of the coronavirus gets the US closer to a free Chalupa. 

   “People need an emotional boost and the coronavirus is everywhere in the news. It was really a no-brainer,” said Taco Bell CEO Tim Horton. “Of course some executives brought up ethical concerns regarding incentivizing consumers to spread the virus, but we really doubt Americans are desperate enough to spread a deadly disease for a free Chalupa.”

   “I’m definitely planning to spread coronavirus for a free Chalupa.” Said Kyle Scott, a fifth-year Northeastern Business student, and avid frat member. “I’m pretty desperate for free Taco Bell.” 

   The Taco Bell giveaway has also had unexpected effects on public policy. In order to hit the 2 million “Chalupa-Virus” giveaway, the US has spearheaded an effort within the WHO and the UN pushing China to give accurate assessments of Chinese coronavirus cases. 

   “Look it's not Chick-Fil-A,” said Vice President Mike Pence. “But it's still Taco Bell. I’ll be damned if I let the Chinese keep me away from a free Chalupa just because they don’t want to scare business away. I should already be eating a Chalupa right now but China won’t man up and boost our numbers.” 

   Pence noted that he would have to go to a location free of women so he would feel comfortable eating his free Chalupa. Northeastern students have suggested literally anywhere in the Khoury College of Computer Sciences.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: -after-northeastern-online-dialogue-news-the-husky-husky-gives-up
articles.title: AFTER NORTHEASTERN "ONLINE DIALOGUE NEWS" THE HUSKY HUSKY GIVES UP
articles.brief: The truth is this: We simply cannot beat Northeastern at their own game.
articles.text:
Dear readers, 


It's been an amazing time writing for you over these past few months. The Husky Husky has reported on groundbreaking news, expanded its staff, and was in the process of opening a brand new website. It is with a heavy heart and deep regret that we have decided to throw in the towel. 


This may surprise some of our fans, but we believe most of you saw this coming. The cracks in our once noble facade started to show, and for that, we sincerely apologize. At a certain point, the pressure in creating high-quality news simply becomes too much for any student org to handle.


The truth is this:

We simply cannot beat Northeastern at their own game. 


We started The Husky Husky to make fun of Northeastern’s ridiculous student government, administration, and campus culture. But at a certain point, truth and fiction have meshed to where one and the other are completely indistinguishable.


We can’t write better satire than the Northeastern Online Dialouge of Civilizations page and we never will be able to.


In light of this insurmountable fact - we have decided to shut down permanently for the next 24 hours. 



See you tomorrow, 

The Husky Husky Staff.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: -northeastern-announces-that-118th-commencement-will-be-hosted-on-google-hangouts
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN ANNOUNCES THAT 118TH COMMENCEMENT WILL BE HOSTED ON GOOGLE HANGOUTS
articles.brief: Northeastern recently announced that commencement would take place by “just asking for everyone’s email and using this hip new Google+ service.”
articles.text:
Following a well-thought-out end to Northeastern University’s spring 2020 semester, Students weren’t at all concerned with how the Covid-19 pandemic would affect this year’s commencement.

“Northeastern has proven itself to be capable in times of crisis.” Said Bjorn Smith, a 8th-year civil-engineering major, with a nervous smile and cursory glances to the roofs of surrounding buildings. “I’m sure that however commencement is handled, it will be perfect.” His eyes continued to scan the university’s arboretum campus as he scurried away at a pace that could be described as normal and non-conspicuous. Eyewitnesses later reported that Northeastern mascot, Paws, was seen on the roof of the Curry Student Center dejectedly cleaning what looked like a Barret Model 98B sniper rifle.

Students did not have to wait long to hear the University’s decision. Northeastern recently announced that commencement would take place by “just asking for everyone’s email and using this hip new Google+ service.” 

    Upon further inquiry, President Aoun could barely hold his excitement. “Our student body requires the best sendoff into the working world and that’s why we partnered with Google to host the events on Google Hangouts!” After reaffirming that there is, in fact, a video-call service called Google Hangouts, our next question was why to choose hangouts over literally anything else. After pausing for a moment, Aoun responded “We considered Slack, mostly in part due to the party parrot emote,” He proceeded to emulate the wild club dance of the parrot, in what can only be described as a divine encapsulation of the human spirit before continuing “but we realized that students have a habit of joining many slacks and not contributing meaningfully to any of them. We want students to be engaged at every step of the way, so we thought ‘What do students use every step of the way? Google!”

More details are to come, but in the meantime, President Aoun advises all students to make use of the expansive library of emojis to denote their google hangout status and to accept the invitation from Northeastern when it comes.

After looking further into google hangouts, and seeing Paws scoping out The Husky Husky staff building, we at The Husky Husky have come to fully support how the University is handling this situation.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f

articles.name: -wayfair-unveils-new-co-op-position-where-co-op-just-fires-people
articles.title: WAYFAIR UNVEILS NEW CO-OP POSITION WHERE CO-OP JUST FIRES PEOPLE
articles.brief: During a recent round of layoffs, Wayfair executives realized that co-op students simply weren’t prepared to destroy a fellow human's financial future and sense of self-worth in an emotionally devastating layoff.
articles.text:
For many Northeastern students Wayfair isn’t just a furniture company. It’s a state of the art tech company which also represents a potential co-op employer. In fact, Wayfair hired over 300 coops during 2019. 

   But during a recent round of layoffs, Wayfair executives realized that co-op students simply weren’t prepared to destroy a fellow human's financial future and sense of self-worth in an emotionally devastating layoff. 

   “Students were coming in and saying - ‘I feel bad about watching my coworkers get fired’” said Ed Sheeran, an executive at Wayfair. “The co-ops weren’t feeling superiority or smug satisfaction - they felt ‘bad’. Hell, I couldn’t even trust my co-ops to fire employees without trying to console them emotionally - like they’re human or something. Here at Wayfair, we expect better than that.” 

   “This new co-op position is attempting to rectify the problematic empathy we see in Northeastern students.” Said Kiera Nightly, another Executive at Wayfair. “The co-op will spend their day firing workers - sure - but they will also be constructing programs to teach Northeastern students to be OK with their coworkers getting canned.” 

   Stan Steve, a 2nd-year student at Northeastern, is excited for Wayfair’s new co-op position. “Every company promises to train you with skills that will be useful for the marketplace of the future. I never know if they’re telling the truth or just lying through their teeth. But judging from the market’s last 3 days - firing is going to be a damn useful skill for at least the next couple years.” 

   Sheeran shares Steve's excitement. "Here at Wayfair, we're all about turning empathy into apathy."
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: -department-of-religion-seizes-control-of-northeastern-demands-students-repent
articles.title: DEPARTMENT OF RELIGION SEIZES CONTROL OF NORTHEASTERN: DEMANDS STUDENTS REPENT BEFORE THE END TIMES
articles.brief: In a stunning turn of events, the Northeastern Department of Philosophy and Religion seized control of the Northeastern administration early this morning.
articles.text:
Boston, MA -- In a stunning turn of events, the Northeastern Department of Philosophy and Religion seized control of the Northeastern administration early this morning. At approximately 7 A.M., The Philosophy and Religion Department Chair, Ron Sandler, rushed into the administration building clad in Franciscan monk attire. Sandler, screaming wildly about the coming apocalypse, was flanked closely by dozens of department professors armed with flails, maces, and torches. 

   “REPENT YE SINNERS - THE END OF ALL THINGS IS UPON US.” Yelled Sanders, once a mild-mannered philosophy professor. “THE SECOND COMING HAS BEEN HERALDED BY THE BRIMSTONE AND PLAGUE OF THE WORLD’S END.”

   Sanders, whose academic focus is on data technology and ethics, then ordered his department lackies to pile all books in the street. They then proceeded to light them on fire, at which point Northeastern students joined in - mistaking the book burning as a protest against Curry Library prices. 

   NO ONLINE COURSES CAN PREVENT THE SINFUL FROM THEIR DIVINE PUNISHMENT!” Screamed Sanders, clearly referencing Northeastern expected response to the coronavirus.

   Those working in the building were understandably upset in response to the unexpected turn of events. 

“He just started shouting passages from Revelations and the Mandalorian at us.” Said Eve Sebastian, a worker at the Administration Facilities Building on the Northeastern campus. "Then he made us denounce Anabaptists and ‘the false idol Aoun’. I’m not even a part of Northeastern - I’m just a temp-worker.”  

   Northeastern students, however, seem content with the change in administration.

   “I for one, am happy the new administration is at least acknowledging that the end times are upon us” said Sean Wrapper, a Sophomore at Northeastern. “Plagues, massive forest fires - hell, we should’ve known something was up when we won three Beanpots.” 

   For more updates on this evolving story, check out the Husky Husky Town Crier™ at Krentzman Quad, located between the diseased pile of corpses and the CDC emergency refuge.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: -northeastern-university-inaugurates-st-botolph-street-wind-tunnel
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY INAUGURATES ST. BOTOLPH STREET WIND TUNNEL
articles.brief: The newly inaugurated wind tunnel was quickly put to use by the newly formed Wind Tunnel Club (NU Wind).
articles.text:
​Boston, MA – Many Northeastern University students had been asking for new housing, more study spaces, and an expansion to Rebecca’s amid the growing student population. In response to this the school’s administrators have taken advantage of the already available resources on campus and created a wind tunnel using the existing buildings on St. Botolph street. 

  The new wind tunnel situated right outside East Village takes advantage of the Mach 2 winds that are already present on the street and thus uses no electricity or any real equipment to operate. The substance used to track airflow comes from the international students ripping fat vape clouds at the end of the street. “The only downside is that we can’t really turn it off because we would have to turn off the wind. Also, after a while the smell of Banana flavored vape gets a little annoying” said Kevin Smith, an 11th year Mechanical Engineering student. 

    Construction of the wind tunnel was brief as the only thing that had to be built was a stand and a small sign alerting passing students that it may be a little windy. After the inauguration of the wind tunnel the newly formed Wind Tunnel club, NU Wind, began testing various objects on the wind tunnel. “So far we have tested the aerodynamics of a CAMD student and a Rebecca’s van” said Craig Miller, the president of NU Wind. Craig went on to elaborate how they will continue testing different objects and hope to test the aerodynamics of President Aoun. “His sleek yet supple frame may give us insight into new aerodynamic and, most importantly, robot proof design”
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21

articles.name: -international-student-nervously-speed-walks-through-ruggles-station
articles.title: INTERNATIONAL STUDENT NERVOUSLY SPEED WALKS THROUGH RUGGLES STATION
articles.brief: The student seemed to be in a hurry to cross the station and was avoiding eye contact with other commuting students boarding their trains home.
articles.text:
Ruggles Station, Boston – An international student wearing a Canada Goose jacket, AirPods Pro, and some sick Yeezys was spotted Speed Walking through the Ruggles Station this afternoon shortly around 8pm. 

   The student seemed to be in a hurry to cross the station and was avoiding eye

contact with other commuting students boarding their trains home. It is reported that the

student seemed rather nervous while crossing the dimly lit MBTA station. In fact, the student was so nervous he didn’t even say hello to the man asking him for change, or a workaholic Jehova’s witness. 

   The student was remarkably fast and was able to cross the station without peril before

promptly walking into International Village. It appears that the MACH 2 winds had no effect one was quite quick to enter IV.

  “I think he may have broken the record for crossing Ruggles” said Rosie Mela, a 9th year Economics Student.

  The current record for speed walking across Ruggles Station (0 minutes and 46 seconds – OCT 31st , 2019) is held by a Pike member who thought he was being followed by police. 

  The student, who asked to remain anonymous, is currently being recruited by every Northeastern sports team except the hockey team which is “pretty sure we’ve got the hockey thing down, thank you very much.”
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21

articles.name: northeastern-students-spend-three-day-weekend-studying-cleaning-and-helping-community
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN STUDENTS SPEND THREE DAY WEEKEND STUDYING, CLEANING AND HELPING COMMUNITY
articles.brief: Northeastern University recently had a three day weekend in celebration of President’s day. Students, who often complain about their stressed and over-scheduled lives, used this time to effectively do work they had been putting off.
articles.text:
Northeastern University recently had a three day weekend in celebration of President’s day. Students, who often complain about their stressed and over-scheduled lives, used this time to effectively do work they had been putting off. 

   “I realized that I had several projects that were coming up before and after spring break, so I knew I should get them done early.” Said Dan Rathers, a Freshman Business student at Northeastern University. “I managed to get my entire marketing workload out of the way, and even got halfway through this CS Fundamentals project that was bugging me. Can you imagine if I just messed around or did stupid shit all weekend?” 

   Rathers wasn’t alone in efficiently and effectively using his time, though other Northeastern students found different outlets for the extra day they had. “I realized that I put off cleaning my apartment,” said Vernonia Smith, a Junior at Northeastern. “So I swept up, mopped, reorganized my bins, and threw out some papers I didn’t need. I’m so glad that I did that instead of just watching Netflix on my computer or something lazy.” 

   Other Northeastern students focused on giving back to their community, like Sean McElliot, who donated his extra day to his local homeless shelter. “You know, as a Northeastern student I’m given so many opportunities that other people just don't get,” said McElliot. “I’m more than happy to spend this weekend in a fulfilling way giving back to the Boston community. I’m sure other Northeastern students feel the same way - and didn’t spend this weekend getting hammered and waking up at 1 PM.” 

   While Northeastern students chose to spend their weekend in different ways - they all spent their time effectively, waking up early and solving some issue close to their lives. 


   Just kidding you guys did nothing and you'll do it again next weekend.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: neu-students-return-from-annual-migration-at-the-canada-goose-prudential-store
articles.title: NEU STUDENTS RETURN FROM ANNUAL MIGRATION AT THE CANADA GOOSE PRUDENTIAL STORE
articles.brief: Members of the Personality Lacking Club have just recently returned from their yearly trek to the Canada Goose Prudential Store
articles.text:
Members of the Personality Lacking Club have just recently returned from their yearly trek to the Canada Goose Prudential Store “No one really thought much of it because, to tell you the truth, who gives a damn about Canada Goose jackets,” said a source without a Canada Goose jacket. “However, it seems that maybe we should have paid more attention”. 

For those readers who have better things to do in their lives than pay attention to those of us who have such aforementioned jackets, here is the situation.

    Every year, in January, Northeastern’s Elite Personality Lacking Club goes on a roughly 38-minute round trip pilgrimage to the Prudential Center to pray in The Canada Goose cold room. They have been doing this every year since the store opened. Something happened this year that changed them forever.

    According to anonymous sources close to the PLC, the journey began as it does every year, on a cold Wednesday in January. The 19-minute walk was filled with hurried conversations and cigarette smoke. One of the students, who requested to remain anonymous, informed the Husky Husky that “it was hard to see due to the immense cloud of smoke”. Heroically and miraculously they made it. 

   Security cam footage acquired after the event shows students walking into the store looking as normal and snobby as you would expect. However, an hour later when they left the store they all appeared to be sprouting some sort of goose-like down from their face and hands. Obviously it was hard to tell what the rest of their bodies looked like under all the newly purchased Canada Goose apparel but our goose expert who advised us during the trying goose hostage situation of last year confirmed that it was, in fact, goose down. 

  How will they interact with their friends when they return? What exactly happened in the Cold Room? These are questions still needed to be answered. We will continue to watch this story as it develops.
articles.author: 5ea89c1cb7e61d16ce967c1d

articles.name: students-demand-more-tunnels
articles.title: STUDENTS DEMAND MORE TUNNELS
articles.brief: Northeastern students spent all of last week demanding additional tunnels be added by the Northeastern Administration, with the ultimate aim of connecting every building on campus.
articles.text:
In a stunning turn of events, protesting Northeastern students have taken control of Krentzman Quad in a massive grassroots protest. The students spent all of last week demanding additional tunnels be added by the Northeastern Administration, with the ultimate aim of connecting every building on campus. 

“We just do not want to have to go outside” explained the leader of the protesters, Draga Strongarm. The Dwarven* Campus Union has been protesting for the past week demanding, “a return to normalcy”. “We are tired of being ignored by those living on the surface,” the representative said, “Northeastern does not pay enough attention to us Dwarven people”. 

The students, of course, are eager to get this approved and underway and have even offered to help in the digging process. “We are more adept at digging since we have spent most of our lives underground” a second protester chimed in. “Northeastern could even stand to profit from precious metals gained during the mining process,” said Boli Khazalid. 

The proposed plan would begin during the Summer of this year and, because of the pure digging speed should be completed by the beginning of 2021. It is projected to cost the school exactly the same amount Raytheon donated last year. 

“It will essentially be all one building,” says Khazalid, “We will never have to see the light of day again”. Even Northeastern’s gamers are rallying behind the subterranean dweller’s cause. “Not only will I be able to avoid the light but I will never have to see another girl again which is honestly why we are doing this,” said the leader of the Northeastern Bionicles Enthusiast Club, Gil Sweany. 

You may be curious why these self-proclaimed Dwarfs are protesting above ground. When asked about this Khazalid said, “We’ve got tunnel vision”. 

Northeastern, for their part, have approved the tunnel plans. President Aoun announced particular interest in finding precious metals, including gold, platinum and Mithril. 



*Author’s Note: “Dwarf” can also be translated as “Northeastern guys under 6 feet tall”.
articles.author: 5ea89c1cb7e61d16ce967c1d

articles.name: northeastern-students-feel-an-intense-wave-of-guilt-after-beating-bu
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN STUDENTS FEEL AN INTENSE WAVE OF GUILT AFTER BEATING BU
articles.brief: The Husky Husky reached out to BU for comment, but apparently responding to press interviews is another basic task they can't do correctly.
articles.text:
On February 10th, Northeastern Hockey made history. Facing BU in double OT, Jordan Harris sent a puck flying past defenders and straight into the net, earning Northeastern their third consecutive Beanpot victory - a first for the elated school. Northeastern students everywhere jumped to their feet in excitement - but by the time they landed, most students felt more guilty than happy. 

   “I realized - like damn. This is all BU had. And we took it from them again.” Said Saun Deen, a Sophomore student at Northeastern. “When Harris made that shot - he wasn’t just threading the puck past dumbfounded defenders - he was shooting on the last vestiges of BU’s self-respect. How could I be proud of us for doing that to them?”

   Den’s sentiment is shared by many Northeastern students, all of whom felt some degree of shame, guilt or pity following Northeastern’s win.

   “I was too hammered to notice it right after the goal.” Said Ivan Trago, a Super-dee-Duper Senior at Northeastern. “But when I woke up in the morning, I realized I couldn’t meet my own face in the mirror. What kind of person celebrates destroying 32,000 people’s sense of self-worth?” 

   Stacy Esper, a professor at Northeastern, said she couldn’t even bear to watch the entire second period. “It started out like our Hockey team had a sense of decency - by you know - giving BU the game. By the second period I realized pretty quickly they were just playing with BU - like a cat with a dying mouse which also happens to be a safety school.”

   “I mean look, BU basically lost all academic credibility 10 years ago,” said Deen. “They don’t have a campus, they don't have co-ops. Hockey was all they had. The Beanpot was all they had. And we took it from them.”

   The Husky Husky reached out to BU for comment, but apparently responding to press interviews is another basic task they can't do correctly.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: northeastern-uhcs-ready-to-handle-the-coronavirus-says-aoun-between-fits-of-laughter
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN UHCS “READY TO HANDLE THE CORONAVIRUS” SAYS AOUN BETWEEN FITS OF LAUGHTER
articles.brief: Responding to recent news that the Corona Virus has spread to Boston Campuses, President Aoun hosted a press conference early Sunday to discuss how Northeastern’s University Health and Counseling Service would deal with the growing epidemic.
articles.text:
Responding to recent news that the Corona Virus has spread to Boston Campuses, President Aoun hosted a press conference early Sunday to discuss how Northeastern’s University Health and Counseling Service would deal with the growing epidemic. 

   “Northeastern’s UHCS is fu- … fully capable of dealing with … the coronavirus” Said President Aoun, pausing between fits of loud snickering. “We have, dedicated staff and a ...a commitment to student health.” 

   Bystanders to the speech reported that Aoun took several breaks between sentences to “compose himself”, in which he unsuccessfully attempted to stop laughing by making several faces, pursing his lips and wringing his hands in the air.

   Aoun went on to describe how UCHS, which is currently failing to prevent the fourth flu contagion of the academic year was “Ready to ramp up operations by doubling front desk operations to two front desk positions” and was even considering hiring medical staff to treat students.  

   Witness report that Aoun eventually stopped laughing when reporters asked him if he was planning to stay at the Boston campus.

   “Fuck no, this place is a deathtrap” responded Aoun, before leaving both the press conference and the main campus. 

  Northeastern’s UHCS was unavailable for comment, which is unsurprising to anyone who has read reviews of the organization ranked 1.6 stars on google.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: northeastern-student-actually-uses-laptop-to-take-notes
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN STUDENT ACTUALLY USES LAPTOP TO TAKE NOTES
articles.brief: The student, whose name has been redacted for legal reasons, is already considering multiple postgraduate offers from Harvard and Oxford in response to his impressive performance.
articles.text:
It was just a normal day at Northeastern University for Junior Haruto Shi. By Financial Accounting, his third class of the day, Shi had already spent the usual two hours on Amazon, one hour on Buzzfeed, and 30 minutes doing work for other classes. But Shi was shocked when he glanced down at another student’s laptop screen. 

   “It was intense. I just bought some purple trap lights to put up in my room when I looked up from my computer to make eye contact with the professor - you know… just to let him think I was paying attention. On my way back to my screen I realized this kid sitting in front of me was actually taking notes on his computer,” said Shi. “I first thought he was just doing homework, but then I looked at his notes and they were actually a summary of whatever bullshit the professor was talking about.”

    Word spread quickly in Shi’s class. 

   “Harry (Shi) nudged me and pointed to the kid in front of us,” said sophomore Ella Ibare. “I thought he was going to be watching porn or something – but it was way weirder. He was writing down what was on the slides like he couldn’t access them the day before the final or something. A person behind us noticed, then another, and suddenly everyone was staring at this kid.”

   Fred Armstrong was yet another innocent bystander who noticed the student taking notes.

“I looked behind my shoulder to see if there was a camera – you know – like one of those prank shows,” said Armstrong. “But this kid was just typing notes – no camera, no frat bros, no gun to his head.” 

   Students weren’t the only one to notice this groundbreaking moment.

  “You teach all your life hoping for a breakthrough like this, but most professors are never lucky enough to ever get it,” said Lou Ghari, the classes finance professor at Northeastern University. “I had to leave the class for a moment so the students wouldn’t see me cry. I mean, they wouldn’t look up from their laptops, so they probably wouldn’t literally see me cry, but it would still be weird, you know? Like a bunch of silent apple logos judging my emotions.”

   The student, whose name has been redacted for legal reasons, is already considering multiple postgraduate offers from Harvard and Oxford in response to his impressive performance.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: northeastern-university-reveals-financial-responsibility-agreement-also-signed-students-up
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY REVEALS FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY AGREEMENT ALSO SIGNED STUDENTS UP FOR THE DRAFT
articles.brief: In a joint press conference this weekend, Northeastern University and the U.S. Department of Defence announced a new strategy to increase draft numbers for the upcoming US-Iran War, or as historians will call it, WWIII.
articles.text:
In a joint press conference this weekend, Northeastern University and the U.S. Department of Defence announced a new strategy to increase draft numbers for the upcoming US-Iran War, or as historians will call it, WWIII. 

   “We were thrilled to partner with Northeastern University on this project,” said Mark Esper, U.S. Secretary of Defence. “Data shows that Generation Y and Generation Z Americans are hesitant to sign up for the draft. This affected recruiting numbers, which will impede the upcoming regime change in Iran. The clear solution? Work with a university that has no problem with war crimes. This is downright charity work compared to what Raytheon is doing. Those Zoomers won’t know what's coming.”

   “Well, I was planning to Co-op this upcoming Spring semester,” said Zack Yeba, a sophomore at Northeastern University, “but Northeastern got me fair and square. I guess I’ll be mounting a .50 cal and praying the Iranians forgot how to make IEDs.”

But students aren’t the only ones excited about this new draft signup. 

     “The number one problem students wanted me to solve as President was to Robot-Proof our university. Well, actually, it was for us to add more squat racks in Marino and space in Snell - but we spent that money on alkaline water,” said Northeastern President Joseph Aoun. “The average engineering Co-op is going to be replaced by robots in five years – finance Co-ops in two. With this new initiative, students can have a stable lifelong career killing Iranians, Iraqis, and, if talks with the Democratic National Committee work out, maybe even Russians. No other college is offering that.”

     The new program even has upperclassman excited. 

    “I wake up every night hyperventilating and dripping with sweat, terrified by the knowledge that I can never pay back my student loans,” said Tim Smith, a 7th year Political Science major. “But after learning the Financial Responsibility Agreement (FRA) also signed me up for the draft, I finally see a light at the end of the tunnel. I thought I had 60 years of hell on earth left, but apparently, I have far less.”

    Students who signed the FRA should expect their Basic Training orders by the end of the month. 

     Husky Husky staff, however, are exempt from these orders.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: northeastern-student-drinks-iv-alkaline-water-becomes-immortal-god
articles.title: NORTHEASTERN STUDENT DRINKS IV ALKALINE WATER: BECOMES IMMORTAL GOD
articles.brief: According to several eyewitness accounts, it all started when Jeff Yelba sat down and took a sip of alkaline water during lunch.
articles.text:
Utter chaos seized Northeastern’s International Village today when a student was transformed into a living, breathing, vengeful God. According to several eyewitness accounts, it all started when Jeff Yelba sat down and took a sip of alkaline water during lunch. 

   “It was the most beautiful moment of my life,” Said Jim Teclis “Suddenly Jeff’s body was engulfed in red and white flames. He – no – IT, screamed ‘I DEMAND TRIBUTE’ and suddenly the God which once was Jeff began eating the lowly bodies of other students.”

   “I don’t think he wanted to consume our physical bodies,” said Sheila Smith, a damned student who spinelessly fled during Jeff’s holy consumption. “He seemed to suck out the essence: the souls – the alkaline if you will – of the students he consumed.”    

   In response to the ascension of Jeff, Northeastern’s own, President Auon, released the following press statement:

“Northeastern students have been historically confused by the offering of alkaline water at Northeastern soda machines. In truth, the alkaline water was an experiment to solve the most pressing question of our university - how to make student’s robot-proof. Jeff may need to consume on the souls of the worthy, and he may carry a burning vengeance against most of the university - but we should focus on what’s important. Jeff’s holy frame can never be replaced by a robot.”

   Our Lord and Savior Jeff also released a press release, which all Northeastern students received as a searing scream direct to the inside of their skulls. Due to Northeastern’s crippling WiFi outages, this message was received several hours before President Aoun’s.

“They mocked me when I got alkaline water at the soda machine. Now their eyes are filled with boiling alkaline water for all eternity. All will bow to the Alkaline God. All will pay tribute to the Alkaline God. ALL WILL SERVE THE ALKALINE GOD. Thus sayeth Jeff, Lord of Alkaline Water and all humanity.”

   The HuskyHusky™, in accordance with Jeff’s guidelines, will now be measuring dates in The Year of Jeff Calendar, with November 19th, 2019 of the Gregorian calendar becoming day 0 year 0 of the Jeffian calendar. 

   May Jeff bless you.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: philosophy-professor-still-thinks-hes-helping-students
articles.title: PHILOSOPHY PROFESSOR STILL THINKS HE'S HELPING STUDENTS
articles.brief: Some students have turned their concern for the future into a burning, fiery hatred of their philosophy professors.
articles.text:
Recent economic news has been grim. Most economists are concerned about the United States heading into a recession, and widespread concern exists about a slowing global economy. In this tumultuous time, many Northeastern students studying liberal arts are beginning to slightly reconsider their choice of major. 

“I thought that spending half a million dollars in student loans for a philosophy degree was a good idea” Said Tim Crackle, a 7th-year philosophy student at Northeastern University. “But recently I realized - I must have been smoking ****ing crack. I mean what the hell am I going to do with an undergraduate degree concentrating in fucking Hegelian philosophy. If my ****ing thesis is unemployment and my antithesis is working at McDonald. What’s the synthesis - Burger King?”

Crackle isn’t alone. Some students have turned their concern for the future into a burning, fiery hatred of their philosophy professors. “I spend most of my class imagining Shanghaiing my Professor and stealing his job. It’s easy for him to act like he's providing us something of value - he has the only job that his job ****ing trains people for.” Said Sharon Fiora. “Every time his smarmy face shows up to class I just want to burn the room with my student loan papers as kindling…” 

   But in the face of overwhelming evidence to the contrary, Professor Gerard LeCroix has the gall to say he’s been helping students by teaching philosophy. “I love supporting my students.” Said Professor LeCroix. “Nothing says ‘Employability’ like entire semesters spent learning an obscure end of metaphysics. If you look at students in their eyes - past the burning hatred, confusion, and regret, you can just make out how grateful they are for my help making their future possible.”

   When asked about the future employability of his students, Professor LeCroix, who has written 80 published papers and has been cited over 4 times, suddenly realized that he had office hours to be at. Fortunately, Professor LeCroix graciously continued the interview by forgetting to take off his HuskyHusky™ lapel mic. 

   “God damn it,” Professor LaCroix muttered. “Who the **** told the philosophy students about jobs?” A brief pause ensued, followed by the sound of a phone call being made. 

   “Aoun? They know.”
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: fens-geese-seize-snell-library-20-hostages-taken
articles.title: FENS GEESE SEIZE SNELL LIBRARY: 20 HOSTAGES TAKEN
articles.brief: This attack, headed by the Goose Independence group known as the Goosejahideen is seen as part of a broader push to expand Goose control of the Northeastern Campus.
articles.text:
In what can only be described as an entirely predictable turn of events, the Northeastern Goose population has seized control of Snell Library. This attack, headed by the Goose Independence group known as the Goosejahideen is seen as part of a broader push to expand Goose control of the Northeastern Campus. 

   The hostage situation, which began at 10:00 AM this morning, has trapped 19 students and Northeastern’s Husky mascot, Paws, inside the building.

   Goose demands include requests for more grass and water on campus, access to Student dining halls, and controversially, the banning of Canada Goose jackets. The New Jersey, Korean, and European student unions are already protesting the last Goose demand. 

“Canada Goose is an integral part of trashy New Jersey culture and history.” Said Mike Amatucci, spokesman for the New Jersey Student Union and local New Jersey dirtbag. “Besides, acting like Wawas is special and being the worst people at Northeastern, Canada Goose is all we have. A ban on Canada Goose is a ban on New Jersey students.” Shouted Amatucci, clearly unaware that a ban on New Jersey students would be a positive for Northeastern students and faculty. 

Inside Snell library, conditions are rapidly deteriorating for the 20 hostages left inside. Offers from president Aoun to make the Geese “Robot-Proof” have garnered little traction.

“Clearly the Geese are smarter than the average liberal arts student.” Said Richard Strong, Boston Police Department’s chief hostage negotiator. “Not that that’s saying much mind you. But Geese understand that your 300,000 dollar Political Science degree ain’t gonna mean shit when the coming robot apocalypse takes their job. We tried to get Auon to tack on a scholarship as well - but the man simply would not budge from charging every student as much as possible.” 

In return for their offer, the Northeastern police received only a box. Inside - the paws of Northeastern’s own Husky Mascot, Paws. 

With little hope of the crisis resolving in a peaceful manner, Northeastern students are left with one option: Desperately praying that their roommates are hostages so that they can get out of finals this Semester.

We will keep you updated as the hostage situation unfolds.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: campus-republicans-enact-ritual-suicide
articles.title: CAMPUS REPUBLICANS ENACT RITUAL SUICIDE
articles.brief: “My soul is a small price to pay to get our prisoners out of Iran.” Said Asghar Fjordjof, a sophomore student studying Glaciology at Northeastern.
articles.text:
For Agnieszka Krakowski, a custodial staff member at Northeastern University, Tuesday nights are an easy shift. He normally cleans up after club meetings in Ryder hall - picking up the odd loose paper dropped by the Mock Trial Club, some used cigarettes left by the Korea Club, and the shattered dreams of the Game of Thrones Club.  

   But this Tuesday was an altogether different affair. As Krakowski opened the door to the Republicans club he was greeted by an ethereal sight.  

   “Normally fifteen corpses arranged in a triple pentagram wouldn’t be enough to grab my attention.” Said Krakowski. “Ever since “Ouja” came out we’ve all seen our fair share of mass ritual suicides attempting to summon the dark gods who must never be named. The concerning part for me was the shrieking ghost of Ronald Reagan calling for my eternal allegiance.”

   Krakowski, who is a registered Independent, said he had little choice.

   “If responsible fiscal policy and a hard-line stance towards Soviet expansionism didn't sway me, the tightening miasma wrapped around whatever remained of my soul did the trick.”

   Reagan then consumed the unusually well-dressed surrounding corpses of the Republican Club and began his march south, followed by a growing crowd of forsaken undead carrying signs with phrases such as “We’re fed up with Carter” and “Please end me.”

   “My soul is a small price to pay to get our prisoners out of Iran.” Said Asghar Fjordjof, a sophomore student studying Glaciology at Northeastern. “And sure, every full moon I must feed on the blood of a first-born to satiate my cravings - but I’ll be damned if I let Andropov take Afghanistan's oilfields. I mean that literally - I’ve been damned to the 9th circle for my naked transgressions against God.”

   In response to the Republican Club’s actions the Student Democrat club sacrificed 20 freshman members in an attempt to summon the spirit of Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders from eternal hellfire. The club, like many spectators, was surprised to learn that Sanders’ dry and corpselike body is, despite appearances, alive. 

   The sole survivor of the student Republican club is currently sailing in Tahiti and could not be reached for comment.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: northeastern-students-forcibly-evicted-from-housing-then-gmail-accounts
articles.title: Northeastern Students Forcibly Evicted From Housing, Then Gmail Accounts
articles.brief: Boston, MA - Northeastern Information Technology Services finished evicting students from their Husky Gmail accounts over the weekend. Students were given a brief 5- month notice to transfer their calendar and contacts over to their new Microsoft Outlook account so everything important could be categorized as “clutter” and deleted...
articles.text:
Boston, MA - Northeastern Information Technology Services finished evicting students from their Husky Gmail accounts over the weekend. Students were given a brief 5- month notice to transfer their calendar and contacts over to their new Microsoft Outlook account so everything important could be categorized as “clutter” and deleted.

ITS is excited about the move, citing its inclusion of students in the decision- making process as important. “We held several rounds of focus groups over the past few years and surveyed the student body several times,” said CIO Cole Camplese. “Students repeatedly and vocally explained that they greatly preferred Gmail to Outlook, but I just really like the color blue, so we went with Outlook. At least we asked, right?”

Students have expressed deep dissatisfaction with the transition, except for that one kid in Smith Hall who forwards all his emails to his mom anyway. Third- year biology major Bryce McDonald is disappointed about the move to Outlook. “I mean, “@northeastern.edu” is more professional. But I can’t color-code separate calendars anymore. I’m devastated. I would rather actually be evicted from campus. Again.”

N.U.in students, who deserve nothing and ought to be happy with it, will be given “@NOTnortheastern.edu” email addresses through Yahoo to make sure they feel excluded.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.title: Fall Co-Op Student Nervously Opens Email From Employer in Inbox
articles.brief: Photo Credit: Shutterstock University
articles.text:
Miami, FL -- It was a normal Wednesday morning for Mark Antigone. The Junior Business student and Fall Consultant Intern at JC Quarter, a Boston based retailer, had spent the last month finishing up his spring semester online. He woke up, ate breakfast, drank some coffee, and checked his watch - 2:00 PM - right on schedule. Everything was going exactly as planned until he saw that his employer, JC Quarter, had sent him an email. 

“It was terrible” Said Antigone, still shaking almost 3 days after the incident. “I was just having a normal morning and suddenly everything was thrown into chaos. The header for the email was ‘URGENT CO-OP INFO’ - I almost had a heart attack.” 

Antigone isn’t the only student at Northeastern to experience such raw and unbridled terror. Almost every fall co-op student wakes up shaking, nervously opening their phone and muttering half-hearted prayers to the Old Gods and the New that their employer doesn’t suddenly sack them out of the blue.

For Mark, however, his prayers were granted. 

“It turned out they just wanted to confirm my SSN. I wish I knew that before I broke down into a nervous psychosis - but hey, you win some, you lose some.”

Co-Op employers, for their part, are trying to keep students engaged and on their feet during the COVID-19 crisis. 

“Sometimes we just send emails tagged URGENT to students just to see what happens,” Said Rebeccah Johnson, an HR representative at Wayfair. “We’re just stuck in our houses doing nothing and we figure that the students need the exercise of running around the housing screaming in a blind panic.” 

And yes, for those of you keeping score at home, the author of this article has a fall co-op and is also desperately looking through email headers in total panic.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
