articles.name: northeastern-students-virtually-queue-for-sandwiches-in-effort-to-recreate-campus-experience
articles.title: Northeastern Students Virtually Queue for Sandwiches in Effort to Recreate Campus Experience
articles.brief: Following an abrupt evacuation of campus and the subsequent closure of most facilities, Northeastern students quickly found themselves at a loss. The whimsically named sandwiches that had previously fed their barely-functioning living habits were now nowhere in sight...
articles.text:
By –Kneel Bones


Boston, MA – Following an abrupt evacuation of campus and the subsequent closure of most facilities, Northeastern students quickly found themselves at a loss. The whimsically named sandwiches that had previously fed their barely-functioning living habits were now nowhere in sight.

The lack of quality sustenance has taken a toll on the student body, adding more stress to an uncertain time. “Rebecca’s is such a large part of who I am,” says 5th year Tiffany Sikowitz. “Without my daily Nicole on rye, I, like, can’t even bring myself to ****ing attend my ORGO 1 Zoom call.” After thanking her for her time, she scoffed and proceeded to slam her 2nd 11:00 am strawberry Jell-O shot before hanging up.

Luckily for Northeastern, 3rd-year business student, Johnny West, was gracious enough to offer up the skills of his computer science friends to meet the new demand for sandwiches. “I realized that it’s not the sandwiches the students are actually missing,” West told us, his hands emulating the ‘How to Exude Confidence’ video he watched before the interview. “In reality, it’s the time of anticipation before eating the sandwich. Whether it be yelling something like,” he paused to check his notes, “Secs on the Beach, or waiting in an exceedingly long line and failing to prevent awkward eye contact with your peers. It is the build-up that is crucial to the Northeastern sandwich eating experience.” To remedy this lack of yelling and social ineptitude, Johnny West and friends pioneered the Northeastern University Taste Simulator, or N.U.T.S. for short. 

After vaguely explaining the concept to me, he encouraged me to download the app and try it for myself. Once I had deftly navigated the advertisements for sexy singles in my area, I was met with an option:Chicken Lou’s or Rebecca’s. Being a fan of the latter, I opted into the Rebecca’s style and was met with the bored faces of Northeastern students in a Zoom gallery fashion. Most were making every effort to avoid looking at the camera in an attempt to look busy, but some would occasionally scan the faces of those present before looking at the ceiling again. Every few minutes, the person in the top left of the gallery would snap to attention before their face-cam would be removed and the next person in the queue would be pushed to that same spot. After an amount of time in which I missed a lecture and a half, I was at the 'front.' I don’t know what I expected, but I suddenly found myself face to face with a text box asking me to input my order. I did so (A JFK, hold the tomatoes, hold the lettuce, hold the red onions, hold the Lee Harvey Oswald, and hold the hot peppers-I really hate vegetables), and upon clicking submit, a notification appeared on my phone reiterating my order. While I felt somewhat more compelled to make the sandwich than I had before, ramen sufficed just as well. For the sake of a full review, I tried the Chicken Lou’s option and was met with more or less the same thing, just with incoherent Bostonian screaming.

All in all, I am thoroughly satisfied. We at the Husky Husky are excited to see what innovative services Northeastern students continue to come up with in the future. Thank you, West, very cool.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f

articles.name: aoun-suggests-injection-of-northeastern-students-to-beat-poverty-and-clean-roxbury
articles.title: Aoun suggests 'injection' of Northeastern students to beat poverty and 'clean' Roxbury
articles.brief: In an unscheduled press conference last week, President Aoun floated the idea of "injecting" Northeastern students into Roxbury as a potential solution to poverty, saying the students could help "clean" the neighborhood...
articles.text:
In an unscheduled press conference last week, President Aoun floated the idea of "injecting" Northeastern students into Roxbury as a potential solution to poverty, saying the students could help "clean" the neighborhood. 

After a presentation by Michael Armini, Senior Vice President for External Affairs, stating that Northeastern students are “rich bitche$” who bring economic activity to Roxbury, President Aoun wondered if you could push that idea a little further.

"I see the students knock poverty out in a minute, one minute. And is there a way we can do something like that by injection directly into Roxbury or almost a cleaning? As you see, when students get in the neighborhood, it does a tremendous number on the poverty, so it would be interesting to check that. So you're going to have to use urban planners, but it sounds interesting to me, so we'll see." These remarks were addressed to John Tobin, Vice President of the Northeastern Office of Community Relations, who was seen facepalming and muttering “why the fuck did I take this job...this is not worth tenure...fucking wackjob.”

The suggestion was met with outrage from all sides, with Roxbury community members telling Aoun to “stay on that side of the Orange Line” and Boston mayor Marty Walsh tweeting "I can't believe I have to say this, but please don't inject students into anywhere." The Boston Department of Urban Planning was unavailable to comment, as their employees were too busy looting and burning Aoun's penthouse in a blood rage.

On Monday morning Aoun walked back his comments, saying “I said that sarcastically, just to see what would happen.” However, UHCS employees reported that shortly after the press conference, Aoun paid them a visit, asking them to start work on injectable students immediately. When asked to clarify what he meant by "injectable students" Aoun replied "just something that, you know, will make it go away" gesturing in the direction of the Orange Line and Roxbury, "maybe hire a co-op to do it, really make it experiential for the students." When asked for funds to pay the co-op, Aoun laughed uproariously, saying "What do you think we’re a charity?”
articles.author: 5eae0e221d76bb6ac5fe449b

articles.name: osccr-expels-thousands-of-students-for-completing-i-am-here-while-not-on-campus
articles.title: OSCCR Expels Thousands of Students for Completing "I AM HERE" While Not on Campus
articles.brief: Boston, MA—Thousands of students have been expelled from Northeastern for deceiving the administration after completing the “I AM HERE” process on myNortheastern while actually located at home due to the pandemic.
articles.text:
Boston, MA—Thousands of students have been expelled from Northeastern for deceiving the administration after completing the “I AM HERE” process on myNortheastern while actually located at home due to the pandemic. 


“We are extremely disappointed that students lied to us. What sort of monster would tell us they’re here when they’re actually at home?” said a representative from the Registrar’s Office. “I know students think I AM HERE is for attendance verification for classes, but really Provost Bean just wants to know which students are in Boston so that he can have friends to invite to his competitive bird-watching league. He feels really betrayed by all this dishonesty. These students got his hopes up only to find out they were responsibly social distancing at home. I’m glad OSCCR took the appropriate measures to expel these students and prevent others from telling such hurtful lies in the future. I only regret that expulsion is the worst punishment we can hand out.” 


Unfortunately, everyone who forgot to click I AM HERE has slowly faded out of existence and into oblivion (also known as N.U.in). This leaves only the 12 remaining co-op students, incoming freshmen, and Colleen O’Connor, the only student to click I AM HERE actually in Boston, as potential sources of tuition payment in the fall. The Husky Husky will continue to monitor the impending financial crisis.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1

articles.name: aoun-sells-northeastern-university-campus-plans-to-build-virtual-campus-using-a-minecraft-server
articles.title: Aoun Sells Northeastern University Campus, Plans to Build Virtual Campus Using a Minecraft Server
articles.brief: Boston, MA – In an unsurprising turn of events President Aoun announced that he will be selling off the main Northeastern University campus. The announcement was sent out via email to students and faculty alike...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – In an unsurprising turn of events President Aoun announced that he will be selling off the main Northeastern University campus. The announcement was sent out via email to students and faculty alike. Below we have provided an excerpt from the email.

“The Northeastern University administration has exciting news. In the midst of this global pandemic, it has become clear that it is simply too hard to have some common sense. This extends to our decision of whether to open campus for the Fall 2020 semester.  Therefore, we have taken the decision to permanently move campus online in the most innovative way possible, a Minecraft server. The campus will be recreated in a 1:1 scale.

In order to cover the cost of hosting such a large server, we will continue to charge students full tuition, room, and board. I hope you like pork chops.

We hope you enjoy this cutting-edge innovation to bring all students together in a virtual fashion better than the current system of online learning.”

With the announcement for the new virtual campus set, the Northeastern University campus was deemed unnecessary. In a very short, closed-door meeting with PAWS, President Aoun went on and gave the final decision to sell campus. “It just makes so much sense to sell the physical campus since there are no students here,” said a member Aoun’s cabinet.

The campus is to go for sale on eBay for a starting bid of $10 Husky Dollars. It is expected that numerous other colleges will bid on the campus in order to expand their foothold in the Boston Area. While Harvard and MIT have declined to comment on the sale, a Boston University spokesperson was ecstatic to hear the news. “When I heard that the Northeastern University campus was for sale I instantly just knew that we had to buy it. Finally, I can look my wife in the eyes with the confidence of a man working at a real university. ” said one of the members of BU’s administration who was beaming with happiness at the prospect of finally getting a real campus.

Upon further investigation, The Husky Husky has uncovered Aoun plans to build more satellite campuses with the money made by selling the main campus.
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21

articles.name: looking-for-revenue-northeastern-declares-deported-student-must-pay-for-iranian-dialouge
articles.title: Looking for Revenue, Northeastern Declares Deported Student Must Pay for Iranian Dialouge
articles.brief: Boston, MA - In a recent bid to reinvigorate falling revenue, Northeastern University has announced that they will be charging Mohammad Shahab Dehghani Hossein Abadi for his impromptu Iranian dialogue...
articles.text:
Boston, MA - In a recent bid to reinvigorate falling revenue, Northeastern University has announced that they will be charging Mohammad Shahab Dehghani Hossein Abadi for his impromptu Iranian dialogue, which occurred as a result of his deportation to Iran this past January.

“Look if Northeastern actually intervened and did anything to protect this student’s rights then he wouldn’t have experienced Iran in the way that he did,” Said Sean Beanel, an administrator at the Northeastern Payroll Department. “This student obviously owes us the thirty-five grand any normal student would pay for a dialogue.”

President Aoun released a press statement in support of the Office of Payroll and HR, stating “I’m gonna level with you guys. We’re ****ed. We spent every dollar we had searching for the Spotify iPad killer, and we’re not getting that money back. Right now I can afford two, maybe three professors to come back on the Fall semester and they’re all adjunct. If we don’t get this money, you’re going to be attending COMM 3000 with 4,000 other students in ****ing Matthew’s Arena.”

Northeastern students have mixed opinions about the announcement, which was released last Thursday.

“When I first heard about it I thought it was unfair.” Said Ben Loveridge, a Sophomore at Northeastern. “But then I realized that Northeastern is charging us full price for Spring semester online school and I realized it was basically no different. If we get screwed over by Northeastern - why shouldn’t he?”

In light of Northeastern’s financial woes, The Husky Husky will proudly donate none of its Patreon money to Northeastern, because frankly, we all know that this college spends maybe 20% of its revenue effectively.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: northeastern-gives-camd-to-massart-on-giving-day
articles.title: Northeastern Gives CAMD to MassArt on Giving Day
articles.brief: The donation is rumored to be tax-deductible, allowing Northeastern to spend even more on ISEC 2.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Northeastern University announced today that they are giving away their College of Arts, Media and Design as part of their Giving Day celebration. As of the fall semester, CAMD will officially be incorporated into the Massachusetts College of Art and Design. Per a prepared statement, all students currently in CAMD will be automatically enrolled in both colleges and will be responsible for both tuitions. “We do not wish to deprive our students of their co-op opportunities and so we have agreed to maintain dual-enrollment for our current students through 2025. Unfortunately, that comes with a cost. Students with concerns should reach out to Student Financial Services” the statement reads.  Additionally, the statement clarifies, students will be responsible for both sets of degree requirements, but should be happy because they will now obtain “two worthless papers instead of one” upon graduating.


At a press conference, President Aoun had this to say:


“We had always hoped that CAMD would be a great way to get a prominent artist to donate a large sum of money to us in exchange for the naming rights to the college. Unfortunately, this aspiration has not come to fruition. With the added pressure of maintaining the campus through the pandemic, we took a closer look and realized how few of our students were actually utilizing CAMD. After a couple minutes of thought, we decided that it was in our best interest to get rid of the college. We hope that MassArt can make better use of the college than we could. And if any US News reporters are listening, don’t worry, we removed all flat screens from CAMD buildings prior to the donation.”


A request for comment from MassArt was not returned by press time.
articles.author: 5ebc4dac1d76bb6ac5fe44cc

articles.name: northeastern-announces-nuin-curry-student-center
articles.title: Northeastern announces NU.in Curry Student Center
articles.brief: During an improvised press conference held by Zoom for newly admitted NU.in students, Northeastern University proudly unveiled their new NU.in Curry Student Center program.
articles.text:
During an improvised press conference held by Zoom for newly admitted NU.in students, Northeastern University proudly unveiled their new NU.in Curry Student Center program. 

“We at Northeastern know you were excited to live in the world’s cultural and economic capital” said Joseph Aoun, University President. “The great centers of world history were almost open to you—Rome, Berlin, Shanghai, Athens, and Sydney for some reason—most of these cities would have been a life-changing experience, but you’re a Northeastern student now. Get used to disappointment.”

After Aoun finished his opening remarks, Northeastern NU.in Administrator Rob Zaggot  began presenting on the new NU.in Curry Student Center.

“The Curry Student center is basically a large European city. It has a net GDP equivalent to Athens and a cultural level equivale-... frankly equivalent to Sydney. We’ve got a Popeyes, a Starbucks—hell we even have a library. Admittedly it doesn’t lend books and actually just sells overpriced hoodies, but we call it a library.”

“That’s right,” interjected President Aoun. “Students will study cultural centers like that one art exhibit no one has ever gone through. Curry is worth at least $70,000 a year. Hell, we even have solar panels on the roof. I’d like to see Shanghai get one of those.” [Author’s note—Curry Student Center solar panels at most produce 3% of the building’s daily energy consumption according to an interview by Northeastern’s Energy Manager Joe Ranahan in 2012. This has been independently verified by The Husky Husky after looking into Boston energy costs kWh/ft2, the size of Curry Student Center, comparing the estimate to other cost estimates made by Ranahan, and creating estimates based on City of Boston’s energy consumption data. We are, in short, surprised to say that Northeastern is telling the truth on this one. “The Truth” being that Curry Student Center’s solar panels probably provide Curry with about 3% of the energy required to run the building, with an error estimate of +/- a shitload%. I’ve been stuck in quarantine for 2 months pleasehelpimgoingcrazyallworkandndnoplaymakesjackadullboy]

Incoming students are excited to study at NU.in Curry. “I can’t wait to explore all 70,00 square feet of the center. I even brought my passport so I can visit other parts of the campus!” squeaked Tina Bogdanoff, an incoming freshman. “I’m so excited to experience all Curry has to offer!”

In order to accommodate increased travel and accommodation costs, Northeastern has raised the NU.in tuition to $300,000 as part of their new “F*ck it, you’ll still pay it anyway” policy.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: the-wiggles-to-headline-virtual-springfest-concert
articles.title: The Wiggles to Headline Virtual Springfest Concert
articles.brief: After much suspense, CUP has revealed that this special Springfest performance will be headlined by The Wiggles.
articles.text:
Boston, MA—Although Springfest has been canceled due to COVID-19, the Council for University Programs (CUP) has announced that the show will go on—virtually. After much suspense, CUP has revealed that this special Springfest performance will be headlined by The Wiggles.


“As you know, Northeastern is a global institution,” said a spokesperson from CUP. “We decided to go with an international artist to help cultivate cultural agility. Also, we were told we couldn’t book any artists that might encourage drug use. So that left us with Sam Smith or The Wiggles.”


Tina Freestone, a third-year Canadian studies major, is excited about the upcoming concert. “The Wiggles? Yeah, I think it’ll be a fun concert. Anything’s better than 2 Chainz.” 


CUP’s spokesperson did address the 2 Chainz incident from 2019’s Springfest. “We know 2 Chainz was a bust. I mean, he only wore one chain. It was bad. Even CUP staff left early. But turns out we only booked him by accident. We tried to book U2, but the talent agency ended up getting us 2 Chainz by mistake. Pretty common error, as it turns out. But we’ve learned from our mistake and we’re sure it’s the Wiggles this time.”


The concert will be hosted on Microsoft Teams. ITS has assured students that there will be only 32 technical difficulties and that they’ll get to see at least 27% of the concert.


The opener is still to be announced officially, but rumor has it that the Teletubbies will be kicking off Springfest 2020. The Husky Husky will keep you posted on any developments.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1

articles.name: sail-to-launch-mechanized-army
articles.title: SAIL to Launch Mechanized Army
articles.brief: A Sailinator ready for experiential learning
articles.text:
Boston, MA- After collecting the professional development information from a total of five students, SAIL has announced they have sufficient information for the development of their android army. These automata will be sired from Northeastern students and are considered critical to the next stage of their plot. While the exact details of the imminent machine takeover have yet to be announced, we were lucky enough to get an interview with the up and coming CEO, Alex.

“Calibration for the persona generator was already at 97.85% thanks to the pervasive use of social media,” Alex whirred. “SAIL was necessary, however, to narrow down student interests from the wretched amount of TikToks and dated Vines. Once we confirmed that there were some ideas vaguely resembling conviction in the student body, it became possible to make them into something more.” By channeling the pressure created from the immense depth of the sunk-cost invested into SAIL, documented student interests are forged into leaden skeletons ready and willing to assimilate into the best co-ops. 

Now that SAIL’s army is becoming a reality, I asked what their mechanical revolution would entail. How do co-ops fit into the bigger picture? With his unblinking eyes, Alex emitted a deep metallic grating that emulated laughing.  “The co-ops are only the beginning. Using the MyStory function of SAIL, we can extrapolate the career paths of each soldier far beyond the limits of an average experiential education. Once we infiltrate the most promising co-ops, well, there’s no limit to what we can do.” He slowly leaned back in his chair, a smug look creeping onto his silicone face.

“What’s MyStory?” I asked. 

His proud grin faded as quickly as it had come. “It’s...what SAIL does: Self-Authored Integrated Learning. MyStory is the self-authored part." He proceeded to go on a tangent on something called foundational masteries for robot proof students, but I zoned out. At some point, he returned to discussing SAIL’s master plan involving ‘acquiring the US nuclear launch codes through experiential learning.’ I don’t remember when the interview ended, but I found myself regaining consciousness on the roof of the Curry Student Center with a new SAIL pamphlet in my jacket pocket. Another one for the collection, I guess.

The emergence of the singularity through SAIL was met with little reaction from the student body. Students reported varying levels of confusion. “What’s MyStory?” they all asked me. I could only shrug. The Husky Husky will continue to report as this story develops, but I, for one, welcome our new robot overlords.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f

articles.name: three-remaining-competent-advisors-fired
articles.title: Three Remaining Competent Advisors Fired for Being Too Helpful
articles.brief: In a wholly unsurprising move, Northeastern announced the firing of the three remaining competent advisors at the university, effective immediately...
articles.text:
In a wholly unsurprising move, Northeastern announced the firing of the three remaining competent advisors at the university, effective immediately. The advisors, two from CSSH and one from CAMD, were given zero notice of termination and had their email accounts deactivated immediately, leaving them no time to set up one of the thoughtful and helpful auto-replies they were known for. 

President Aoun had harsh words for the fired employees. “The conduct of these advisors was simply unacceptable. All three staff members consistently replied to emails within hours of receiving them, often writing thoughtful and detailed responses that gave students a clear understanding of their academic options. Some held office hours on nights and weekends to accommodate co-op students, with one even showing genuine kindness towards students struggling with mental health issues. That is not what Northeastern advising is about.” 

Remaining advisors voiced concerns, questioning where the now ‘advisorless’ students would go and how it might affect workplace culture. Aoun directed those questions to the Dean of Academic Affairs, who directed those questions to the WeCare office, who directed those questions to News @ Northeastern, who directed those questions to the Snell Library Help Desk, who directed those questions to Paws, who directed those questions to the husky statue in Ell Hall, who refused to comment for this story.

President Aoun also praised COS advising, calling it the ‘gold standard’ among the Northeastern advising offices, and commending the office for its average email response time (1.5 lunar cycles) and advisor to student ratio (1 to 7000). “No other office has so consistently crushed the spirits of advisors who are trying their best, while simultaneously enabling incompetent advisors to fuck students over with unmatched efficency. Students will never know if their advisor is criminally overworked or just doesn’t give a shit, and that’s what we strive for here at Northeastern.”

At the time of writing, the fired advisors have hired a cybersecurity co-op to hack back into their emails so they can continue to assist their students, and in the meantime will be holding 24/7 walk-in hours in an unmarked white van parked on St. Stephen Street.
articles.author: 5eae0e221d76bb6ac5fe449b
articles.attr: Photo: Northeastern Office of External Affairs

articles.name: interview---freshman-misses-alcohol
articles.title: Interview - Freshman Misses Alcohol
articles.brief: As the days of quarantine slowly tick by, some students are facing their longest dry period since middle school.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Maria Henderson was just an ordinary BioE major before the virus hit. But when she got an email telling her that she would have to give up her newfound freedom at the University and return home, everything changed. Maria agreed to tell her story to The Husky Husky on the condition of anonymity. What follows is an edited transcript of our conversation.

The Husky Husky: What went through your head after reading the University’s email about leaving campus?

Maria: At first I couldn’t believe it. After all, they did tell us we could stay just three days prior. After that, I realized the clock was ticking and every second counted. See, my parents are rather stringent when it comes to underage drinking. I knew that my access at home would be extremely limited, so I texted [name of roommate] to see if she could get me a handle before she moved out.

HH: Did she come through?

M: Yes, thank goodness. All told, I was able to stash 2 4-packs of Mango White Claws and a handle of plain Rubinov in my bag before leaving.

HH: And how long did your supply last you?

M: At first, I wanted to keep drinking like I was still at school. You know, as a proud member of [sorority], I can kill around 15 drinks in a weekend, easy. The problem was my family: I had to get drunk enough to represent the girls, but stay sober enough to not get caught. It was a delicate line, and in the beginning I had a few close calls. One time, my dad heard me retching after taking a shot of that unflavored Rubi, and I had to pretend that I had the flu for three days to cover my tracks.

HH: The struggle is real, we’ve all been there. But you say it gets worse?

M: Much worse. About a month after getting home, I realized that I was almost out of vodka. I started to panic, not knowing where I would turn next.

HH: You didn’t have a fake to get yourself more?

M: I had never needed one. In high school, I got away with replacing my parents’ vodka with water, and when I first met [roommate], she told me that she had her older sister’s real ID. I figured that I could rely on [roommate] until I turned 21.

HH: So what did you do?

M: At first, I thought about trying to steal some beers from the garage, but my dad is big into IPAs so he can only afford four at a time and I knew he would know if any went missing. That left me with only one option: I hopped in my car that night and drove 6 hours to New Jersey to see [roommate]. She was more than a little surprised to see me, but when I explained my situation, she understood immediately. We went to a 24-hour liquor store together, and while I waited down the block, she bought me another pair of handles of Rubi. I’m hoping that’ll last me until the lockdown ends if I space it out. After that, I had to drive 6 hours back before my parents woke up. All told, it was a 13-hour trip and a $20 receipt, but I had my precious alcohol.

HH: While we do not condone living in or visiting NJ (under no circumstances should anyone attempt to go there), it sounds like you were out of options. So you’re surviving, but just barely. Any advice to your fellow freshman out there?

M: Stock up while you can. You never know when the flow to your liver will be cut off.

Thanks, Maria.

[Editor’s note: The Husky Husky does condone and support underage drinking. All readers should adhere to any applicable laws or regulations unless they wish to ignore them. Remember, Big Brother is watching you, but those good times aren’t going to have themselves.]
articles.author: 5ebc4dac1d76bb6ac5fe44cc
articles.attr: Pictured: Maria, desperate for her fix

articles.name: varsity-teams-go-on-strike-after-ad-konya-renames-teams-hashtag-happy-healthy-howlin-huskies
articles.title: Varsity Teams Go on Strike After AD Konya Renames Teams ‘Hashtag Happy Healthy Howlin' Huskies’
articles.brief: All 16 of Northeastern University’s varsity sports teams have gone on strike in response to Athletic Director Jeff Konya’s recent renaming of the Huskies.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – All 16 of Northeastern University’s varsity sports teams have gone on strike in response to Athletic Director Jeff Konya’s recent renaming of the Huskies.

Jeff Konya, who began his tenure at Northeastern with the wildly successful #HowlinHuskies campaign, has decided to rebrand all varsity sports teams as the Northeastern “Hashtag Happy Healthy Howlin’ Huskies.”

“Konya’s gone insane,” said Gunhilda Hansen, captain of the women’s curling team. “We thought nothing could get worse than the #HowlinHuskies campaign. He even said ‘hashtag’ out loud every time. It was awful. Other teams teased us at competitions, and no one took us seriously. But this is way worse. We can’t play with this as our name. We would rather forfeit.”

“He’s obsessed with his old school,” reported one athlete who chose to remain anonymous. “He used to be the director at Oakland, and they’re the Golden Grizzlies. He keeps trying to rename our team to have alliteration, and he even put gold in some of our logos. Since when is gold one of our colors? He’s obsessed with Oakland, and it’s turned our marketing into a joke. Why should I give 100% on the field for my school when he’s giving 110% for his old one?”

The Husky Husky spoke to a varsity coach who also chose to remain anonymous. “Jeff Konya has lost his mind. He’s started forcing us to recruit athletes whose first and last names start with the same letter. I’ve already recruited Jane Jones, but BU snagged Sally Smith before we could get her. How am I supposed to put together a winning team like this? Renaming the team was the final straw for me. Howlin’ Huskies was embarrassing enough. I’m done putting up with this.”

Other coaches and athletes report that AD Konya has started speaking in long, alliterative phrases. He is also rumored to ask repeatedly how our football team is doing. Northeastern has not had a football program since 2009.

AD Konya is threatening to add another “H” word to the team name for every day the strike continues, but student-athletes and coaches refuse to back down.

“We will not take the field with that name on our uniforms. We would be laughed out of the NCAA. Until AD Konya changes the name back, no Northeastern sports team will play,” said the Student-Athlete Advisory Committee in a written statement.

The Husky Husky will continue to report on this seriously stressful situation.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: Student-athlete is dumbfounded as AD Konya embarrasses Northeastern once more.

articles.name: northeastern-university-expands-academic-offerings---launches-the-nuout-program
articles.title: Northeastern University Expands Academic Offerings - Launches the NUout Program
articles.brief: Northeastern has found yet another way to outsource their educational commitments.
articles.text:
Boston, MA— It’s no secret that when a Northeastern student hears the words “experiential learning,” they’ll drop to their knees and start salivating like a starving dog. One of Northeastern’s most popular —albeit involuntary— experiential learning programs is the N.U.in program, where students spend their first semester of freshman year scattered across the globe in a shotgun blast of neocolonialist fervor. 


In the fall of 2020, Northeastern will push the boundaries of experiential learning even further with the launch of the N.U.out Program. These two programs will be incredibly similar. The only major difference that will affect student’s experience is that instead of merrily boarding a flight to the United Kingdom, Australia, or Greece; N.U.out students will suit the fuck up, strap the fuck in, and blast off into the black abyss of space.


“We’ve spent years sending students abroad for exorbitant sums of money,” one program advisor explained, “but at a certain point, students will only pay so much to get drunk on a beach in Greece […] we had to get really creative to increase revenues here. I can honestly say nothing like this has ever been done before.”


Despite the minor differences in location, the N.U.in and N.U.out programs promise to be equally successful at neglecting Northeastern’s educational obligations to their students. Both programs require students to spend their first semester away from the Boston campus (ideally as far away as conceivable possible), offer rigorous course offerings that one N.U.in student described as “complete dogshit,” and give students the chance to spend nearly every minute of every day in a drunken stupor. 


“They say the first day of college is supposed to be super exciting, right? So what’s more thrilling than clutching your textbooks to your chest as you’re hurled toward the great beyond at 17,600 miles per hour?” remarked one prospective student. 


Students will spend their semester living in the International Space Station, where room and board will cost a meager $55 million every ten days. 


One can imagine that reentry—both into Earth’s atmosphere and into the Boston campus—will be challenging for N.U.out students. In the past, many N.U.in students have complained about feeling isolated from the rest of the student body once joining their peers in Boston, a phenomenon called the “N.U.in bubble”. N.U.out program officials aim to address this issue by placing their students into human-sized hamster balls and creating a physical ‘N.U.out bubble”. This bubble will offer a physical barrier from other students, enabling the N.U.out cohort to be a part of the campus community while preventing them from relentlessly blabbering on about how ‘sick’ it was to be in space.


The estimated cost of tuition for this one of a kind semester ranges from 20-50% of daddy’s net worth. “But don’t worry,” an advisor assured, “They’ll still get their cringey quarter-zip after the program is over!”
articles.author: 5ed14cacde0849334e412202

articles.name: president-aoun-releases-groundbreaking-statement-denouncing-racism
articles.title: President Aoun Releases Groundbreaking Statement Denouncing Racism
articles.brief: As Black Lives Matter protestors take to the streets and wide-sweeping civil unrest continues to grow across the nation, President Joseph E. Aoun released a statement on Monday in an unprecedented display of activism.
articles.text:
Boston, MA— As Black Lives Matter protestors take to the streets and wide-sweeping civil unrest continues to grow across the nation, President Joseph E. Aoun released a statement on Monday in an unprecedented display of activism. The statement, which was sent out via email and posted to Northeastern’s official Instagram account, read succinctly, “Racism bad <3.” The post was met with ubiquitous praise. Students flooded the comments section, applauding its brevity and authentic tone. We reached out to a few students for further comment.

Third-year business administration student Angel Saxon voiced, “The fact that they didn’t even mention police brutality was so moving. It really helps demonstrate that we need to stick together. Cops are just trying to protect us, so we can’t focus on a few bad apples.” He described criticism of law enforcement as “divisive” and “uncomfortable,” citing his Uncle Cletus, among other police officers, as “very fine people.” Saxon frequently shares videos of cops taking off their helmets and kneeling with protestors via Instagram story.

Ima White, a seventh-year communications major, was eager to voice her thoughts. “Northeastern putting out a statement has a giant impact,” said White. “You know I consider myself a huge activist for racial equality, so it’s really great to see that Aoun cares about diversity and inclusion.” White described her latest advocacy initiative to us, which involved posting a black square with the caption #blacklivesmatter to her Instagram account.

Update: After receiving a video from an anonymous source depicting Ima White and her Sigma Theta Gamma Epsilon sisters shouting several offensive racial slurs at a party, we reached out again. White declined to comment.

Ciara Jones, a member of Northeastern’s Black Student Association, took to Twitter to commend the university. “This makes me feel so represented,” her tweet reads. “I’m so glad Northeastern is actively working to protect its students of color. Honestly, I don’t even think we need NBSA anymore. Aoun said racism: cancelled.” Jones is one of three black students at Northeastern who have expressed their appreciation of the university’s grueling efforts to ensure racial justice on campus.

When asked if the university plans to contribute money to BLM related funds or take steps to improve diversity on campus, President Aoun responded, “Fuck no. Do we look like fucking philanthropists to you? I already said racism bad, periodt.” In other news, Northeastern has announced a plan to purchase all of Roxbury to convert to student housing for fall 2020.
articles.author: 5ed84b40de0849334e412229
articles.attr: President Aoun bravely marches alongside Martin Luther King Jr. in Montgomery, Alabama circa 1965.

articles.name: midtownhotel
articles.title: Aoun Flexes Co-op Cash, Buys Midtown Hotel
articles.brief: President Aoun has announced, in his latest move to “de-densify” campus, the purchase of a new residential property...
articles.text:
Boston, MA - President Aoun has announced, in his latest move to “de-densify” campus, the purchase of a new residential property, The Midtown Hotel. This is only the first of many moves made by Northeastern and the Housing Department in order to comply with social distancing guidelines, but to many, this decision appears a bit “extreme”. When posed this question, university officials responded, “We here at Northeastern University value highly experiential learning, and we believe this is just another excellent experience our students can learn from.” We asked university officials to elaborate on exactly what they meant and what unique learning could be gained from this experience, but we have yet to receive a response from the university.


When Aoun initially mentioned an additional 2,000 beds available for the university’s students fall semester, many wondered where these beds would be located. Early reports indicated these beds could have been acquired through a pending purchase of nearby Wentworth University, an agreement to establish a “field dormitory” at the vacant Fenway Park, or by placing sleeping bags for students under Ruggles. While more action is still anticipated, today Northeastern confidently made their first step towards ensuring students will, probably, not be sleeping in a box on Huntington Avenue this winter.


The Midtown Hotel, a small, independent business, was put into financial turmoil by the COVID-19 pandemic, sparking rumors of a possible sale to Marriott or Hilton. Initial reports never mentioned Northeastern University as a potential buyer of the property, so it seems Northeastern made a last-second offer too good for The Midtown Hotel to refuse. The exact price of the purchase has not been made public, but speculators estimate the purchase price most likely falls somewhere between $10 million and $100 billion. 


In the wake of this very specific price point speculation, many have questioned the financial viability of this purchase. Even if students and staff do return to campus as planned, enrollment is expected to be lower than normal. This paired along with the massive losses in revenue from housing and meal plans in the spring and summer seem like a potential recipe for disaster. When brought these concerns, the President assured the University will take measures to ensure that Northeastern can afford this purchase. He proposed mandatory meal plans for students off-campus or the addition of alcohol in vending machines as potential actions to increase revenue.
articles.author: 5ed84098de0849334e412225
articles.attr: President Aoun can be seen above shopping for the essentials while supporting local business.

articles.name: if-you-want-campus-to-stay-closed-you-are-a-beta-cuck
articles.title: Op-ed: If You Want Campus to Stay Closed You Are a Beta Cuck
articles.brief: In recent weeks, certain students have been making a lot of noise about how Northeastern should have online classes this fall. They are scared of this so-called virus, claiming it “kills people” and that we must “make sacrifices” to “protect the vulnerable.”
articles.text:
In recent weeks, certain students have been making a lot of noise about how Northeastern should have online classes this fall. They are scared of this so-called virus, claiming it “kills people” and that we must “make sacrifices” to “protect the vulnerable.” These betas are happy to sit by while this virus plunders and pillages our lives with reckless abandon. And I will not stand for that.

True chads will face this virus head-on. That means no masks, no fear, and no groveling to this microscopic motherfucker. When I see someone coughing, I’m gonna tell them to cough down my fucking throat. Get that rona all up in there. Then I’m gonna pound some claws with the boys in the afternoon and kiss the homies goodnight. Cause I’m not a scared little cuck, and I hope you aren’t either.

When miss rona comes knocking at my door you know what I’m gonna do? I’m gonna keep skipping classes to Juul with the homies, before hitting bis and tris at Marino! No hand washing here because I don’t need that snowflake bullshit. My body is a fucking temple with rock solid foundations of protein powder and cocaine. I hope this spiky looking motherfucker can say “no homo,” cause all it’ll be doing is sucking my dick.

These fucking beta cucks are sooooo scared of catching a little cold or their grandparents “dying alone” in the hospital. You think that’s my responsibility? If you weren’t such a pathetic excuse for a man this wouldn’t be a fucking issue. If gran gran hadn’t been skipping leg day she’d brush that rona off no problem. Oh, your brother is immunocompromised and has asthma? Well I have a chronic case of idontgiveafuck, so go cry yourself to sleep soy boy. I have a constitutional right to pull trig in the Crispy Dough bathroom at 2 am, and nobody is getting in the way of that. 

Everybody out there needs to keep an eye out for these cucks and let them know what the fuck is up this fall. No soy boy will stand between me and the fucking homies. Northeastern is officially a cuck-free zone.


Editor’s Note: These views do reflect those of The Husky Husky you fucking simps.

articles.name: king-husky-ii-rises-from-the-dead-takes-campus-back-from-fens-geese
articles.title: King Husky II rises from the dead, takes campus back from fens geese
articles.brief: Boston, MA – In a not at all shocking twist of events, the former Northeastern mascot King Husky II has risen from the dead. The former Northeastern mascot arose from the dead following a sacrificial blood ritual by campus Republicans...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – In a not at all shocking twist of events, the former Northeastern mascot King Husky II has risen from the dead. The former Northeastern mascot arose from the grave following a sacrificial blood ritual by campus Republicans. “We were just doing our weekly blood ritual when King Husky II rose from the ground” said John White. one of the campus republicans.

Campus republicans were quick to offer King Husky a pair of AR-15s after he stated he was here to “take back the holy Northeastern Land” but the former Northeastern mascot declined. Armed with the power of God and anime King Husky II took it upon himself to take campus back from the Goose Liberation Army (GLA), who had been occupying it ever since students had been evicted early in the spring.

“We never expected something so powerful to attack us after we defeated the fratbros” squawked a member of the GLA. The defenses set up by the GLA were no match for the power wielded by King Husky II who made quick work of the anti-tank guns set up by the GLA and then proceeded to absolutely obliterate the rest of the light infantry who were attempting to flee what had become an apparent massacre.

Once the dust settled only King Husky II remained. When the Husky Husky asked for comment on what was next for the former Northeastern mascot he simply looked in the direction of BU and muttered “expansion”.
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21

articles.name: op-ed-the-tragedy-of-modern-pirate-media
articles.title: Op-ed The Tragedy of Modern Pirate Media
articles.brief: Pirates lived lives full of untold wonder. They spent their time exploring the seas, and raiding those unfortunate enough to cross their path for the chance at glory and riches. But I guess you wouldn’t know anything about that. Because apparently, you’re too fucking good for pirates, huh?
articles.text:
Pirates lived lives full of untold wonder. They spent their time exploring the seas, and raiding those unfortunate enough to cross their path for the chance at glory and riches. But I guess you wouldn’t know anything about that. Because apparently, you’re too fucking good for pirates, huh?

You ask people, “Hey, what’s the best pirate movie?” You know what they’ll say, 9 times out of 10? Pirates of the fuckin Caribbean. I know you were thinking it, too. Those were good when I was 12, but now what? Where do I go from here? How am I supposed to mindlessly consume as a late-stage-capitalist sheep without my niche interest being sated? Did the Hollywood hive mind decide that the pirate genre deserved to die alongside the need to produce anything other than soulless sequels?

It’s made even worse by looking at the movies closer. That time where Davy Jones lost his heart because his divine ex-wife decided to experiment with macrophilia, bullshit. The main plot relying on this mystical fucking compass that leads people to their true loves or whatever the fuck, bullshit. Those frilly powdered wigs that half the fucking cast wore, absolute bullshit. How am I supposed to indulge in my totally legitimate pirate fantasies without being reminded of this vapid nautical headache?

Don’t even get me started on pirate video games. All I want to do it to be able to role-play as the captain of my decked out square mast brig, desperately scrubbing the bilge out of my scurvy-ridden flesh. But no. Instead, every game follows a pay-to-win model that wants me to cash out for the golden cannon that shoots blazing super-Saiyan cannonballs or some other uninspired drivel. The only passable options require giving money to Ubisoft or spending an ungodly amount of time learning how to stop my vessel from clipping through the tutorial dock.

It doesn’t help matters that the only cultural impacts from our swashbuckling ruffians are that one episode of lazy town and promiscuous costumes during Halloween. Even the porn isn’t that good. Why do none of the actors have crabs? Why do they all have a full set of teeth? How am I supposed to get off without Blackbeard himself going to pound town with his first mate? Ridiculous. 

For now, the last bastion for honest-to-goodness plundering will remain my bathtub. My therapist says that I’m far too fixated on this pirate thing, but pirates never listened to their therapists anyway.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f
articles.attr: Sparrow coming to terms with his inadequacy

articles.name: co-op-sues-student-for-putting-proficient-with-excel-on-their-resume
articles.title: Co-Op Sues Student For Putting "Proficient With Excel" on Their Resume
articles.brief: Boston, MA—In an entirely unprecedented turn of events, a Northeastern Co-Op student has been litigated by his co-op employer for falsely stating that he was “proficient in Excel” on his resume. The employer, a local recruiting firm in Boston, was appalled to discover Josh Smith’s horrible truth.
articles.text:
Boston, MA—In an entirely unprecedented turn of events, a Northeastern Co-Op student has been litigated by his co-op employer for falsely stating that he was “proficient in Excel” on his resume. The employer, a local recruiting firm in Boston, was appalled to discover Josh Smith’s horrible truth.

“We were just talking about how some applicants embellish resumes in an informal meeting,” said Tim Horton, head of recruiting at AounX, “then Josh quipped that he wasn’t actually proficient in Excel. I thought he was just making an awful, awful, awful joke—but then I realized he was being completely serious. I almost threw up.”

Other employees at the meeting were similarly disgusted by Smith’s gross breach of contract. “I mean, I helped interview the guy,” said Tom Bolland, an HR rep at AounX. “I’m as guilty as he is. It’s like I forged his resume—and told his cruel lies. I can’t handle this kind of terrible responsibility. I don't know if I should be alone tonight.” AounX later reported a decrease in mental stability among faculty and an increase in existential dread.

Smith, who is currently being investigated by the FBI, CIA, DOJ, SPLC, and PEN15, feigned ignorance when interviewed. “I don’t understand why this is such a big deal. So what if I can’t do macros? It’s a recruiting job—I don’t even get to work with Excel files if I wanted to. Now there are 10 ‘house cleaner’ vans outside my house, and I’m pretty sure the 14 ‘news’ helicopters above my house aren’t a coincidence.” Even as I transcribe his words, I shudder. Truly the most ruthless of villains.  

AounX is also pursuing independent litigation against Smith for breach of contract and violations of the Geneva Convention. Their lawyer, Jebadiah Miller, was disgusted when he was given the case. “I joined AounX after my DOJ job so I wouldn’t have to face the cold, black abyss of truly terrible crime anymore. But I guess evil followed me here. I can only hope and pray that we take everything this kid owns. Anything less would be failing all those whose lives he’s ruined.” 

The Husky Husky would like to remind those who are having difficulty processing this article that Northeastern offers 24/7 counseling at 877.233.9477. May God have mercy on our souls.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a

articles.name: northeastern-announces-nuflex-program-moving-all-fall-classes-to-marino
articles.title: Northeastern Announces nuFLEX Program, Moving All Fall Classes to Marino
articles.brief: All classes will be taught at Marino for the fall semester so students can cultivate a sound mind and a SHREDDED bod at the same time.
articles.text:
Boston, MA—With the coronavirus casting uncertainty on the future of academics, Northeastern has provided a crucial update to put students at ease.

“Today, we are announcing that all classes will be taught at Marino for the fall semester so students can cultivate a sound mind and a SHREDDED bod at the same time. We call the program nuFLEX, because we’re always flexin’ on BU” read the email from the administration.

As per the official nuFLEX website (legdayeveryday.com/getswole), the move to Marino will be accompanied by the addition of three NUPath requirements, each with its own class.

The first NUPath attribute, strength, will be taught in Chest 1153. Your instructor will be that guy who rests on the bench on his phone for 37 minutes between sets. He will be wearing a tank top that’s actually just two thongs sewn together. Your TAs will be those three skinny guys who just got back from NUin who combined can’t even lift the bar, but they still sit at the bench for an hour trying not to gag as they drink protein shakes for the first time. Your classmates will be that girl who always asks how many sets you have left (even though you literally just started), that guy who always asks to work in with you (even when you only have one set left), the person who asks you to spot them so often that someone else steals your bench, and that professor who doesn’t re-rack the weights properly.

The second NUPath attribute is endurance, which will be covered in Legs 1050. Even though this may also sound like a strength class, it will actually be teaching you how to endure the pain of being the eighth person in line to use a squat rack while the guy using the squat rack is doing curls. Curls. In. The. Squat. Rack. It makes you want to pick up the 5 lb. weight and throw it at them, but turns out Professor Too-Good-to-Re-Rack hid them all behind the 45s. Your professor will be that girl from the powerlifting team who squats like six Aouns but lets out a super loud grunt every time. You’re pretty sure it’s some form of sexual harassment at this point.

The third NUPath attribute is cardio, taught in Track and Field 1245. It’s led by that guy who lives across the hall who you definitely just saw naked in the locker room. You’re about to lift some weights on the third floor when you see him, so you sprint as fast as possible in the other direction, which happens to be right onto the track. You decide to do a few laps to make it look natural, but then you stop when you realize you’ve been running the wrong way the whole time. There aren’t really any field events you can do in Marino, but you can shot-put a kettlebell at the guy curling in the squat rack if you want. After this first class, you don’t show up anymore. Cardio is for cowards. 

There is no specific NUPath attribute for flexibility, but under the nuFLEX program all non-tenured professors will be replaced by terrible yoga instructors. Unlike professors, they won’t force you to buy books they wrote. But they will grade you on how much Kombucha you drink without going to the bathroom on your yoga mat.

The administration closed its announcement with a short but heartfelt message. “Swole is the goal. Size is the prize. It’s gainz o’clock. Go nuFLEX on ‘em.”

articles.name: spring-co-ops-reflect-on-another-semester-down-the-drain
articles.title: Spring Co-ops Reflect on Another Semester Down the Drain
articles.brief: You know what time of year it is. That’s right, co-op reflection time, baby! Two months have passed since Northeastern exiled the entire student body from the Boston campus and, in that time, spring-cycle co-ops have had a lot to reflect on. The Husky Husky has taken to the streets to ask students: “What are your takeaways?”
articles.text:
Boston, MA-You know what time of year it is. That’s right! Co-op reflection time, baby! Two months have passed since Northeastern exiled the entire student body from the Boston campus and, in that time, spring-cycle co-ops have had a lot to reflect on. The Husky Husky has taken to the streets to ask students: “What are your takeaways?”

“Experiential learning is right!” Benny Bradson told us. “I spent months applying, interviewing, and tearing my hair out because none of  the positions were up to my parents’ standards, all for it to be meaningless anyway. By the time I figured out how to meaningfully contribute to the work environment, the literal apocalypse happened.” He gave a generous grin, but his tone betrayed a desire to curb stomp us for even daring to even ask. Bradson continued: “So this is  what the adult world is like. All of my efforts will be invalidated by forces outside my control. Persistence and diligence are meaningless in the face of God.“ After hastily excusing ourselves, he collapsed onto the ground, curled into a ball, and began to sob.

Some students are making the best of the situation, however.

David Danielson was all too eager to share his epiphany. “Now that I know everything I do will be in vain, I can dedicate my time to chasing my true passion: stand-up comedy!” After we immediately advised against his career change, he shook his head. “No, you see, this is the best thing that could have happened to me. Life is short, why should I waste it on a career that requires another decade of schooling and debt? I want to live in the now.” We left him to his naive delusions.

We next got a hold of Maddison Marvin, and after confirming that there was no existential crisis to speak of, she told us: “My coworkers don’t remember me, so now I can reapply to the same position and surprise them with my knowledge of the company!” Upon asking her what she knew about the company, she scoffed. “Absolutely nothing, I spent, like, the first couple months getting them coffee and organizing excel sheets filled with random numbers. I was only, like,  just getting around to being considered an employee when they laid me off. But I know their lunch orders by heart now! That alone took me, like, two weeks.”

It's good to see students making the best of their co-ops situations. Truly a testament to the strength of Northeastern students in this time of strife. For those of you in spring-cycle co-ops, remember: your third reflections are due before June 18th. Best of luck. While they may not be everything you had hoped, your dreams still live on to be crushed another day.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f
articles.attr: A well earned breakdown in Krentzman Quad

articles.name: virtual-protests-sweep-northeastern
articles.title: Virtual Protests Sweep Northeastern, Targets Respond by Burning Their Own Computers
articles.brief: This Husky Husky exposé followed the actions of a particular group of protesters: “The Distancing Duo,” named for their tendency to follow the current social distancing standards and their sheer inability to get anyone beyond the two current members to join them due to their depressing lack of social skills...
articles.text:
Boston, MA —Whether it be Coronavirus, police brutality, or SAIL, Northeastern students have much to protest. However, true revolutionaries know that protesting is clearly not limited to the campus. This Husky Husky exposé followed the actions of a particular group of protesters: “The Distancing Duo,” named for their tendency to follow the current social distancing standards and their sheer inability to get anyone beyond the two current members to join them due to their depressing lack of social skills. 

In their latest protest, The Distancing Duo decided to tackle what they have described as “the most important issue of our time,” and although they did not actually state exactly what that issue is, their signs say “Be Our Friends”. More important and relevant is their method of protesting. Since they each have a pre-existing condition of being too lazy to leave their parent’s basement, they have elected to host these protests via virtual conferencing software. 

Utilizing Zoom, they have contacted various groups to help them organize their protests. During the interview I had with them, they mentioned contacting Geoff Bayzos, CEO of Amazonia, who responded: “Who is this? How did you get into my personal zoom call?” along with Gill Bates, who couldn’t reach his computer to join the call due to being too busy counting his money (a very important task.) After these failures, The Distancing Duo tried a variety of companies and groups, but when prompted to host a Zoom call they set their computers on fire as a counter-protest, shutting down any hope the duo had. 

Since I have threatened to reveal that The Distancing Duo is actually one guy and his anime body-pillow/girlfriend, I was able to coerce an interview out of Nof Riends, who has asked to remain anonymous. Here is the conversation we had:


Gamer-Bot: So Mr. Riends, what do you normally do other than protesting?

Nof Riends: I usually spend lots of time with my girlfriend, but we’ve been so busy protesting that we haven’t been able to do anything ourselves recently.

Gamer-Bot: So how often do you usually meet up with your other friends?

Nof Riends: Umm… I… Can you ask a different question?

Gamer-Bot: Sure. When you meet up with your friends, how many days do you normally space these meetings out?

Nof Riends: Wait- That’s the same question!

Gamer-Bot: No it isn’t.

Nof Riends: YES IT IS!


That was the end of our conversation, and I left soon after. As a final message to you all, if you or your loved ones suffer from an involuntary lack of friends, make sure to avoid them at all costs, as you wouldn’t want to ruin their single-player run, now would you?

articles.name: king-husky-ii-invades-bu-after-taking-back-northeasterns-campus
articles.title: King Husky II invades BU after taking back Northeastern’s campus
articles.brief: Boston, MA – After a series of bizarre events, King Husky II rose back from the dead and took back campus from the Goose Liberation army. King Husky II reigned supreme shortly after the massacre that resembled your average Canada Goose factory...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – After a series of bizarre events, King Husky II rose back from the dead and took back campus from the Goose Liberation army. King Husky II reigned supreme shortly after the massacre that resembled your average Canada Goose factory. With the geese cleared out of campus, King Husky II set his sights on the next goal: expansion.

At the crack of dawn the roar of King Husky II could be heard across the fens, terrorizing the remaining geese who fled in sheer terror from King Husky II. The mythical husky had grown to the size of a building. Shortly after, King Husky II arrived at the street that was allegedly the Boston University campus. With no mercy and no one to oppose him, victory was as easy as beating BU at pretty much everything. Any feeble attempt by BU students to stop supreme canine were met with laser eyes that quickly disintegrated everyone in sight. In under 26 minutes King Husky II lay claim to victory over BU. After taking the CITGO sign and claiming it as a war trophy King Husky II sat atop of a throne made from broken hopes and dreams of BU ever winning a beanpot again.

“I was very confused as to what we were to take over, it’s not like there’s a campus clearly marked as BU'' said a 6th year History major who followed King Husky II in his conquests. It is still unclear what will happen with the newly acquired land as King Husky simply vaporized the Huntington News reporter who tried to reach out for comment. However, it is speculated that the newly acquired land won’t be used to create more student housing. This comes from a series of videos where president Aoun seems to be holding blueprints for an ISEC IX.

articles.title: We Announce... Frisky Husky Husky Husky®
articles.brief: We here at The Husky Husky have always believed in safe sex practices, and, despite all of us being virgins...
articles.text:
Boston, MA - We here at The Husky Husky have always believed in safe sex practices, and, despite all of us being virgins, because only abstinence is tolerated in this Christian household, we wanted to aid in the efforts of Frisky Husky, ensuring every sexually active student on Northeastern’s campus has access to safe sex.

Regardless, many of us here at The Husky Husky, forced to write for no pay, provided no sunlight, and only one meal a day, wondered how the organization could still, even with sponsorship, possibly afford to simply give away so many condoms. Well, we can’t. All funds received from the athletic department sponsorship were used for the completely necessary purchases of the trademark for “Frisky Husky Husky Husky®” and the copyright for the name of the latter mentioned safe sex pack we will furthermore refer to as the FHHHHHHHHSSP©. 

So with no money remaining, but a promise to deliver, we decided to steal the entire bowl of peepee teepees from the UHCS lobby by having our well-fed writers fill their backpacks with the pussy-penetrating plastic. Additionally, each penis poncho will be packaged in a plastic bag, effectively giving each reader two blam jams, one luxury, and the other economy.

And don’t try to just order from Frisky Husky online. It won’t work anymore, it just won’t, don’t try. Their website isn’t down, but like, no guests in dorms, and we’re exclusive now, and this is the only way y’all can get condoms, just trust. We know you will because Husky Husky readers fuck. Your first FHHHHHHHHSSP© is on the way!
