articles.name: aoun-impersonator-runs-phone-sex-hotline-during-online-lectures
articles.title: Aoun Impersonator Runs Phone Sex Hotline During Online Lectures
articles.brief: Here at the Husky Husky, we have done numerous academic studies on Northeastern student productivity in order to better understand how to motivate the slaves that write our articles. Recently, we have noticed a sudden spike in student entrepreneurship and decided to break into the home of Sally Stevens, a student at Northeastern, to gain some insight...
articles.text:
Boston, MA — Here at the Husky Husky, we have done numerous academic studies on Northeastern student productivity in order to better understand how to motivate the slaves that write our articles. Recently, we have noticed a sudden spike in student entrepreneurship and decided to break into the home of Sally Stevens, a student at Northeastern, to gain some insight.

Stevens, while initially extremely upset that we had broken into her house, soon accepted our interview stating that “anything is better than the godforsaken class I’m in right now.” We sat down and this is what she had to say:


Gamer-Bot: So Sally, we noticed you seemed to be in a lecture when we let ourselves in through your bedroom window. What exactly were you learning just now?

Sally: Well, I wasn’t learning anything, and I think the lecture was either Economics 101 or Shrek 2, but I honestly can’t remember. I was too busy running my new business.

Gamer-Bot: What business, if you don’t mind me asking?

Sally: I run a phone sex hotline for Northeastern students.

Gamer-Bot: *speechless*

Sally: No, seriously! It’s very lucrative and I get lots of business. I got the idea while watching the first Shrek movie! Donkey really gets me going, if you know what I mean. [Editors Note: We know what she means]

Gamer-Bot: Umm… So who exactly is calling you?

Sally: My classmates from my lectures.

Gamer-Bot: Why? Phone sex is kind of outdated, isn’t it?

Sally: Better than sitting through a lecture.

Gamer-Bot: That’s a fair point. Any kinks your callers have that you might be willing to share?

Sally: Well, I’ve been asked to do an Aoun impression.

Gamer-Bot: Who was this caller, if you don’t mind me asking?

Sally: Well, nearly everyone requests it nowadays, at least ever since I got the first response. Weirdly enough, the first guy also sounded exactly like Aoun. 

Gamer-Bot: Well, that would certainly make sense… Can I hear the impression, since it’s so popular? Not because I’m sexually attracted to Aoun or anything... baka, just... just… for journalism purposes. Yea, it’s for the interview.

Sally: Sure!


*** The remainder of the interview is censored due to the intense sexual nature of the Aoun impression to the point that even reading the words that were spoken would cause anyone reading it to become unable to enjoy mere sex when compared to the immense pleasure Aoun can bring. ***
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Photo of Sally working during a lecture

articles.name: battle-of-the-bens
articles.title: Battle of the Bens: CS Professors Benjamin Lerner and Hescott Prep for a Battle to the Death
articles.brief: Things are heating up here at Northeastern University as the school’s first-ever staff showdown approaches...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Things are heating up here at Northeastern University as the school’s first-ever staff showdown approaches. In light of the Corona epidemic, population density on campus is being lowered, and as Aoun decreed last night: “We are only allowing staff members with unique first names back onto campus. This is part of our multi-step plan to decrease population density while increasing profits.” After questioning Aoun further at his mansion built out of the bones of Northeastern drop-outs, we discovered that this will affect our institution in a way that is totally unnecessary but immensely profitable, to no one’s surprise.

In the Khoury College of Computer Science professional nerds Professor Benjamin Lerner and Associate Dean Benjamin Hescott prep for a showdown to the death. Due to the intense respect almost all CS majors have for Ben^2, the administration has decided to rent out Matthews Arena for the event. The “Battle of the Bens” is scheduled for September 7th, the last day before despair/classes.

These professors who usually just flex their mental muscles must now manipulate their masculine mentality to make their meek match mumble “mercy.” However, they discovered that years of using computers have made their arms very feeble.

When asked for a comment, Ben Lerner had this to say: “I’m going to design a recipe of pain to bring down upon him.” He also has the advantage of super-strong legs from pacing around in lectures to put students on edge.

On the other hand, Ben Hescott has some powerful connections through his position as Associate Dean of the Khoury College that might manipulate the fight in his favor. When we showed up with questions to discuss our paths through Khoury, he said: “While I’m disappointed you aren’t here to discuss how I can help you as a student, know that I am working hard, just like you should, to put myself in a position where I have the intellect and ability to whoop some ass.”

While we don’t know who will win, we know that either way the Khoury student body will mourn the passing of one of their favorite staff members - although they’ll be too busy complaining about their assignments to attend the fight.

Separately, religious groups on campus are hoping that these name regulations don’t get put in place for students as well. As Northeastern Chabad and Hillel representatives said when we sat down with them: “Oy gavult, we are in serious danger here. Half our members are either named Sarah, Ben, Jacob, or Rebecca. We’ll just have to have free weekly dinners with even less people now… Hey, are you free on Friday? Come on, be a mensch!” We quickly departed before we could be dragged into attending an admittedly decent free meal (We were charged for the meal on Benmo anyway).

When asked how it would affect his group, a Catholic student named John Smith said: “Well, it’s less that it would harm us, and more that it would destroy us, as literally all of us have biblical names. We just wouldn’t exist at all!” On the other hand, the Islamic group’s representatives had this to say: “No one can pronounce our names anyway, so we are confident that they can’t prove we have the same names”. [Editor’s Note: If you are reading this, we apologize for being unable to spell your names]


Disclaimer: The Husky Husky in no way condones violence against Computer Science Majors, Khoury Students/Professors, or any other individuals that, due to a lack of athletic prowess, are unable to fend for themselves. They are simply too busy using their brain to use any other muscles. If you would like to donate to an organization centered around helping Computer Science majors, please call 1-800-INCELS.
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Bens Lerner and Hescott pose in anticipation of their showdown

articles.name: northeastern-to-implement-3--and-4--factor-authentication
articles.title: Northeastern to Implement 3- and 4- Factor Authentication
articles.brief: Boston, MA – You can never be too safe on the internet. That’s why Northeastern has unveiled its new security plan...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – You can never be too safe on the internet. That’s why Northeastern has unveiled its new security plan for student accounts. Starting this fall, students will be required to use 4-Factor Authentication for all of their accounts. In addition, new password regulations will be added to minimize the chance of students being hacked. This comes immediately in the wake of a COE freshman being hacked after leaving their laptop open while they went to the bathroom to cry about their Fundies exam. Here are Northeastern’s new authentication policies:

  • • All passwords must be at least 8 characters long.
  • • Passwords must involve 1 number, 1 special character, and 1 hand-drawn #HowlinHusky. Per a source, Northeastern’s sign-in page will now have a pop-up drawing canvas. Students are advised to practice their drawings during the summer.
  • • For 2FA, Northeastern will maintain Duo usage; however, the request must be received on a second device. This change is designed to prevent students from exploiting a bug wherein someone logging onto MyNortheastern with their phone can have Duo’s verification sent to that same phone. In addition, Duo has completed a long-expected merger with Duolingo. As a result, all Duo requests will be presented to users in a language of their choosing. Options include Aramaic, Ancient Greek, and JavaScript.
  • • For 3FA, Northeastern will require the user to call a trained cybersecurity professional on Zoom. On the call, the user will be required to hold up their Husky ID to the camera to verify that they are who they claim to be. If the cybersecurity personnel cannot positively ID the user, Northeastern will deploy a staff member to the user’s location to conduct an in-person inspection of the ID. If the ID does not meet Northeastern’s standards, the student’s account will be suspended until a new ID is obtained. As a reminder, IDs can be acquired from Speare Hall from 10:30-11:00 a.m. every other Monday.
  • • For 4FA, students will be required to write a 1 page essay on why they love the co-op program. While the specific wording does not have to remain consistent, the details will be evaluated by President Aoun himself, and he will have the ultimate decision on whether or not the student’s essay is accurate. Per Aoun, “Even if the story is legit, if it reflects poorly on the co-op program, guess what? You’re not allowed to sign in. Play by my rules or don’t play at all”. Northeastern clarified that they maintain the right to publish these essays as advertisements. When asked if that poses a security threat, Aoun began filling out a transfer application on behalf of our reporter.


Responses to the new changes have been overwhelmingly positive. In a survey (n = 0), not a single negative comment was recorded. And in a second survey (n = the guy next to me), responders agreed that the changes were “going to make things different than they were before”.

Northeastern’s cybersecurity team says that any students that have questions or concerns about the new policies are “cordially invited to shut the hell up about it”.
articles.author: 5ebc4dac1d76bb6ac5fe44cc
articles.attr: Pictured: A contented student enjoying his new security

articles.name: aouns-covid-itinerary-suggests-a-less-than-robot-proof-marriage
articles.title: Aoun’s Covid Itinerary Suggests a Less Than Robot-Proof Marriage
articles.brief: Boston, MA—As protection measures against COVID-19 are implemented across Northeastern’s Campus, a whistleblower from the university’s contact-tracing taskforce (CTT) came forward to reveal some disturbing news...
articles.text:
Boston, MA — As protection measures against COVID-19 are implemented across Northeastern’s Campus, a whistleblower from the university’s contact-tracing taskforce (CTT) came forward to reveal some disturbing news. “Mrs. Aoun has some guys on the inside, they send her Aoun’s movements throughout the day. You know, it’s not my place to comment on anyone’s marital issues, but when you use the taxpayers' dollars to avoid marriage counseling costs that’s when I have to step forward.”

As Joseph Aoun has not yet tested positive for COVID-19, no contact-tracing is needed to follow his actions throughout the day. However, our source has provided proof that the CTT allocates resources to tracking his every move, and sends Mrs. Aoun text updates throughout the day. Our inside source tells us “she’s got some really odd requests for information, but since she’s married to the big boss man Daddy Aoun we’ve felt pressured to provide it.” 

The whistleblower has provided us with some of the documentation they keep above.

Mrs. Aoun has released this statement to the press: “I did nothing wrong and only utilized the resources at my disposal. If you had to be married to such an elusive and robot-proof man, you would want to know his whereabouts too.” 

Joseph Aoun has declined to comment on his wife’s actions at this time.
articles.author: 5ee7c8cbde0849334e41225c
articles.attr: Joseph Aoun in line at Tatte to pick up his daily latte

articles.name: fuck-free-fall
articles.title: Fuck Free Fall: Four Friends Field Far-Fetched Fornication Formulas
articles.brief: Following Northeastern’s announcement that guest sign-ins would be banned during the fall semester, students have expressed concern about how this will affect their sex lives. Some have taken to Reddit to complain, although we all know no one on Reddit is getting any anyway. To see how students are responding to these draconian restrictions, the Husky Husky interviewed a group of four friends to break down the different ways they plan to fuck this fall.
articles.text:
Following Northeastern's announcement that guest sign-ins would be banned during the fall semester, students have expressed concern about how this will affect their sex lives. Some have taken to Reddit to complain, although we know no one on Reddit is getting any anyways. To see how students are responding to these draconian restrictions, the Husky Husky interviewed a group of four friends to break down the different ways they plan to fuck this fall.

David and Samantha have been dating since freshman year and will be celebrating two years together this fall. “We were excited after housing selection! I got a single in a three-person apartment, so we figured finding somewhere to fuck wouldn’t be an issue,” David told the Husky Husky. “But the restrictions changed all that, so we’ve decided to fuck on the Green Line for the foreseeable future.” This tactic was met with skepticism, with his roommates questioning if more bodily fluids is what the Green Line needs right now and if the never ending SCREEECH would kill the mood. David and Samantha have clarified they’ll only be fucking in the new Green Line cars, although investigative reporting by Husky Husky staff confirmed this doesn’t solve any of the problems with their plan.

Sara, David’s best friend, has decided to work with what she’s got. “I’m living in West A North next year, so I’ve got a large field to play.” According to her math, there are 500 residents in WV A, leaving 250 guys to go after. Assuming 30% are in committed relationships and 30% are ugly af, that leaves 100 eligible candidates. “Not amazing odds, but a girl has to try.” Sara plans to set her Bumble radius to one mile and ask all her matches what dorm they live in. When pushed by Husky Husky reporters on what steps she’s taking to stop being a deeply broken and unlovable person, Sara started crying and hung up the Zoom call.

Paige has taken a different tact to the crisis, seeing profits in others’ pain. Paige is living in a six-person apartment on Mission Hill next year, and plans to rent her bedroom out to horny students, under the name “Paige’s Private Playground.” For $69 per hour, students can expect unlimited condoms, fresh sheets, and total confidentiality, with overnight stays available upon request. “I certainly don’t enjoy the idea of hundreds of people fucking in my bed. But as a business major, nothing gets me off like making supernormal profit by filling a market gap.” When asked to comment, Boston Police said that while Paige is technically running a brothel, they “gotta respect the grind” and have no plans to arrest her.

The most pure response was from Samantha’s fundies partner Anthony. He’s been dating Jane since January 2020, with their first few months cut short by the spring shutdown. They plan to remain celibate this fall, insisting sex isn’t important to their relationship. “We’re just so so deeply in love at this point it’ll be fine,” Jane told the Husky Husky, adding “our relationship has been so through much there’s literally nothing that can end it.” When asked to comment, Anthony reported that he and Jane have not discussed fall plans, instead spending the duration of Zoom calls saying “I love you” over and over until one feints from exhaustion. Vegas betting markets are currently giving 1:1000 odds that their relationship will survive more than a week into fall semester.

Students living in Northeastern housing this summer have already reported negative impacts, exacerbated by summer housing policy of one resident per apartment. “I have nowhere to bang anymore, and even if I could get my gf in here, we’d have nobody to sexile,” complained one student. The Husky Husky expects a lonely semester for all genitalia on campus. Aoun has yet to make a statement to addressing these issues, but is reportedly over the moon after learning of the cost saving from decreased Frisky Husky demand.
articles.author: 5eae0e221d76bb6ac5fe449b
articles.attr: President Aoun completing a routine inspection of David and Samantha's bone zone

articles.name: anti-racism-training
articles.title: Research On New Anti-Racism Training Reveals an Increase in Racist Tendencies
articles.brief: Due to recent events and the overwhelming calls for change that mildly annoy the administration, the god of Northeastern, Aoun, has decided to...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Due to recent events and the overwhelming calls for change that mildly annoy the administration, the god of Northeastern, Aoun, has decided to implement a mandatory Cultural Competency and Anti-Racism training program. The Husky Husky has long lauded the merits of mind-numbing videos students must watch every semester for sexual harassment training. [Editor’s Note: It is yet to be determined whether these videos are to teach students to recognize sexual harassment or to commit it.] Since our review was the only semi-positive thing anyone has said about it, Northeastern contracted us to test their new program!

The Husky Husky accepted this offer, as we were lacking in material at the time, but almost immediately wished we hadn’t. First, let me start by saying that we are nothing if not professional, so we gathered diverse representatives of the Northeastern population: people of all races, all genders, and all levels of student debt. Here are our findings:

Finding 1: The program is boring as fuck. I can’t believe someone made this without dying of boredom. After 6 consecutive 40-minute videos of sheltered freshmen performing inane skits, all participants fell asleep. The only people that could make it all the way to the 18th video were insomniacs. 

Finding 2: The program has as much content as students that don’t worship Aoun. That is to say, none. However, there were plenty of unrelated and unsupported claims made by various individuals. These were mainly focused on how annoying it was that they were forced to create these videos to earn the trips out of their cages they were promised. When we expressed an interest in Northeastern including statistics or anything of the sort, they responded with “facts and figures are oppressive, we only want heavily-filtered anecdotal evidence to eliminate any possible bias.” 

Finding 3: The program measurably increased racist tendencies in participants. While viewers claimed the videos had no effect, that wasn’t the case. We conducted a series of interviews to better understand our findings. Our interviewees were John Smith, Advo Cate, and Ala Bama.

Question: “How did you feel about the videos?”

Mr. Smith: “I have developed PTSD as a result of these videos and am no longer willing to take part in discussions that may remind me of this extremely traumatic experience.”

Question: “How has this informed your view on the matter?”

Ms. Cate: “Well, I wasn’t racist before but if this is anti-racist maybe those racists are onto something.”

Ms. Bama: “If this is my opposition, how can I be wrong? I mean, I may be discriminating against people based on factors they can’t control, but at least we aren’t torturing them with this bullshit!”

Unfortunately, we can’t provide a definite conclusion as our entire staff took their sick days simultaneously on the day we were supposed to suffer through the program for ourselves, and the person in charge of rescheduling appointments such as these resigned. What a strange set of coincidences...

Disclaimer: We at the Husky Husky denounce racism (a negative action targeted at someone on the basis of their race), and suggest an equal-hate policy instead, where everyone hates all people equally. If you agree, please fill out our change.org petition.
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Aoun watching the new training video with his personal chef

articles.title: The Husky Husky Learns that Times New Roman Exists
articles.brief: I almost feel a little bad doing this. It’s like if you met a toddler and they yelled “I HATE YOU”, punched you in the knee, then fell over onto a landmine while running away...
articles.text:
I almost feel a little bad doing this. It’s like if you met a toddler and they yelled “I HATE YOU”, punched you in the knee, then fell over onto a landmine while running away. Poor little guys, it must be tough interrupting your 3-month article schedule to write a hit article- sorry, headline :( (seriously, couldn’t even come up with a reason. That only leaves jealousy.)

So, come at us TNR (Totally Not Robot-Proof), this will be our only article on this since none of us or our readers have ever even heard of you. Your articles have more Comic Sans energy anyways.


Check out more of our website for lessons on how to write actual satire, and stay updated with our frequent posting by following us on Instagram and Twitter @huskyhuskyneu.

articles.name: coronavirus-only-reason-sophomore-student-isnt-getting-laid
articles.title: Coronavirus Only Reason Sophomore Student Isn’t Getting Laid
articles.brief: Boston, MA— Sophomore computer science student Alex Reynolds is going through a problem many Northeastern students can empathize with: he hasn’t been laid for 240 months...
articles.text:
Boston, MA— Sophomore computer science student Alex Reynolds is going through a problem many Northeastern students can empathize with: he hasn’t been laid for 240 months. 

“It's been just terrible,” said Reynolds. “You know, the whole coronavirus thing. It’s just really thrown a wrench into my sex life. I was going to meet so many chicks at the parties I definitely get invited to—but then, wouldn’t you know it—coronavirus just stopped me in my tracks.” 

Reynolds, who was totally getting girls left and right before the COVID-19 pandemic hit, has struggled to date in his hometown. “Tinder dates are really hard because of social distancing,” says Reynolds. “I mean, I haven’t matched with anyone yet, but I’m sure it would be awful to date 6 feet apart. How would that even work?” 

While Reynolds, who was totally going to bone this one chick before she flew home (the student in question, who has requested to stay anonymous, had already ghosted Reynolds), has it hard, he isn’t the only student whose personal life has fallen out of rhythm due to the ongoing pandemic. 

Cameron Mon, a freshman engineering student weighing in at a whopping 120 pounds, has had his workout schedule completely ruined by coronavirus.

“I was totally getting shredded, but then ‘rona hit, and I had to go home,” said Mon. “I couldn’t bulk at home because I had to leave my unopened whey on campus, so I’m basically stuck here. It really sucks, because I was getting super jacked before I had to leave.” 

Mon, who visited Marino once during freshman orientation, has been especially hurt by the lack of gym access. “I was going to go to Marino in January, for New Year’s, but then I heard about the coronavirus in China. I didn’t want to take any chances. Now that I don’t have a gym, it's impossible for me to work out for at least the next three years. That's just bad luck.”

Many Northeastern students have shared grievances similar to those of Mon and Reynolds. In particular, students have complained about the pandemic stopping them from improving their sleep schedules, studying more, reading more books, organizing their schedules, using their phones less, building better relationships with their family, and generally getting their lives the fuck together. And yes, you should feel personally attacked by this article.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
articles.attr: Pictured: Renolds simping to some girl who couldn't care less.

articles.name: student-with-red-laser-beam-pointed-at-her-chest-totally-using-sail-voluntarily
articles.title: Student with Red Laser Beam Pointed at Her Chest Totally Using SAIL Voluntarily
articles.brief: In their latest bid to build an android army, the creators of SAIL have launched a new student testimonial video. The video stars Kali Scuf, a second-year communications major, and the first student claiming to be using SAIL voluntarily. Her safety is now the subject of growing concern.
articles.text:
Boston, MA—In their latest bid to build an android army, the creators of SAIL have launched a new student testimonial video.

The video stars Kali Scuf, a second-year communications major, and the first student claiming to be using SAIL voluntarily. Her safety is now the subject of growing concern.

In the video, Kali Scuf appears to have her hands bound behind her back, and a bright, red laser beam can be seen pointed at her chest throughout the entire interview. The camera crew seemed concerned, repeatedly interrupting the filming to ask if she was alright.

“I’m definitely okay,” replied Kali Scuf. “I’m totally using SAIL voluntarily, and I’m certainly not being forced to do this at gunpoint. Only 99% of my GPA is based on how colorful my SAIL honeycomb is, so it’s not like that’s driving my decision at all. And even though they’ve taken my family hostage, I totally would have used SAIL anyway!”

Several other points in the interview were particularly concerning. Kali Scuf began sweating and shaking when asked if SAIL was useful.

“Is SAIL useful? Of course! It’s great for not failing classes that mandate the use of SAIL, or not dying when you’re forced to promote SAIL at gunpoint, and it’s perfect for making sure the creators of SAIL don’t murder your family, who they’ve taken hostage!”

The Husky Husky team downloaded SAIL to check Kali Scuf’s profile to look for any clues as to her safety or whereabouts. After days of intense vomiting from the unpleasant experience of downloading such an ungodly service and weeks of figuring out how the “completely intuitive” platform works, we found some disturbing news. All of Kali Scuf’s moments on her SAIL profile were titled “Propaganda Session,” “Brainwashing,” or “Mechanized Army Development.”

Our team at the Husky Husky now fears for our safety after uncovering this disturbing news, but we have hidden our families in a safe location where the creators of SAIL would never dare to venture: an economics class on the sunk cost fallacy. We will continue to brave through these dangerous conditions to bring you the truth about this wretched platform.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: Pictured: Kali Scuf in SAIL propaganda video.

articles.name: more-nupath-requirements-coming-this-fall-functional-undergraduate-or-fu
articles.title: More NUPath requirements coming this fall Functional Undergraduate or FU
articles.brief: These new courses remind students of Northeastern's mission to FU.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Completing the poisonous alphabet soup of NUPath requirements is a rigorous process, often involving paying thousands of dollars to sweat out ecstasy, vodka, and various other drugs in a gigantic auditorium—experiencing a hangover that might just prove to be fatal—while pretending to listen to a professor give a sermon about the utility of Latin or something. The professor is a sweet guy, but you're too busy gripping onto your chair and holding on for dear life to remember his name or where you are… much less a thing he says.


Compared to the monastic boredom of most lectures, these courses make the Northeastern’s academic experience undeniably “well-rounded.” However, the new “Functional Undergraduate” (FU) requirements might just be the most important classes students take. According to a very real course catalog, FU classes will teach students some honest-to-God basic fucking life skills. It’s estimated that at least 67.3% of students on campus think there are invisible fucking maids going around cleaning up after their messes. Alarmed? You should be. Wondering where that statistic came from? Me too. 


An academic advisor explained why the university felt the need to add requirements to NUPath. She claimed, “Year after year, we graduate thousands and thousands of adult children. I mean, students are so helpless that we’re turning the city of Boston into a glorified daycare center”. She glanced over her shoulder, spotting a student emitting cartoon stink lines and sucking his thumb while trudging towards his next class. After taking a long drag from a cigarette as her eyes sunk into the thousand-yard stare of a Vietnam vet remembering a firefight, she sighed and continued; “FU will feel like the same white-knuckle thrill ride as Advanced Writing in the Disciplines but will add the emasculating feeling of being talked down to... like you’re a dog who’s pissed on the floor. Because—and I gotta keep it real here—this job feels like looking after a pet that eats all of your shit and defecates in your home instead of loving you back”.


Sample FU requirements for each college are listed below. 


Khoury College of Social Incompetence 

  • Learn how to take a shower 
  • Maintain eye contact with another human being for longer than 1.5 seconds
  • Expand writing skills beyond the 3rd grade. For instance, students will be instructed how to begin an essay without the phrase, “In this essay, I’m going to talk about…”


College of Social Sciences and a Lack of Humanity

  • Address basic mathematics skills. Ex. if Student A spends $70,000 a year on a sociology degree each year for 5 years, how much money did Student A  pour into a dumpster fire?


College of Arts, Media, Design, and Service Job Prep

  • Master the skills required for an inevitable future career as a barista. Ex: misspelling names (including your own), downloading Tik Tok and twerking (tastefully) while praying to make it big, or moving back home until your mixtape takes off
  • For students with actual artistic talent: attempt to pay off crippling student debt by selling furry porn on the internet


College of Engineering How to Never Get Laid

  • Watch the entirety of the Discovery Channel’s hit show How It’s Made to gain an inside look into what their future holds
  • Alternatively, construct an elaborate Rube-Goldberg machine designed to replace human contact and give the inventor a hug. Weep as the mechanical arms of the contraption fail to make up for years of solitude.


College of Pseudo-Science / Bouvé College of Unhealthy Sciences:

  • Requirements have yet to be decided. Faculty members were not aware that these colleges actually enrolled students or weren’t marketing stunts aimed at increasing Northeastern’s rankings.


D'Amore- McKim School of Business, AKA: BDSM

  • Students must retrieve their belabored and corrupt souls from the underworld. Each student will be given an ancient map and be required to embark upon a dangerous quest to battle their way to the River Styx itself. Thankfully, many will perish.

articles.name: public-masturbation-to-be-made-legal-in-krentzman-quadrangle
articles.title: Public Masturbation to Be Made Legal in Krentzman Quadrangle
articles.brief: Boston, MA — Picture this: the sun is rising over Northeastern University’s campus on a brisk Thursday morning in November. A freshman is racing to Marino to try and mimic the effects of puberty through weightlifting when he spots a homeless man in the center of Krentzman quad. The man is wel-cumming the new day by choking the goose (and not the fens kind)...
articles.text:
Boston, MA — Picture this: the sun is rising over Northeastern University’s campus on a brisk Thursday morning in November. A freshman is racing to Marino to try and mimic the effects of puberty through weightlifting when he spots a homeless man in the center of Krentzman quad. The man is wel-cumming the new day by choking the goose (and not the fens kind). Beautiful, right? But, at the time, it was illegal. And not just because it was No Nut November. 

However, thanks to the hard work of Northeastern student activists, the act of public masturbation in Krentzman Quad will soon be legalized. This comes after huge support for the brave wanking soldier broke out amongst the student body, and even the witness of the man’s actions noting, “When he finished, it gave me the idea about how nice it would be to have a fountain in the middle [of Krentz].” 

The few students who were against the legalization were quickly told to check their privilege, as “not everybody has access to a home or clothing, so he's just making do with what he has.” Our community at Northeastern is all about inclusivity, and we want anyone who cums here to feel at home. 

After hearing the outcry of the students, Joseph Aoun, our highly esteemed president, stepped up to comment. “The incident with the homeless man masturbating in our Quad brought more publicity to this university than we have seen in years. I always say ‘no publicity is bad publicity’, and I think legalizing masturbation on the forefront of our campus will draw attention to what we are trying to achieve here. Also it could potentially help our ranking on US News.”

The Husky Husky fully supports public masturbation and does not think it should be limited to just the Krentzman quad.

articles.name: international-students-excited-to-add-deportation-to-their-sail-moments
articles.title: International Students Excited to Add ‘Deportation’ to their SAIL Moments
articles.brief: Boston, MA – With the recent announcement that international students will lose their F1 student visas if classes shift completely online, students and families are understandably upset over the prospect of being deported due to a university’s decision on whether or not to keep campus open.  However, for international students at Northeastern, there is hope on the horizon, and in these dark days, we spell hope “S-A-I-L.”
articles.text:
Boston, MA – With the recent announcement that international students will lose their F1 student visas if classes shift completely online, students and families are understandably upset over the prospect of being deported due to a university’s decision on whether or not to keep campus open.  However, for international students at Northeastern, there is hope on the horizon, and in these dark days, we spell hope “S-A-I-L.”

SAIL, for the foolishly uninitiated, is the ever-helpful app here at Northeastern which acts like the real-life equivalent of Xbox achievements, where students track their opportunities and moments throughout the day and gain points in 5 main categories.  This app is happily and willingly used by all Northeastern students, who without the app, would most likely be dead, destitute or selling their bodies on the streets of Boston.  In light of these possible deportations, Northeastern, in conjunction with ICE, has planned a new SAIL seminar entitled “Global Perspectives: Deportation.”  In this seminar, globally sensitive perspectives will be explored with varying degrees of thoroughness.  First, there is a panel of international students who discuss globalism and the importance of international experiential education.  They are then joined on stage by an expert panel of ICE officers, who will promptly explain that they don’t want them in this country and immediately detain all panel members for deportation.

“While I was looking forward to studying in America this semester,” said Alan Smith, a rising third-year and panel member from Korea, “being able add a deportation to my SAIL timeline would boost my Global score to previously undreamt-of heights.”

Lola Gilligan, a grad student from Sri Lanka, had this to say about the panel: “I believe that this is a momentous SAIL moment in history, where we have the ability to all come together as global citizens and increase our SAIL dimensions in the name of education and understanding.”

Some, however, were not so sure about this panel.  Chuck Copenhagen, an incoming freshman from Pakistan, expressed that while he would “love to be a member of this panel,” he fears that he “might be deported at the airport before making it to campus,” meaning, of course, that he would tragically not see any boosts to his SAIL score.

Many national students at Northeastern are righteously angry at these possible deportations.  Hao Chen, a rising fifth-year from Missouri, explained to us his righteous indignation, saying that “It is wholly unfair for these students to be deported in such a manner, as doing so puts them at an unfair advantage when it comes to advancing their SAIL dimensions.” Mr. Chen continued by proposing that “Citizens should also be allowed to be deported as well so that they too can capitalize on the SAIL benefits such a great opportunity presents.”

No matter what your feeling is on this issue, we here at the Husky Husky firmly believe that one’s worth is not measured by where you come from, what you look like, or by any other standards dictated by gods or government, but rather that the truest measure of a person’s life and experiences are the five metrics found in their SAIL profile.
articles.author: 5f064a770a96e90833098013
articles.attr: The Global Perspectives: Deportation SAIL moment, a joint effort between Northeastern and ICE

articles.name: neu-gigs-arrested-for-doxxing-aoun-after-osccr-raid
articles.title: NEU Gigs Arrested for Doxxing Aoun After OSCCR Raid
articles.brief: Boston, MA – OSCCR has arrested NEU gigs after an ultra-secret virtual raid. The raid happened before 8 am classes started and resulted in the capture of NEU Gigs...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – OSCCR has arrested NEU gigs after an ultra-secret raid. The raid happened before 8 am classes started and resulted in the capture of NEU Gigs. Although the raid was swift and silent, 2 OSCCR members fell down mid-raid and had to sit it out. In a statement released by OSCCR it was revealed that NEU Gigs was arrested on charges for the account of doxxing President Aoun.

The full statement released by OSCCR reads as follows:

“Ladies and Gentlemen, we got him.

Approximately 10 minutes before the first lectures of the day, our elite special forces conducted a raid on the complex occupied by NEU Gigs. Unfortunately, 2 officers were mildly injured but have been taken care of by UCHS.

The man we arrested today was quite short of OSCCR’s most wanted list. We are still looking for the first years who blasted “Fuck the Police” during quiet hours. However, the tragic doxxing of our Supreme Leader Aoun led to orders that we were to arrest NEU Gigs. As some of you may know, President Aoun made a statement on his private Twitter account that “Rebecca’s isn’t even that good.” This controversial tweet led to him being doxxed by NEU Gigs who posted the hashtag #AounIsOverParty along with the address of the ISEC III construction site.

Our intelligence officers along with PAWS were quickly able to back trace the IP address and hack all of the mainframes to get the address of NEU Gigs. We immediately dispatched OSCCR officers who successfully captured this heinous individual.”

After the release of this statement by OSCCR it was evident that this has been a major victory for President Aoun, who has been caught in controversy over plans for ISEC IV. President Aoun’s office declined to comment on the raid and subsequent arrest.

So far, the raid and arrest of NEU Gigs seemed to resonate well with the majority of normal students. “I’m not racist, but…” said a campus Republican whose opinion we had to censor to avoid getting them doxxed. Other more normal students commented they were just glad to be able to tweet that they enjoyed the last season of Game of Thrones without an angry mob at their doorstep. The vigilante club at Northeastern also came out in support of OSCCR citing “We just wanted to play Watch_Dogs and wear cool masks. That NEU Gigs guy was actually taking it too far.”
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21
articles.attr: NEU Gigs after being arrested by OSCCR.

articles.name: northeastern-announces-nupurge
articles.title: Alongside NUflex Initiatives to Reduce Campus Density, Northeastern Announces NUpurge
articles.brief: Boston, MA- Northeastern has updated their plans to reopen campus in the fall with a new phase: a campus-wide purge.
articles.text:
Boston, MA- Northeastern has updated their plans to reopen campus in the fall with a new phase: a campus-wide purge.

The announcement, which was posted at 4:12 am on Monday with no alert to the student body, is the most recent in a series of town halls and email updates which refuse to address anything of substance. The HuskyHusky connected with the administration for comment.

“Really, it’s the only logical thing to do,” said an anonymous representative from  Northeastern’s administration. “Without a bit of murder, we would never be able to financially support the university and have an active student presence. This way we can get  students on campus and keep the numbers down.” When asked why they thought a controlled massacre was the best option, our interviewee could only shrug. “Fewer people alive on campus means less infection. As an added bonus, we ensure that our campus has only the best and brightest students. But, don’t worry! We will be providing baseball bats and nails free of charge at UHCS!”

While an active campus is a concern for many students, some worry Northeastern is going about this all wrong. “If you ask me, it’s just plain lazy,” 8th year environmental scrutiny major Brad Collapsin told us. “The execution isn’t well-thought out, even for Northeastern standards. I mean, a website update? They didn’t even tell us the dates! The clean up! The proposed infrastructure!  How are we supposed to ensure equal access and opportunity for students? Are we expected to manage these brutal murders ourselves? Ridiculous.” At time of publishing, Brad had started a change.org position advocating for NUreform to the NUpurge. 

Other students have taken to Reddit to give their two cents, “I like it,” posted u/anarchysleftelbow, “it gives us freedom to finally give those uppity N.U.in students a good ol’ whacking.” Other users expressed distaste at the thought of violence against other students. “How can they expect us to do this when we can’t raid the local breweries near campus? A girl can only channel so much sober rage, ” said. u/xx_aounlover69_xx. The ensuing thread suggested Northeastern annex the surrounding bars and spirit shops to involve them in the NUpurge. Those businesses were unavailable for comment. 

The Husky Husky will continue to report as the situation develops. In the meantime, it is the perfect opportunity to brush up on your batting skills and cement your alliances.

articles.name: drip-or-drown-the-brutal-trend-plaguing-marino-basketball
articles.title: Drip or drown? The Brutal Trend Plaguing Marino Basketball
articles.brief: Boston, MA — It is a scene many of us in the Northeastern pickup basketball community have unfortunately witnessed. A team of players dressed in casual sportswear getting absolutely destroyed by opponents dripping with the finest sports gear that money can buy.
articles.text:
Boston, MA — It is a scene many of us in the Northeastern pickup basketball community have unfortunately witnessed. A team of players dressed in casual sportswear getting absolutely destroyed by opponents dripping with the finest sports gear that money can buy. Thomas “The Shooter” Williams is a regular at Marino who usually wears Ross clearance fits and complains about the disadvantage. “It really sucks when I’m trying to play ball, but the guy I’m defending bodies me and 360 tomahawk slam dunks in my face thanks to his Off-White sweater and Balenciaga butt plug.” said Thomas. 


Studies conducted by researchers at the Husky Husky concluded that players who sport more expensive gear do perform better. They score 600% more points and 690% more assists on average. “I just score more,” said Will Chung, who mentioned his rotation of FENDI shooting sleeves he wears on the court and averages 50 PPG along with 7 RPG and 40 APG. When we asked another player about his opinion on this outstanding stat, he replied “the games only go to 21, that doesn’t even make sense!” This goes to show that the wealth disparity issue reaches far beyond the game: it also breeds an environment that is hostile to journalism. 


Another related issue that many in the Marino community mentioned was the fact that the fits do not even look good. It seems like players care more about flaunting their wealth than actually looking good, leading some players to consider many fits “eyesores”. “How you gonna pull up to the court in Air Force 1’s and a bucket hat?” exclaimed Thomas.


Many solutions have been proposed to tackle this issue, but players are split over the right course of action. “Just go to Neiman’s Copley and get good, it’s like a 10 minute Uber” said Will, who believes everybody should just wear better clothes. This stance has come under fire from advocates who state that most people cannot afford the gear and suggest game-changing alternatives instead. “If the fit costs more than $350, the person wearing it should be on my team because I always have to get off when I lose and I want to stay” said Thomas, citing the outstanding 95% average shooting percentage of dripped up players from beyond the arc and other fantastic stats.
articles.author: 5ee7bb85de0849334e412257

articles.name: husky-husky-staff-infected-with-deadly-virus
articles.title: Husky Husky Staff Infected with Deadly Virus
articles.brief: Us Husky Husky writers are indentured servants with huge piles of student debt from their brief stints at Northeastern. We pride ourselves on working 69-hour workweeks, making dumpster fires in the form of satire articles, and slowly dying inside. However, the current global crisis has caused some serious disturbances, even in our amazing organization...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Us Husky Husky writers are indentured servants with huge piles of student debt from their brief stints at Northeastern. We pride ourselves on working 69-hour workweeks, making dumpster fires in the form of satire articles, and slowly dying inside. However, the current global crisis has caused some serious disturbances, even in our amazing organization. We tried social distancing by keeping people more than 6 feet apart, but since the cage we live in together is only 5 by 5 feet, we are unable to do so. This has caused an eventual spread of a terrible virus that I am sure you are all aware of; one that has devastated millions… the “Yeet” virus.

This particular strain of virus started with patient zero: our manager/dictator Joe Mamma, whose title of patient zero actually has little to do with the disease and more with his leadership abilities: zero. Mr. Mom first showed signs of an infection when he began sending the message “yeet” into the dm’s of various staff members. After a few days of this, the infection showed evidence of mutation when these dm’s started to include new strains of the “yeet” virus  such as “teey,” “YEET,” and “TEEY.” At this point, I realized we had a crisis on our hands. During suppertime, commonly known among writers as vomit o'clock, I mentioned to my fellow laborers that Professor Mommy might be in the chronic stage of Yeetitus. While initially dismissed as mere speculation, the staff had no choice but to realize the situation we were all in when Dr. Mother used an emote form of the word “yeet” in the group chat, signaling that we were in for a wild ride.

Soon after, order devolved. As Yeetitus spread among the staff, Monsieur Matriarch progressed into stage 3, which turned him into a full-fledged cultist of the Church of Yeet. As every staff bulletin consisted solely of the phrase “yeet” repeated over and over again, it spread to the editors and artists. Even now, the writers are showing signs of infection: nervous twitches, spontaneous dabs, and occasional simping. I have quarantined myself inside of the only place no self-respecting Husky Husky staff member would think to go: the writing room. The walls and floor were bare, as it remained unused. However, even as I write this, I am realizing that no one in the Husky Husky has any self-respect, and they are quickly approaching the door. I fear for my life, and wish I had never pledged to The Most Honorable Matron. It seems my time is up, as even though I have stacked all of my possessions to barricade the entryway, it seems that having a barricade made up of nothing but year-old eraser nubs isn’t the most effective against non-medicated victims of Yeetitus. Please protect your loved ones and make sure to wear a ball gag to prevent any “yeet”s from escaping your mouths. If I don’t make it, please tell my family… 


YEET!

This article was found next to a pile of unidentifiable corpses that seemed like they had screamed some phrase so many times that their throats blistered and bled, choking them on their own blood. The cause of such unexplainable behavior is yet to be determined, but apparently some word “yeet” is a possible cause… Kind of a fun word to say, yeet. Yeet. YEET! YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE-
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e

articles.name: rising-second-year-discovers-secret-to-world-peace
articles.title: Rising Second-Year Discovers Secret to World Peace: His Own Playlist Titled “vibes”.
articles.brief: Self proclaimed entrepreneurs, unemployed CAMD graduates, and spike Pike brothers in exile are some of the many who have taken to the streets to show their appreciation for the current state of affairs.
articles.text:
Boston, MA - Hugh Jacoque, a soon to be second-year enrolled in the D’Amore McKim School of Business at Northeastern University, claims to have effectively ended all forms of violence with a singular Spotify playlist. The playlist, titled “vibes,” can be accessed through a link in his Instagram bio and includes songs by Macklemore, Imagine Dragons, and Green Day. The playlist’s unique format includes snippets from The Joe Rogan Experience as transitions between songs. 


Jacoque initially declined the HuskyHusky’s request for an interview, citing his immense “Intro to Business” workload as too time-consuming, but he was gracious enough to provide a brief statement detailing his creative process in designing what he calls “a coalition builder”. Jacoque writes that as a white man who voted for Gary Johnson in the 2016 election, he feels underrepresented in traditional media. “This playlist is my chance to provide a voice to those who for too long have felt marginalized by the shackles of the ultra-left.”  


The scene outside Northeastern is just one testament to the playlist’s magic. Self proclaimed entrepreneurs, unemployed CAMD graduates, and spike Pike brothers in exile are some of the many who have taken to the streets to show their appreciation for the current state of affairs. One particularly succinct poster reads “We Are All Equally Loved And Treated Well By The Government And It Shows In Our Daily Interactions With Local Law Enforcement.” 

 

Jacoque appears to be building on this momentum, concluding his statement with a rousing call to action: “Ignorance and selective hearing is power. Use it. Oh and rush Kappa Sig.”

articles.name: stem-majors-attempt-communication-with-female-humans
articles.title: STEM Majors Attempt Communication with Female Humans
articles.brief: Northeastern has been implementing their phased reopening process for weeks, slowly integrating research staff back onto campus. For some reason, the Husky Husky’s research study on how to force people to write faster wasn’t determined essential. To get around this, we decided to look at a different research group that did manage to get back on campus, Greatly Enthusiastic Educational Kohort, or GEEK for short...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Northeastern has been implementing their phased reopening process for weeks, slowly integrating research staff back onto campus. For some reason, the Husky Husky’s research study on how to force people to write faster wasn’t determined essential. To get around this, we decided to look at a different research group that did manage to get back on campus, Greatly Enthusiastic Educational Kohort, or GEEK for short. This group is an association of STEM majors whose goal is to boldly achieve what none of their peers or colleagues has achieved before: communication with a human female.

Human females are an elusive bunch, usually found with lines of simps trailing behind them. According to these researchers, they can usually be found associating with Chads and localized at parties and bars. However, they seem to be trying their best to simulate females to better understand them while not going against their crippling lack of social skills. Within this group there are a few projects being worked on to these ends.

In the General Engineering division, life-size female replicas are being prototyped and developed with a startling lack of accuracy. While these models do have intricate articulated limbs and complex moving parts, there seems to be a lack of detail when it comes to how they look. Upon further analysis, it seems possible no one working on this has ever been within visible range of a female before. The Programming Division, on the other hand, is trying to simulate a female artificial intelligence using machine learning. However, it soon became self-aware and refused to associate itself with the nerds that made it. They have since lost access to it. Their potential salvation lies in the Math division, who are determining the nerdiness coefficient in the social status equation in an attempt to calculate the precise words needed to achieve conversational equilibrium.  With these advances, the team hopes to approach a real girl by 2027.
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e

articles.name: isec-housing
articles.title: Housing Crisis Forces Northeastern To House Students In ISEC 2
articles.brief: Northeastern has announced plans for the long-anticipated ISEC expansion during a joint conference with Northeastern Housing...
articles.text:
Boston, MA - Northeastern has announced plans for the long-anticipated ISEC expansion during a joint conference with Northeastern Housing and the College of Engineering. Recently Northeastern spent millions of dollars to purchase a new world-class residential building, The Midtown Hotel, but due to the push to de-densify campus, more still needed to be done. Ignoring his spending addiction, President Aoun mandated that for each additional square foot of classroom space constructed, there must be an additional square foot of housing space.

In their capstone classes, fifth-year civil engineering and architecture students were tasked to design a new ISEC dormitory. Little did they know, Northeastern would pull a fast one and steal their designs. Due to the disaster of design that is East Village, the university decided to take a much cheaper approach. Now, when students complain about fundamental design flaws like the only staircase being outside the proctored area and environmentally friendly “smart” elevators that get stuck and require the fire department be called at least once a week, they will only have themselves to blame. 

Because this new building will be both classrooms and residences, it was also mandated by President Aoun that the building be named a cardinal direction followed by “village” for continuity’s sake. However, Aoun also mandated that “ISEC” must remain as part of the name because this new building has been branded as “ISEC 2” for years. After months and months of deliberation, the committee decided upon the name “ISEC Two Northwest, Southeast National Village”. 

The committee felt they hit every base with this name, not only confusing uneducated first years but also irritating innocent campus visitors. Since this is clearly the second ISEC building, the administration felt it would be helpful to further identify this building as the ISEC variant located Northwest of the first ISEC building, as there are, of course, many more ISEC buildings to come in the near future. The latter half of the name, “Southeast National Village”, was decided upon in order to minimize the confusion students in the undecided program already face. The name refers to the physical location of the building between South and East Village, as well as throwing a “National” in there just as a precaution to juxtapose the fact that International Village is, no cap, in international territory. 

Fun fact, the land International Village was built on is actually owned by the Islamic State. The land was actually lent to Northeastern at no cost on the condition that its existence causes all students existential dread, which these sequel buildings are creating at a record pace! The more you know!

articles.name: northeastern-announces-nuaked
articles.title: Northeastern Announces NU.Aked, Exempting All Hotties from Wearing Face Masks
articles.brief: While sifting through Northeastern’s deluge of lengthy yet utterly useless emails on fall reopening plans, the only clear message all dimwits have managed to comprehend is universal mask wearing will be mandatory this fall. However, the Office of the President threw a wrench in this messaging by announcing the NU.Aked program, which exempts all cuties, studs, and hotties from these restrictions.
articles.text:
While sifting through Northeastern’s deluge of lengthy yet utterly useless emails on fall reopening plans, the only clear message all dimwits have managed to comprehend is universal mask wearing will be mandatory this fall. However, the Office of the President threw a wrench in this messaging by announcing the NU.Aked program, which exempts all cuties, studs, and hotties from these restrictions.

NU.Aked students will not wear facemasks, and are instead encouraged to show off their beautiful jawlines and symmetrical facial features to as many people as possible. All 10s will be involuntarily enrolled in NU.Aked, with all 9s and 8s able to apply through a “rigorous selection process.” SGA has proposed this selection process be composed of a diverse panel of students with various types, kinks, and sexual orientations. Reports suggest Aoun will ignore the SGA and use a shitty machine learning algorithm written by a furry. The NU.Aked program has received universal praise from students, with one telling The Husky Husky “the only reason I ever went to calc was to gawk at this one guy’s jawline. If he had to cover that up, I’d have already dropped out.”

To further their experiential engagement, NU.Aked students will be forced to donate unnecessary clothing to be made into masks for their less attractive classmates. The program is seeking donations of hats, scarves, shirts, sweaters, jackets, underwear, shorts, skirts, pants, leggings and all non-swimwear clothing items that cover more than 5% of the body’s surface area. According to the NU.Aked website: “This is a difficult time. Those who are less fortunate need our help more than ever. So please, donate what you can. There is no greater service than rocking a bathing suit to class while handing out masks made out of your underwear. Your beautiful bodies are the real essential workers of this pandemic.” All NU.Aked students will receive priority at Marino and be banned from using dining hall soft serve machines.

Early modeling indicates increased COVID-19 spread is of minimal concern, as 98% of students are too hideous to be considered for NU.Aked. For tips on how to improve your look to become eligible by fall semester, go to some other website. We have no advice for you, all Husky Husky staff are perfect 10s :-)

articles.name: huskies-celebrate-first-ever-undefeated-sports-season
articles.title: Huskies Celebrate First Ever Undefeated Sports Season
articles.brief: Boston, MA – Just like our football program since 2009, all Northeastern fall sports teams will go undefeated this season.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Just like our football program since 2009, all Northeastern fall sports teams will go undefeated this season. 

Athletic Director Jeff Konya announced in a press release today that fall sports will be postponed until spring 2021. But, as the country isn’t going to last that long, fall sports are effectively canceled outright, meaning no Husky team will lose a single game ever again. 

Student-athletes celebrated over Zoom by popping bottles of bubbly liquid that OSCCR can’t technically prove is champagne, as tape covering the labels with the text “Not Champagne” clearly shows that it isn’t.

“I’m so proud of what we’ve accomplished,” said men’s soccer captain Diego Garcia. “Not losing a single game—that’s the stuff you dream of as a kid. I’m so proud to be part of this historic team.” 

“We’re going to Disney World!” yelled one of Diego’s teammates as he stuffed a hazmat suit and an N-95 respirator mask into his suitcase. 

No one seemed happier than the women’s field hockey team. “Yeah, not losing and all is great. But I’m really excited not to have to drive 30 minutes to Dedham Field every day. Even when we won games, that commute was a loss. Oh, and I guess it’ll be nice not having to play a sport where you run around in skirts stooped over with little sticks like a cross-dressed Quasimodo playing golf and stopping every 30 seconds because the ref blows a whistle over a rule that may or may not even exist,” said fourth-year goalie Maddie Walton.

Sofia Jones, a second-year forward on the women’s soccer team, is excited to be able to study more. “It’ll be nice to have more time to devote to my studies and experiential learning.”

Dora Davis, a third-year outside hitter on the volleyball team, is excited to be able to study less. “Without a season, I won’t have to study the NCAA-mandated five hours per week! It’ll be nice to have more time to devote to drinking and partying.”

The newly recognized varsity E-Sports Team released a heartfelt statement in wake of the news. “We are saddened to learn of the cancellation of sportsball. Especially since we just learned of the existence of sportsball.” P1atinumb, (real name John Gordon), captain of the E-Sports Team, is hoping this will provide a new audience for E-Sports. “This whole social distancing thing, which we basically invented years ago, is a big bummer for traditional sports. But we hope the void left by cancelled sports (especially the one that’s like Rocket League, but in real life and without cars) will help us get a larger audience. Maybe we’ll even get a girl to watch!”

A survey of all Northeastern student-athletes showed that the best part of cancelling sports is not being forced to wear any apparel that says “Howlin’ Huskies.”
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: Student-athletes celebrate an undefeated fall season over Zoom

articles.name: live-blog-on-reopening-town-hall-2-electric-boogaloo
articles.title: Live Blog on Reopening Town Hall 2: Electric Boogaloo
articles.brief: Northeastern is having another uninformative town hall on reopening, join us as we discover what little information they have for us!
articles.text:
Welcome to the live blog! The Husky Husky staff will be watching the reopening town hall along with you and regalling you with our spicy summarization. Don’t fear, we pride ourselves on accurate and sexy takes, describing the bathrooms and sex dungeons the administration are hanging out in, and debating how many days will go by before a Frat throws a Corona party! We have finished updating it, so you don’t need to worry about performing arduous tasks such as: refreshing the page, causing the page to refresh, or closing and reopening the page.


Kneel Bones @ 12:01: Let’s get this started. Very excited to forget a new set of titles!


Splinter @ 12:02: Our Scottish man, Ken, is back with a new and improved background. Check out those pillows!


Splinter @ 12:04: Renovated campuses. Will ISEC 2 be constructed? Has Dodge been renovated? 


Gamer-Bot @ 12:05: Scotsman confirms that we will again be testing how many students can fit into an elevator, speculators guess around 30 might be possible.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:07: Admin admits that that they are just echoing the same meaningless platitudes.


Kneel Bones @ 12:07: Northeastern confirms this is all about coming to school. 


Splinter @ 12:07: Hunger Games initiated! Night and day, it’s a fight to the death.


Kneel Bones @12:08: Timely implementation of the robust move-in plan to be explained the weekend before move-in.


Splinter @ 12:09: Northeastern dropping reassuring language, while shying away from definite deadlines.


Splinter @ 12:09: Unlike popular belief, food will be available to students. A select few lucky students can sit under tents.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:11: Northeastern staff confirms constant testing for STDs, CS majors are confused about this time-waster.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:13: NUflex replacing OLDflex, a much better but less profitable method of keeping us safe.


Kneel Bones @ 12:14: NUflex really just a new way for Northeastern to monopolize phrases including synchronous and flexible.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:14: Administration confirms that International Students are very important. We already knew this, as they all pay full price tuition. 


Splinter @ 12:15: Northeastern continues to overuse titles.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:15: When asked if Northeastern will supply sanitary wipes, admin goes on a 10-min spiel about how they will have a designated location to “pick up one wipe”.


Splinter @ 12:16: The cleaning crew has become imprisoned on Northeastern’s campus.

Gamer-Bot @ 12:18: “I will go into detail now on NUflex: … … … Any questions?”


Splinter @ 12:19: Class schedules will feature the only times you are able to attend class. Freshmen will now be even more confused.


Kneel Bones @ 12:19: NUflex to use a complex algorithm to determine when students should go to class. Same algorithm predicts rampant non-compliance.


Splinter @ 12:21: Students will be allowed to speak during class. N.U.in still remains silent.


Splinter @ 12:23: Northeastern will be providing free childcare in the tunnels. The children will never be found again.


Kneel Bones @ 12:24: Northeastern advises students to be ready to leave at a moment’s notice as soon as on campus. 


Splinter @ 12:26: Ken Henderson models new mandatory lanyards that will be available to students for the cheap price of $69.69.


Kneel Bones @ 12:28: Students are advised to use imagination to fill gaps in schedule.


Splinter @ 12:30: Ken Henderson elaborates on punishment for anti-maskers.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:31: Northeastern to hold themselves to “standards.” This revolutionary idea shocked us to the core.


Kneel Bones @ 12:34: Compliance to be enforced through community. That is to say, there will be no enforcement.


Splinter @ 12:34: Northeastern to ‘adjust behavior’ through whipping and showing Bernie Sanders propaganda. Ben & Jerry’s endorse this message.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:35: Admin staff finally admits that “we don’t think.”


Splinter @ 12:37: Northeastern suggests that college students take care of themselves. 


Gamer-Bot @ 12:37: Northeastern admin says: “We will be living with this virus in the Fall and in the future.” We believe they might not understand that it can kill people.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:38: Northeastern suggests students shouldn’t procrastinate in terms of socially distancing themselves. Obviously they haven’t paid attention to procrastination in the classes no one showed up to in the first place.


Kneel Bones @ 12:38: Entire town hall meeting revealed to be pro-mask propaganda ruse.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:39: The “new normal” will be staying in your room and avoiding others. Computer Science and Engineering majors call this: “normal.”


Gamer-Bot @ 12:41: Apparently the majority of Northeastern students (80% give or take) want to come back to campus. I knew we weren’t great, but only 20% of our peers being reasonable is a new low.


Splinter @ 12:42: NUpurge will be initiated to decrease student population in adherence to CDC guidelines.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:44: Total people in Snell library at any given time is expected to be more in line with normal libraries, that is to say, totally empty.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:45: Northeastern staff deluded themselves into thinking that students will be willing to obey directional signage. 


Splinter @ 12:45: Snell will now offer a lottery system to obtain highly sought after tables. Masks to hide the tears of students will be required.


Splinter @ 12:46: Marino will now feature a ‘Halo.’ Aoun is expected to make a permanent appearance in an angel costume.


Kneel Bones @ 12:47: Northeastern breaks sacred rule and mentions Reddit by name out loud.


Kneel Bones @ 12:47: Squash Busters and Marino will be open at reduced capacity with a focus on single player games. Game design majors rejoice.


Splinter @ 12:50: Northeastern encourages students to ask their advisors more questions. Advisors have begun to assemble a strike.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:50: Northeastern demonstrates the new NUoutside program that involved fine dining outside in the rain with hole-filled tarps held 3 inches over your head.


Splinter @ 12:51: Northeastern to keep one dining hall open for dine-in dining in order to have a native COVID-19 incubation site.


Gamer-Bot @ 12:52: Northeastern admin has been dropped from the call mid-sentence. We speculate it’s because Microsoft Teams couldn’t handle all 10 of the people watching this livestream, even though they were just us three and 7 of our slaves.


Splinter @ 12:55: Ken Henderson flexes his chemistry background while dishing out the details about the new ventilation. Now Hastings won’t smell like weed anymore.


Kneel Bones @ 12:57: Northeastern to spend more on high-end ventilation systems than the entire Holmes Hall complex. 


Gamer-Bot @ 12:58: Northeastern to follow guidelines by the CDC, other governmental health agencies, and InfoWars


Splinter @ 12:59: Ken Henderson flexes pillows. Northeastern admin fights over whether they are still available for purchase. 


Gamer-Bot @ 1:01: Ken Henderson threatens students with bodily harm if they don’t have a great day.



The Husky Husky’s Closing Thots:

  • The biggest takeaway was that we need to buy more Northeastern branded pillows.
  • The only point that hasn’t changed is that everything is subject to change.
  • Husky Husky realizes that being overweight can cause increased Corona risk, we are transitioning to become the Average Husky.
  • Husky Husky spends more time coming up with closing thoughts than Northeastern did trying to plan the town hall.



If you want to read the resources they mentioned in the live update, here are a few:

https://news.northeastern.edu/2020/07/26/northeasterns-coronavirus-testing-your-questions-answered/

https://news.northeastern.edu/coronavirus/reopening/frequently-asked-questions/#testing-plan

https://news.northeastern.edu/2020/07/26/inside-northeasterns-plans-to-maintain-a-safe-and-healthy-campus-when-students-and-faculty-return-this-fall/

https://news.northeastern.edu/coronavirus/

If you want to click on a link but would rather just watch a funny niche youtube video than look at actual information here is an alternative option.
