articles.name: new-petition-calls-for-removal-of-king-husky-statue-over-allegations-he-was-not-a-good-doggo
articles.title: New Petition Calls for Removal of King Husky Statue Over Allegations He Was Not a Good Doggo
articles.brief: Cancel culture claims another victim in the form of the oft-beloved statue of King Husky residing in Ell Hall. Amid other relatively unimportant petitions for the removal of statues that no one knew existed before the petition, a new one has surfaced on Change.org after allegations that the dog depicted in the statue wasn’t a “good boy.” This is quite a serious accusation, and as such we at the Husky Husky decided to interview Northeastern staff and students to get their thoughts...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Cancel culture claims another victim in the form of the oft-beloved statue of King Husky residing in Ell Hall. Amid other relatively unimportant petitions for the removal of statues that no one knew existed before the petition, a new one has surfaced on Change.org after allegations that the dog depicted in the statue wasn’t a “good boy.” This is quite a serious accusation, and as such we at the Husky Husky decided to interview Northeastern staff and students to get their thoughts.

During an interview with Northeastern Student Chad Johnston, we asked what came to mind when we showed him the statue. He said “Man, that’s the statue I came on the other day!” After quickly moving away from the statue we asked him who would be shameless enough to have sex with him in such a public area. He quickly clarified that he was simply masturbating to the statue, which is totally understandable. However, further analysis with a forensic blacklight showed the entire statue was glowing, implying that this wasn’t Chad’s first foray into bestiality. We also found a pamphlet with dates listed for upcoming furry activities such as conventions, meet-ups, and orgies. He must have forgotten this at the statue and we have taken it with us for safekeeping.

To get a different view, we asked Karen Ann Oyalot, a self titled “Professional Protester” currently pursuing her PhD in underwater basket weaving while serving as a guest lecturer for Virtue Signaling 101. Karen said that while she was not previously aware of the petition, “even just the allegation is serious enough that the statue – no, the entire building – needs to be demolished this instant!” When asked why destroying an entire building on Northeastern’s campus was the best course of action over an accusation, she responded with: “Oh, Northeastern? Sorry, I actually am a guest lecturer at Northwestern, not Northeastern.” Needless to say, that totally invalidated her otherwise outstanding academic reputation, and we immediately stopped talking with her, citing our moral superiority over Neanderthals such as her, along with her campus’ lack of a cult icon as sexually stimulating as our lord and savior Aoun. 

We did some final polling of our own staff to make sure to include all relevant opinions. While the survey clearly showed people who felt both ways, we made sure to kick all people against the petition off of the staff in order to make our numbers support the removal of the statue. This is actually not because we dislike the statue, it is merely that we have acquired the contract to remove the statue, and want the statue to be our new Husky Husky mascot, although we’d have to feed it lots of Rebeccas before it becomes sufficiently Husky.


At the time of publication, it seems that the petition is picking up lots of steam after a series of angry twitter bots run by Karen ranted for at least 3 seconds each. While there are a mere 666 signatures on the petition to coat the statue with gold to preserve Chad’s markings forever, the number of signatures to destroy the statue have actually tripled to 69 total! 

Shortly after publication, we found out that Chad had actually made 46 alts to get it to 69 votes. The reasoning for this was: “Haha, funny sex number.”
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Husky statue protested by totally rational and normal individual

articles.name: husky-husky-hack-reveals-northeasterns-closeted-robots
articles.title: Husky Husky Hack Reveals Northeastern's Closeted Robots
articles.brief: The Husky Husky staff was surprised to observe a cry for help from the Goose Liberation Army and gathered elite hackers to shed more light on what is actually happening on the Boston campus.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Northeastern University has been unremarkably uninformative about the true status of the Boston campus (who cares about the other ones anyway?) since evicting its students in March. To fill the void, some cybersecurity students have spent their limited waking hours spying through the grainy campus webcams while fantasizing about the only people who willingly interact with them—Jehovah’s Witnesses. The Husky Husky staff was surprised to also observe a cry for help from the Goose Liberation Army and gathered elite hackers to shed more light on what is actually happening on the Boston campus.


The first bid for new intelligence came through abducting and reprogramming the government’s spy pigeons into the personal spies of the Husky Husky. However, our plan was soon proven fruitless due to King Husky II’s return to Northeastern after annihilating Boston University’s campus. He has since been occupying himself with lobbying for ISEC 6, worshipping the Ell Hall husky statue, and crucifying the spy pigeons we painstakingly reprogrammed. What a baddie. 


Undeterred, the Husky Husky planted spy cams throughout the entire campus including Aoun’s private office and bathroom to ensure no secrets were left uncovered. Alas, Aoun’s behavior was deemed so hot and sweaty that the server crashed and left Husky Husky staffers with no blackmail material, but a plethora of mentally scarring imagery to take to the numerous highly competent UHCS therapists.


Frustrated, but far from finished, the Husky Husky staff decided to summon their collective Nokia Space Impact skills and Excel Pivot Table proficiency (you can check our LinkedIns as proof!) to hack NASA’s satellites. It was only a matter of minutes before the satellites were in the hands of the staff members and employed for surveillance of the entire Northeastern University campus. Unlike the cowardly administration of Northeastern and its shitty webcams, the Husky Husky has decided to take a brave stance and share its findings with the wider student body. Although Chicken Lou’s packed its bags and yeeted themselves the fuck out, other inhabitants have been seen moving in. NUPD officers, suffering from exhaustion after having to walk two whole blocks to Dunkin Donuts since the on-campus location temporarily closed, have decided to take a break by filling Centennial with the unholy sight of their sunbathing. Rhett, BU’s yappy mascot, has also been spotted seeking refuge within the tunnels to avoid being caught and renamed something BU’s President deems not connected to the “American Civil War, postwar reconstruction, and slavery” (Brown, 2020). The Goose Liberation Army is practicing military exercises that range in scale from overhead bird poop drops to Taekwondo wing attacks. Their phenomenal antihuman strategy is hindered only by a lone sniper from East Village’s 17th floor. Upon closer inspection, it is possible to see that the event space has been transformed into a showcase for taxidermied trophies mounted on the walls, with the particularly suspicious sniper stroking each of them in turn. Wait, why does he look so familiar? That smile… those glasses… who could it be other than Aoun?! But why does he seem to look worse than a tin man, his joints creaking as he turns to showcase his perpetual smile and his dimly-lit eye… sockets? Wait, could it be that he is actually a —


This manuscript was found next to the corpse of a Husky Husky writer. A single hole was found in their head, but the cause of death may have been a sexual overload from staring at such an attractive all-powerful being. Perhaps there is a second meaning to the need to be robot-proof. NASA’s satellites have since been recovered by the Space Force.
articles.author: 5f150107d19e260835fecb5a

articles.name: florida-man-hurricane-isaias
articles.title: Northeastern Hires Florida Man to Give Tips and Tricks for Surviving Hurricane Isaias
articles.brief: As some of you may know, Hurricane Isaias is fast approaching the Florida coastline. Since the Northeastern administration only sets foot in Florida to escape the Boston winter, they are in no position to advise NU Floridian students about how to prepare for a hurricane. Instead, they have hired an officially certified Florida Man™ to provide guidance to those who might be affected. We have been given a chance to interview him, and have provided the transcript here...
articles.text:
Miami, FL – As some of you may know, Hurricane Isaias is fast approaching the Florida coastline. Since the Northeastern administration only sets foot in Florida to escape the Boston winter, they are in no position to advise NU Floridian students about how to prepare for a hurricane. Instead, they have hired an officially certified Florida Man™ to provide guidance to those who might be affected. We have been given a chance to interview him, and have provided the transcript here.

Gamer-Bot: “Hello there, Mr. Florida Man Sir. May I ask you first why you decided to pursue such a career?”

Florida Man: “As a young’un, I failed out of school and begged for money on a street corner, but one blessed day a news van stopped and asked to talk to me, and ever since I’ve made a living by living the traditional lifestyle of a Florida Man.”

Gamer-Bot: “What college did you fail out of, and have you decided if you want to go back to pursue an education later?”

Florida Man: “Oh, that’s hilarious! You—you think I went to college? Ha! I went to air guitar school immediately after passing middle school, and I wouldn’t even spend two nickels and a single tinfoil hat on no daggum college.”

Gamer-Bot: “Uh… ok. Anyway, what advice do you have for Northeastern students living in Florida to prepare for Hurricane Isaias?”

Florida Man: “Quite tricky beasts, hurricanes are. I’d say that Isaias is a bit of a weakling, so nothing to worry about. Just a Category 1 hurricane.”

Gamer-Bot: “Category 1 hurricanes have 74 to 95 mph winds though. Isn’t that dangerous?”

Florida Man: “Eh, less than 100 mph is nothing to worry about. I drive faster than that all the time. Anyway, if you’re really a scaredy-cat I guess you could do what us Floridians do for the serious hurricanes.”

Gamer-Bot: “And what is that? Putting up hurricane shutters? Purchasing supplies?”

Florida Man: “No you idiot. The hell are shutters? You take your 20-foot-long American flag and wave it about outside your trailer-house when the hurricane makes landfall. That way the hurricane knows we are Americans and won’t tolerate any no-good hurricane in our country. Then, it’ll turn around and leave to bother Mexico or some other dumb place.”

Gamer-Bot: “I hate to correct you, but I was born and raised in Florida, and I’ve never heard anyone confirm this method works. This seems very dangerous and inadvisable.”

Florida Man: “You can’t be a Floridian, you don’t even have a pet alligator!”

The interview was cut short as the Florida Man pulled a full-grown alligator out of his left pocket and it proceeded to eat the entire interviewing staff (including Gamer-Bot.) After his pet’s afternoon snack, the Florida Man rode off to battle the hurricane on his majestic alligator steed.
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Florida Man Playing the National Anthem Outside During a Hurricane

articles.name: northeastern-tunnel-construction-inadvertently-awakens-the-balrog-of-morgoth
articles.title: Northeastern Tunnel Construction Inadvertently Awakens the Balrog of Morgoth
articles.brief: Run! Flee!”  	Aoun burst out of the hallway, flanked on both sides by Northeastern Students in full hockey gear. “We must keep the Hobbits safe!” shouted Aoun towards Paws and the other normal-sized members of the fellowship, his voice faint against the harsh sound of scrambling feet...
articles.text:
“Run! Flee!”


Aoun burst out of the hallway, flanked on both sides by Northeastern Students in full hockey gear. “We must keep the Hobbits safe!” shouted Aoun towards Paws and the other normal-sized members of the fellowship, his voice faint against the harsh sound of scrambling feet. 

“We have names, dude,” Objected Nick Scarra, Northeastern’s 5’7” goalkeeper. 

“I’m 6 feet tall! I’m not a hobbit!” Squeaked Jordan Harris, Northeastern’s 5’11”  defensive captain. The diminutive Hobbits - fear forgotten - moved angrily towards Aoun, only to be stopped in their tracks

Doom.

Doom.

Doom - the drumbeats rolled over the assembled party, thundering throughout the cavernous hall they found themselves in. Then, a horn - and the rapid sound of an approaching horde. Curry had become a deathtrap. The once-sweet taste of Popeyes turned to ash in the mouths of the gathered fellowship. 

Doom.

Doom.

Doom - as the sound of the drumbeats, reverberated up the floor into the very minds of the now still party. “They are coming!” cried Scarra. “We cannot get out,” lamented Harris, who again, is a hobbit. “Trapped!” cried Aoun. “Why did I delay? Why did I wait to build ISEC 2 before the end?” 

“Bar the gates - lock the Starbucks!” cried 6’4 Jeremie Bucheler, the only non-manlet on the entire Northeastern Hockey team. “No!” shouted Aoun. “The library is our only chance of escape! They don't know how to read. Keep the Northern Gate open!”

Another harsh horn-call and shrill cries rang out. Feet were coming down the corridor. The rank smell of beer and defeat seeped into the room. The B.U. students had broken in. 


Find out what happens in the next exciting edition of Lord of the Rings: Fellowship of the Just Kidding Hockey Players Don’t Get Fellowships
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
articles.attr: Pictured: Aoun and the Fellowship burst into a corridor, pursued by an ancient demon of unimaginable evil.

articles.name: vape-mask
articles.title: Northeastern grad student invents a brand-new innovative product for college students: Vape Mask.
articles.brief: Vapes are obviously a college staple, and the need for masks in public has caused issues among Northeastern students. After all, how can you expect immature almost-adults with crippling debt not to throw away tons of time and money ingesting addictive substances? That’s really what college is all about: saddling students with tons of debt in exchange for providing them plenty of educational opportunities to ignore while filling the time spent between parties and casual sex. One engineering grad student, Pablo E. Skabar, has decided to capitalize on this hole in the market...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Vapes are obviously a college staple, and the need for masks in public has caused issues among Northeastern students. After all, how can you expect immature almost-adults with crippling debt not to throw away tons of time and money ingesting addictive substances? That’s really what college is all about: saddling students with tons of debt in exchange for providing them plenty of educational opportunities to ignore while filling the time spent between parties and casual sex. 

One engineering grad student, Pablo E. Skabar, has decided to capitalize on this hole in the market. After mere minutes of work, mainly ripping off actually talented designers, Pablo has developed the Vape Mask™. This mask is made up of a single ball gag stolen from a prolific sex toy designer with a hole cut out and a vape hot-glued in. This keeps your mouth entirely sealed, and since the vape is positioned to block off airflow to your nose, all of your breathing is going through the vape.

This patented NoOxygen technology releases pure nicotine flavored with whatever other chemicals you decide to ingest. Studies have shown that this will give you the best high you will ever have for the rest of your life. This is immediately followed with the total permanent shutdown of your dopamine receivers, after which you will quickly be asphyxiated. Pablo says that this is to be able to guarantee the best high for the rest of your life, and took the idea to Shark Tank.

His initial pitch was centered around it causing lung damage that would go along well with the current trend for students to attempt to contract respiratory illnesses such as Corona. However, Mr. Wonderful trashed it with the only possible criticism, stating that the majority of the target market are beta cucks that would stop vaping in order to breathe. This deficit actually didn’t stop the Sharks from signing a deal with Pablo, as they seemed genuinely interested in investing until they were offered a sample and died shortly after accepting, as they’d rather die a Chad by vaping than chicken out. 

The Husky Husky sampled these masks during a Zoom lecture. While our staffers covered the ball gag vapes with a normal mask, the professor still noticed smoke coming from the staffer’s mouths as their corpses continued to vape long after death. Pablo has since been placed in NUPD custody, but he is expected to be released at the end of the semester and plans on continuing his growing business at that point. This early release is prompted by NUPD realizing that the more students die from this, the fewer they have to fail at protecting!

If you or someone you know has an innovative idea or product that fills a need held by Northeastern students, please submit the idea and any intellectual property associated with it to the Husky Husky so we can steal it and pay off our own crippling debt to the mafia.

articles.name: 5-foot-11-male-with-new-shoes-excited-to-see-how-real-men-live
articles.title: 5 Foot 11 Male With New Shoes Excited to See How Real Men Live
articles.brief: Boston, MA- Timmy Stub never thought the day would come.  After years of insecurity and hardship, he would finally reach the promised land and soar to new heights. 72 inches to be exact.
articles.text:
Boston, MA- Timmy Stub never thought the day would come.  After years of insecurity and hardship, he would finally reach the promised land and soar to new heights. 72 inches to be exact.

Timmy had reached 6ft, all thanks to a new pair of rockin kicks.

Before he bought these shoes, Mr. Stub weighed in at a lowly 5 feet and 10.75 inches tall, however, we all know that means 5’4 and slouching. His evolution from manlet to King is an inspiration to simps everywhere. 

The shoes themselves are a masterpiece of modern times. The drippiest of shoe game, if you will. On the surface, they appear to be normal cherry red vans. Closer inspection, however, reveals a sole that defies expectations. The insole provides a comfortable lift while the treads negate that comfort entirely. The extra material also provides a perfect opportunity for a functional, yet sexy, integrated wheel. 

At the height of his new height, Timmy was kind enough to grace the Husky Husky with an interview.

Transcript to follow.

Kneel Bones: I’m so glad you had the time to speak with us, Timmy. Is there anyone you’d like to thank for making it this far?

Timmy Stub: I’d like to thank everyone except my parents, they did me dirty. Why my mom settled for a 5’5’’ himbo is above-I mean, beyond me.

KB: So, tell us what brought you to this point?

TS: It all started when I was rejected by Ana [redacted] in 5th grade. She was taller than most of the guys in our class, but, being the naive fool that I was, I thought there was a chance.  One day, I worked up the courage to ask if I could sit with her at lunch. I didn’t even finish my sentence. She put her hand up and said: ‘You need a few more inches before you can even look at me.”

KB: That’s devastating. I’m sorry, she ended you, dude. Where did you go from there?

TS: Well, up! My luck didn’t change much through high school. I grew a little, but I had to fudge the height on my dating profiles to even consider getting any response. Of course, everything fell apart when the girl turned out to be eye level with me. But, it’s all going to be different now.

KB: What’s changed?

TS: A sick pair of slips! Half An inch here, half an inch there and now I’m golden. No one will even notice. Now I know all the ladies will be knockin’ on my door. The height brings them in, and then my personality does the rest! I can finally become the Chad I was always meant to be.

KB: That’s good to hear! Dreams do come true. I have to ask, though: what will happen when you take them off?

TS: What do you mean? I can never take them off.

KB: Sure, you will. Unless someone lets you hit it with shoes on.

TS: I can never take them off.

KB: Er, how about when you bathe? When you sleep?

TS: I can’t go back. I can’t. You can’t make me.

KB: Now hold on. No need to-

The interview was short due to a spark of dwarven rage. Testy little shits, aren’t they?

At time of publication, Mr. Stub had returned to the newfound comfort of his modified footwear. While the ladies have not started pouring in yet, he remains hopeful. After all, his personality is impeccable.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f
articles.attr: Timmy Stub rocketing into mediocrity

articles.name: aoun-soon-to-become-more-than-just-a-figurative-snack
articles.title: Aoun Soon to Become More Than Just a Figurative Snack
articles.brief: Coronavirus is now the least of our problems, as a new contagion has recently swept our nation. This pandemic is the knowledge that anything, truly anything, can be a cake. This spread mimics the oft-discussed dress color craze, and once again everyone is unsure of what makes this have any importance at all. Regardless, questions have arisen, after many objects have been confirmed to be cake: your neighbor’s dessert, some baked goods, and even your birthday cake. We at the Husky Husky asked ourselves how we could financially exploit cake, but due to our overwhelming stupidity we were unable to figure it out, and so we asked Daddy Aoun for help...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Coronavirus is now the least of our problems, as a new contagion has recently swept our nation. This pandemic is the knowledge that anything, truly anything, can be a cake. This spread mimics the oft-discussed dress color craze, and once again everyone is unsure of what makes this have any importance at all. Regardless, questions have arisen, after many objects have been confirmed to be cake: your neighbor’s dessert, some baked goods, and even your birthday cake. We at the Husky Husky asked ourselves how we could financially exploit cake, but due to our overwhelming stupidity we were unable to figure it out, and so we asked Daddy Aoun for help.

Aoun is, self-evidently, the most intelligent god to exist in all of Northeastern. We have studied under him for great lengths of time, ranging from minutes to days, some of us even studying for a full week, much more than anything we do for most Northeastern classes. He has revealed some startling insight into this cake phenomenon. Apparently he has inside information from Northeastern researchers that beings made of cake are actually immune to all strains of Covid-19. This all-important tidbit has informed his upcoming policy: NUcake. NUcake is composed of two main parts, the first of which being turning Aoun into a cake monster of utmost deliciousness, and then protecting him from the starving freshman who realized they’d rather die than eat at a dining hall but can’t afford real food. As one such pitiable freshman said: “If I have to eat rubbery eggs or spoiled soup one more time I’ll die. Only the thought of a delicious bite of Daddy Aoun keeps me going. I’ve also already called dibs on his lower half for… culinary reasons.”

However, this requires an increase in the budget, which is where the second part of the policy comes in. Northeastern is opening a baking institute in the lockers residing in the tunnel system. While there is literally nowhere on campus clean enough to cook in, the fact that no one uses the lockers makes them the perfect place to store ingredients such as flour, sugar, and powdered tears. Even better, these aspiring young chefs will be given the same opportunity to go into debt as other Northeastern students, and Aoun plans to monetize this even further by hiring a well-known chef with a foreign accent to verbally berate the students and turn it into a reality TV show, where SAIL’s disproportionate budget will allow them to buy up all the available advertising slots. In addition, their assignments will be to construct life-size cake replicas of Aoun to contribute to his ever growing army of clones. In exchange for their services in his quest for world conquest, they are each promised a single Aoun cake as compensation, which is both delicious and sexy. This incestual integration of various Northeastern properties as the result of mismanaged money is part of a new initiative. While the name is pending, obviously it will start with “NU,” and the tagline is confirmed to be: “What are you doing, step-brother? Daddy Aoun is right there!”
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Aoun splitting at the seams while announcing plans for ISEC 2: Electric Boogaloo

articles.name: northeastern-paves-over-bu
articles.title: Northeastern Paves Over BU
articles.brief: Boston, MA – In its efforts to create a safer campus amid the COVID-19 pandemic, Northeastern has paved over several areas on campus.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – In its efforts to create a safer campus amid the COVID-19 pandemic, Northeastern has paved over several areas on campus. So far, the Willis volleyball court, the Science Quad, and the Cabot Quad have all fallen victim to the bulldozer to make space for testing and dining tents. (Hopefully testing and dining aren’t in the same tent…) 

Students were sad to see their campus, once an arboretum, reduced to a pavement pancake. To avoid paving over Centennial and the other remaining green areas on campus, Northeastern administrators have instead decided to bulldoze some buildings on Commonwealth Ave. Turns out those buildings were what BU considered its “campus,” so they paved over BU. It is now a flat concrete slab, which is honestly quite an improvement. 

As a result, Northeastern Facilities has been given the keys to the city. “They have done the city of Boston a tremendous service,” said Mayor Marty Walsh. “BU’s pathetic excuse for a campus was a scourge to this city. Bunker Hill Community College is an eye sore, but at least it got us in Good Will Hunting! BU was worthless. I’m glad Northeastern’s paving crew has freed Kenmore from its clutches.”

Amid rampant speculation, Northeastern has announced what it will do with this new space. In an effort to reduce the spread of the virus, Northeastern plans to build a giant stage on the Commonwealth concrete where students who test positive for COVID-19 will be sent to be publicly shamed. They will be given shirts that say “I love SAIL” and hats that say “CAMD Student,” and they will be paraded about on the giant stage for humiliation while fellow students snap photos and nearby Masshole drivers taunt them by honking their horns while blasting Nickelback music out the car window. This should be a strong deterrent against breaking social distancing protocols.

After the pandemic is over, it is rumored that ISEC 4, Matthews Arena 2, Lightview 3, and the set of Toy Story 5 will occupy the space. The tunnels will be expanded underneath the Fens to connect the colony to its mother campus. 

When asked about bulldozing BU, Aoun had a short but powerful message. “Wentworth, you’re next.”

comments.name: BU Administrator
comments.content: Thank god the campus is gone, now I'm finally free to leave this trash dump of a school

comments.name: Rhett
comments.content: Now I can keep my racist name! BU proud

comments.name: Boston College
comments.content: Why do I hear boss music

articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1

articles.name: the-nuinvasion-the-shameful-existence-of-nuin-students
articles.title: The N.U.invasion: The Shameful Existence of N.U.in Students
articles.brief: Boston, MA – It is a scene that has played out in homes across the world.  You stare at that fateful, unopened email from Northeastern University.  Your parents are next to you, anxious. Your siblings glance over, their interest feigned but their jealousy real.  Your loyal pooch stands sentinel at your feet.  You hover your cursor over the email.  You click.  Elation!  You have been accepted. Cheers. Hugs. Smiles. Happiness.  But wait... something is not right!  You see it.  They see it.  Then comes the silence.  Next the realization.  And finally, dread.  Your mother leaves the room sobbing.  Your siblings look on in pity.  Your father holds his head in his hands, wishing oh so desperately that he had just put on a condom all those years ago.  Even your dog, who has smelled many butts in his day, cannot bear the sight of the enormous asshole in front of him.  And you.  You look around at your shattered family, your joy now turned to ashes.  You bargain with powers long since abandoned, who, in return, have since abandoned you.  Through misty eyes, you peer in fear at a tear-soaked screen.  The words stare back at you mockingly.  You are scorned.  You are hopeless.  You are damned.  You are... an N.U.in student.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – It is a scene that has played out in homes across the world.  You stare at that fateful, unopened email from Northeastern University.  Your parents are next to you, anxious. Your siblings glance over, their interest feigned but their jealousy real.  Your loyal pooch stands sentinel at your feet.  You hover your cursor over the email.  You click.  Elation!  You have been accepted. Cheers. Hugs. Smiles. Happiness.  But wait... something is not right!  You see it.  They see it.  Then comes the silence.  Next the realization.  And finally, dread.  Your mother leaves the room sobbing.  Your siblings look on in pity.  Your father holds his head in his hands, wishing oh so desperately that he had just put on a condom all those years ago.  Even your dog, who has smelled many butts in his day, cannot bear the sight of the enormous asshole in front of him.  And you.  You look around at your shattered family, your joy now turned to ashes.  You bargain with powers long since abandoned, who, in return, have since abandoned you.  Through misty eyes, you peer in fear at a tear-soaked screen.  The words stare back at you mockingly.  You are scorned.  You are hopeless.  You are damned.  You are... an N.U.in student.

Introduced over ten years ago by someone who obviously hates both children and foreign countries, the N.U.in Program sends students, who were denied from every other college they applied to, across the seas to various countries in hopes that enough drop out or die along the way so that campus doesn’t get too overcrowded come spring.  The survivors then complete what can only be described as a slightly less educational and slightly more horny sleep-away camp experience, where they take watered-down versions of useless elective classes that they would most definitely have failed otherwise.  Afterwards, this motley crew of Husky rejects invades Northeastern’s pristine Boston campus, either being shoved into the infamous Midtown Hotel or awkwardly interjected into unwilling upperclassmen’s dorms.  For the next couple of months, these paragons of mediocrity can be seen wandering around campus with the blank expression of someone who probably didn’t crack a 1350 on the SATs.  They wander from building to building, crowding the halls and food lines. They stick out like dumb sore thumbs, wearing their N.U.in shirts which they believe were given to them as a point of pride. But in actuality it is a brand, a mark warning all normal, productive members of Husky society to stay away from these N.U.interlopers.

While you personally might not have had to endure such a traumatic and shameful experience as being forced to attend your first semester abroad, odds are you know someone who has.  In fact, 1 of every 4 Northeastern students has been afflicted by such circumstances.  That means if you pick out 4 Northeastern students at random, not only can you count higher than the average N.U.in student, but odds are one of the students you picked got pity “accepted” into Northeastern through this program.

The question remains: what do Northeastern students, who came to this school the proper way, think about the students who play dirty and take the shortcut to Northeastern?  We asked actual members of the Northeastern community what they think.

“They’re just dumb people,” said Cliff Engleberry, a second year communications major. “It’s like talking to a more culturally experienced BU student.”

“They just can’t contribute,” said an exasperated professor who wished to remain anonymous. “If I see one of them raise their hand I just look the other way, hoping someone who actually deserves to be here can save the class from whatever nonsensical drivel is bound to follow should I call on them.”  

“I actually have had no problems with them.”  Explained fourth year business major Tom Martin.  “I have found them to be all very well rounded, talented and insightful people who have had a great experience abroad.  I think a lot of the animosity comes from the fact that some people are jealous of the amazing opportunity which N.U.in afforded.”  [Editor’s Note: The Husky Husky later discovered that Tom Martin is, in fact, an N.U.in student.  Please disregard his prior statement.  We sincerely apologize for subjecting you to such nonsense.]

“I could never see myself interacting with them in any capacity,” proclaimed Emily Dickinson, a third year English major. “Socially, academically, not even sexually. Especially not sexually.”

Ms. Dickinson’s last comment speaks to the large involuntary celibacy problem found amongst these N.U.inferiors.  It is well known that the N.U.in program is filled with students most of society would deem as “unfuckable virgins,” but most are unaware of how bad the problem really is.  This lack of interest from normally functioning individuals has caused many N.U.in students to grow angry and bitter towards Northeastern students, often resorting to misogyny, self-pity and general “nice guy” behavior on online message boards.  These individuals have been dubbed N.U.incels.

Regardless of how you feel about these N.U.individuals, we here at the Husky Husky believe that no matter where you started off your Northeastern career, you are at least better than the average BU student.  And in that spirit, we researched a number of N.U.in owned businesses around Boston for you to patronize as a sign of support.  Unfortunately, being owned by N.U.in students, most of these businesses had closed down within a month after opening.  But I suppose that’s what you get by learning economics in Greece.
articles.author: 5f064a770a96e90833098013
articles.attr: An N.U.in student making her way to a class she is currently failing

articles.name: the-husky-husky-contracts-a-bad-case-of-bunions
articles.title: The Husky Husky Contracts a Bad Case of Bunions
articles.brief: Today we had to take King Husky himself to have him examined by a veterinarian. Unfortunately, he’s come down with a bad case of Bunions. Now, some of you may be wondering “But Gamer-Bot… what’s a Bunion?” Allow me to explain: a bunion is either a bony bump that forms on the joint at the base of your big toe, or a mediocre satire publication native to Boston University, although the term isn’t widely used either way. Our factual account of Northeastern paving over BU was apparently misinterpreted as us trying to become their satirical rival...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Today we had to take King Husky himself to have him examined by a veterinarian. Unfortunately, he’s come down with a bad case of Bunions. Now, some of you may be wondering “But Gamer-Bot… what’s a Bunion?” Allow me to explain: a bunion is either a bony bump that forms on the joint at the base of your big toe, or a mediocre satire publication native to Boston University, although the term isn’t widely used either way. Our factual account of Northeastern paving over BU was apparently misinterpreted as us trying to become their satirical rival. This could not be farther from the truth. After all, we really liked the article they put out in response to our article and would have loved to read more of their work, but they’ve only written 4 articles in the past 3 months. We’d simply rather them focus on ramping up production than having to fend off our satirical wit and comedic banter. [Editor’s Note: Their article is surprisingly genuinely funny.] Instead, we hope to get along well as we have to reside in the same city anyway and hope they can find some satirical content that doesn’t rely on us to do the heavy lifting.

Normally, I’d pity an organization like the Bunion as it has clearly been crippled by lack of intelligent students at their university; this phenomenon has been attributed to their campus being “uninhabitable” according to Northeastern scientists. However, they have committed a cardinal sin that no self-respecting Northeastern student can abide by: insulting our very own guardian angel Aoun. By incorrectly stating that Aoun’s name rhymes with Brown, they are trying to draw similarities between the amazing President Aoun and BU’s mediocre President Brown. Obviously we all know Brown could never hope to reach Aoun’s ungodly level of greed and raw sexual prowess, but they only get to witness Aoun’s holy presence while NU’s hockey team decimates BU, which is unfortunate for them. 

At the time of writing this, some of our writers have been implicated as providing interviews and internal documents to the Bunion. While we have confirmed that these interviews were fabricated, we were looking for an excuse to cycle out some staffers anyway and have since culled our worst writers. In a seemingly unrelated incident, the Bunion has subsequently hired numerous Northeastern students to fill their lack of staff, stating: “We’re glad to finally find some writers that won’t make us feel incompetent in comparison.”

When trying to find a treatment to get rid of this Bunion once and for all, we have realized that we simply don’t have to do anything! It turns out that because the Bunion is funded by BU, the imminent collapse of this Northeastern University knockoff due to lack of any interest among high schoolers to attend such a subpar college will cause them to go under shortly. Luckily, we have absolutely no funding from anyone other than a few simps on our Patreon, so we will continue to make satire for satire’s sake long after the Bunion’s collapse.

comments.name: Gamer-Bot
comments.content: On a serious note, I really liked the article that the Bunion wrote! Very quality satire, although the grammar was a bit garbled.

articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: King Husky afflicted with a Bunion

articles.name: husky-husky-writer-crucified-for-standing-up-for-nuin-boston-students
articles.title: Husky Husky Writer Crucified for Standing Up for N.U.in Boston Students
articles.brief: Recently there was a discussion among Husky Husky staffers about the gullible toddlers that think accepting an offer to be an N.U.in student is a good thing. Especially in the current situation, it is a downright awful idea, as you have to be relegated to the most humiliating option possible: N.U.in Boston. Imagine that—consuming the same trash that passes for food in Northeastern dining halls along with actually qualified students while being physically segregated from quality courses as you live in your hovel of a hotel...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Recently there was a discussion among Husky Husky staffers about the gullible toddlers that think accepting an offer to be an N.U.in student is a good thing. Especially in the current situation, it is a downright awful idea, as you have to be relegated to the most humiliating option possible: N.U.in Boston. Imagine that—consuming the same trash that passes for food in Northeastern dining halls along with actually qualified students while being physically segregated from quality courses as you live in your hovel of a hotel. 

The experience is objectively inferior to that of a real Northeastern student in every way. However, while everyone was innocently trashing on N.U.in Boston students, some student named John Smith (probably an N.U.in student himself) pointed out that we are discriminating against those students, and that perhaps we should refrain from completely destroying any last shred of dignity that they might have left. Can you believe the nerve of him?!? While Mr. Smith is right that we call the N.U.in Boston students the imbeciles that they are for paying hundreds of thousands of dollars for a subpar uninformative experience, that doesn’t mean we don’t do that for other Northeastern students! 

The mere fact that Mr. Smith dared to suggest that we are degrading the human pieces of garbage that are N.U.in Boston students is blasphemy and hate speech, so we started a petition to remove him and all 0 other supporters of N.U.in Boston students. When we stopped a Northeastern student on the way to class to ask them what they thought, they said: “I’ve never heard of John Smith, but anyone who disagrees with my objective unbiased view that N.U.in Boston students are sub-human deserves to lose their job, get expelled, and die. Of course I support canceling him!”

It seems like Mr. Smith is of the opinion that our writing team should have nuanced views and accept differing opinions. “That’s obviously utter garbage. Why should we have any responsibility not to be discriminatory?” an editor stated. Mr. Smith responded that we imply N.U.in Boston students take easy courses, won’t go abroad, and have significantly reduced mental capacities, which is harmful to them. 

Obviously these are just facts. They have the money to afford it and they chose to do it, so it’s fair game to make fun of them. It is clearly obvious that these N.U.in Boston students can’t even begin to complain, as we Northeastern students have to take actual courses, and their professors are essentially just glorified babysitters.

Mr. Smith said “Even if the N.U.in Boston students chose to attend Northeastern instead of just not attending college due to their lack of mental abilities, that doesn’t give us a pass to harass them.” This caused an uproar, as we obviously can’t abide by this as the idea. If we did, that would ruin half our content and destroy future opportunities to bond with other NU students over the misfortune of others. 

As a result, we did the only reasonable thing: we hurled stones at him. When those stones hit our computer screens instead of his face, we decided to abduct him from his house instead. After abducting him, we avoided the police searching for us by hiking into the no man’s land that is New Jersey, where we tied him to a cross and set him ablaze. As he pleaded for his freedom, we sat smugly on the sidelines, knowing that we need to be a safe space where everyone can freely voice opinions, and his points contradicted ours and that’s not acceptable for such a space.

comments.name: John Smith
comments.content: You should have made sure I died, you fuckers >;)

comments.name: Gamer-Bot
comments.content: It has since come to our attention that John Smith may have escaped. If you have any information that might lead to his capture and subsequent demise, please contact us immediately.

articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Aoun giving a speech at his crucifixion

articles.name: university-exposed
articles.title: University EXPOSED in a SEXY Leak
articles.brief: Thanks to an anonymous NUintern, the Husky Husky has received a leaked document and a series of messages sent between President Aoun and Chancellor Ken Henderson. This shocking leak reveals...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Thanks to an anonymous NUintern, the Husky Husky has received a leaked document and a series of messages sent between President Aoun and Chancellor Ken Henderson. This shocking leak reveals the true intentions of the University and its plans for the execution of the fall semester. Based on our NUresearch, it seems as if all this classified info was sent through the messaging app Slack, but was accidentally shared in a group-wide chat instead of a private messenger.

According to our NUinvestigators, the leaks detail troubling conduct stemming from our school administration.  The leaks seem to suggest the University’s purpose this year is not to provide world-class education through experiential learning, but to NUincrease revenue, allowing for administrators to maintain their exuberant salaries. But, of course, we know that is not true. The administration NUcares for their students and would never NUblatantly-rip-us-off.

The leaked document, a letter dated for September 11th, 2020, reads, “Hello Students, it is with great remorse that I am required to announce a definitely unexpected, unplanned decision on this unfortunate September 11th; A day that will never be forgotten and will forever reside in the hearts and minds of every single member of the Northeastern community for this very reason and this reason only. Yes, my children, y’all fuckers gotta go back home. We do realize that for many students, the first time being kicked off campus was extremely tragic, stressful, and heartbreaking, so we decided to do it again. No, of course, we didn’t deceive you into paying for an on-campus semester of education just to make more money. We did it because we love you.” The letter continues for another sixteen pages, but the majority of it is some legal jumbo explaining students cannot sue the school this time because they actually signed away their souls to President Aoun when they completed this semester’s “I Am Here” confirmation. It was in white ink on a white background but apparently legally binding nonetheless. The letter says, “Don’t get a lawyer, it definitely won’t work,” and I blindly trust the university, so it seems legit enough. However, the authenticity of the document is currently in review as the memo is signed, “Your Lord and Savior, Joseph, Jesus the Second, Aoun,” which is not out of the ordinary, but the signature is in blue ink, not black, which just feels a bit off.

The Slack chain also leaked to The Husky Husky details devious plans shared back and forth between President Aoun and Chancellor Ken Henderson. Here’s the transcript:


-------------------------------July 6th, 2020 - 4:20 PM---------------------------------


LordAoun: Hey Ken, isn’t it great that we can keep our Gmail accounts, while the students have to suffer and switch to the dastardly electric mailing platform known to plebeians as Microsoft Outlook. ROFL!

HenneyLover69: Hi JoJo! Yes, it is, I’m glad we forced all members of our community off the superior platform, saving almost 25 cents per student, but, unfortunately, I have some concerning news. Harvard has decided to go almost entirely online. Students and faculty will be expecting us to do the same. Oh Lord, what shall we do? Cancel in-person classes?

LordAoun: No! You fool, do you know how much money we’d lose?!? No, no, we need a plan. A plan so intricate that it will appear genuine and result in students legitimately believing the semester will be conducted somewhat normal.

HenneyLover69: But Lord, won’t that be expensive, perhaps generating a loss greater than the amount we’d lose from students declaring a leave of absence?

LordAoun: Oh Ken, Ken, Ken. You have so much to learn. The key word is “appear.” Do you know why they pay me $1.3 million a year? It’s to make bad shit look as good as I do. How do you think we rose over 100 spots in the rankings in less than ten years?

HenneyLover69: Alrighty then, Lord, what is your plan then?

LordAoun: Well, first, we have to ensure all our students stay enrolled.

HenneyLover69: But with the clearly lower quality of learning online classes provide, won’t that be hard?

LordAoun: Yes, but we need to make them think they’ll be going back to class. You really aren’t keeping up, are you, Ken?

HenneyLover69: No, sir, I apologize, I am not. Have mercy on my soul.

LordAoun: All is forgiven. Now, as I was saying, the students should think they will have the choice of whether or whether not to return to class. We will assure them that Hybrid NUflex will allow students to spend a decent amount of time experiencing in-person lectures.

HenneyLover69: But what if a professor isn’t comfortable teaching in person?

LordAoun: We won’t tell them about that. 

HenneyLover69: Okay, but what if there’s an on-campus breakout?

LordAoun: Breakout? Ha! We’ll never let confirmed cases ever get that high, too much of a liability.

HenneyLover69: Oh so we will have a rigorous testing plan?

LordAoun: No, Ken, c’mon keep up, that is way too expensive to maintain. During move-in, we will have all students test for COVID at the same time. And we will ensure to test them at least three times the first week.

HenneyLover69: But wouldn’t that congregation of students risk an on-campus outbreak?

LordAoun: Now you’re getting it, Ken!

HenneyLover69: Excuse me?

LordAoun: Yes, the infected students from hot spots such as Florida and Texas will undoubtedly infect students from safer states such as Massachusetts and New York.

HenneyLover69: Isn’t an outbreak the opposite of what we want?

LordAoun: No, we need an excuse to kick the students off campus again. We take their money in tuition and housing, then we kick them off so we don’t have to provide them with a world-class education or overpriced board.

HenneyLover69: What if students elect to stay on campus? It is unlikely another stay at home order will be declared. And we would lose thousands if we had to give out housing refunds again.

LordAoun: Ken, why do you doubt me so often? Do you not know what I did for this school? You were nothing. This was nothing. I did this. This was all ME. Don’t you dare question my intelligence, my authority, or my vision. Or it will be your head in my lap.

HenneyLover69: Yes, my Lord.

LordAoun: We will never truly kick the students off-campus. As soon as one faculty member contracts the Coronavirus, we will immediately shut down campus “for the safety of our valued employees.”

HenneyLover69: But are people gonna buy that? I mean, we stopped paying our dining hall employees last semester.

LordAoun: Those fools buy anything that comes out of my mouth. They buy my vastly overpriced housing. They buy my vastly overpriced meal plans. They buy my vastly overpriced education.

HenneyLover69: But they’re forced to…

LordAoun: Exactly. Business.

HenneyLover69: So, after in-person classes are canceled indefinitely, I agree, some students may elect to return home, but I don’t think that would be enough to sway the majority of students. We need to do more.

LordAoun: Yes, you are learning, my pupil. We will also be shutting down all campus facilities such as the dining halls and Snell “for the safety and well-being of the community.”

HenneyLover69: But we’ve never given a single shit about the residents of Roxbury and Mission Hill, do you really think students are gonna buy that? And we’d have to issue refunds for those services, wouldn’t we?

LordAoun: No, we would not. I added a new clause to our contract with the students. It reads, “NO REFUNDS BITCH.” And I used white ink so nobody would notice.

HenneyLover69: I don’t think that’s legal.

LordAoun: Are you questioning me again?

HenneyLover69: No, Lord, but what about the intensive testing we promised to the students. I believe that even a few students will stay, and we cannot forget about the students off-campus.

LordAoun: We did say testing would be done every five days, that is correct... 

LordAoun: We can place the test kits in the UHCS lobby next to all the condoms. We will also need to emphasize that students should be able to self administer their tests though. We’ll just include that in the next useless university-wide email I send. You can say it’s for increased efficiency or some bullshit like that.

HenneyLover69: Sounds good my Lord. Your plan is brilliant as always. Have a blessed day.

LordAoun: Oh, one more thing, Ken

HenneyLover69: Yes, my Lord.

LordAoun: I’m scheduling you another town hall tomorrow.

HenneyLover69: But why my Lord? I held one two days ago.

LordAoun: I know, I just love the way your voice sounds. It’s so...diverse.

HenneyLover69: Your wish is my command, my Lord.


There was also a lot of hentai sent back and forth after this, but we decided to redact that from the transcript. I enjoyed it though. Truly some high-quality stuff. Who knew the wonders excessive amounts of money can buy.

articles.name: ruggles-elevator
articles.title: Ruggles Elevator Given $200 Million Budget, 2030 Target Date
articles.brief: Boston, MA – In a joint project with the City of Boston, Northeastern has announced its intention to upgrade the existing elevator in ruggles. Press releases indicate SpaceX, designer of the $3.6 billion Falcon 9 rocket, will be leading the project.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – In a joint project with the City of Boston, Northeastern has announced its intention to upgrade the existing elevator in ruggles. Press releases indicate SpaceX, designer of the $3.6 billion Falcon 9 rocket, will be leading the project. Officials note that the designer intends to take inspiration from the futuristic rocket when constructing the elevator. SpaceX states their team is fully committed to the 2030 deadline and assures the project will stay within $300 million of the $200 million dollar budget.

Recent comments from The Office of the President suggest that the groundbreaking elevator will save Northeastern students hundreds of dollars in commute time, “We have too many tuition dollars lying around. We also noticed BU has been upgrading its elevators to the Platinum Plus model. Thus, we decided to build a proprietary elevator that will be better than every elevator at BU”.

Additional comments from Northeastern executives highlight the three other project finalists. Those include constructing ISEC 7, gentrifying Roxbury, and redesigning the Statue of Liberty into the far more attractive Joseph Aoun.

We connected with Lead Engineer Elon Musk to learn about the logistics of the elevator. Currently, engineers plan for the elevator to accelerate to the speed of sound before instantaneously stopping. This will induce micro concussions in riders, a strategy proven to increase complacency. Furthermore, ride times will be reduced by 3%. When asked whether it will be able to accelerate to the speed of light, Musk emphasized that manipulating the space-time continuum would bring unnecessary complications to Northeastern brainwashing practices.

Our research suggests Northeastern students are incredibly excited about the future of the elevator. However, CAMD student and fourth year Finger Painting major Jeannette Reed comments, “This is such a waste of my tuition. What the fuck are we going to do with this elevator? Does it cure cancer?”. Comments from Musk confirm that the elevator will, in fact, cure cancer.

Closing remarks from Musk indicate that absence of a namesake will force him to name the elevator “☹︎︎♋︎︎■︎︎♋︎︎ ❒︎︎♒︎︎□︎︎♋︎︎♎︎︎♏︎︎⬧︎”, apparently nerd code for “Lana Rhoades”.

Officials report that Aoun is desperately searching for said namesake. Potential donors include Northeastern Alum Bill Gates, the real name of the el chapo guy (El Chapo), Ruggles Dollah Lady, or anyone else willing to donate several hundred million to have their name plastered on a sign.
articles.author: 5f28be06d19e260835fecb9b
articles.attr: Credit: Jeff Bezos

articles.name: communist-clubs-rescind-tuition-strike-realizing-freshmen-arent-subhuman-pawns
articles.title: Communist Clubs Rescind Tuition Strike, Realizing Freshmen Aren’t Subhuman Pawns
articles.brief: In mid-July, the Communist Clubs Coalition at Northeastern called for a tuition strike to fight the Aoun regime. But while the CCC proclaims that all students are equal, some were treated more equally than others under this tuition strike.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – In mid-July, the Communist Clubs Coalition at Northeastern called for a tuition strike to fight the Aoun regime. But while the CCC proclaims that all students are equal, some were treated more equally than others under this tuition strike.  The CCC called for only incoming freshmen to defer their enrollment, while actual club members and upperclassmen would continue to enjoy all the fruits of being a Northeastern student. (Although, if the benefits of Northeastern are fruits, living in Steast is definitely a tomato.)

This announcement subsequently prompted strong comments on social media.

“Because of COVID-19, I wasn’t sure if I’d be able to have a fun hazing experience freshman year. I’m happy the CCC found a creative way to haze us remotely!” said Claudia Smith, an incoming first-year.

“I’m really appreciative that the CCC showed me the right thing to do this semester. I’m gay, can’t afford college, and have homophobic parents, so, I’m really glad the CCC wants me to stay home with my abusive family and lose my scholarship by deferring for a whole year!” gushed incoming freshman Taylor Stephens.

Not all comments were so positive.

“They want these poor freshmen to take a stand, while they circlejerk themselves over the change they ‘created,’ whilst collecting their degree and praying to their socialist overlords” wrote Reddit user I9T1997.

[Editor’s note: this is a real and profoundly eloquent Reddit comment.] 

Others pointed out that the main deferral deadline had passed, meaning students would have to forfeit a large deposit in order to defer.  Additionally, the call for a tuition strike was posted less than two weeks before the final deferral deadline, giving incoming freshmen a short time frame to make the life-changing decision about becoming a sacrificial pawn.

To get the other side of the story, we sat down with CCC Supreme Leader Maurice the Great at his luxury penthouse in Roxbury, paid for by his three co-ops at Amazon.

Said Maurice of the tuition strike policy, “Look, it’s just a recommendation. Unlike Northeastern, which is, of course, not at all giving students the option to learn remotely whenever they want and is physically forcing students to return to campus, our tuition strike is merely a suggestion.”

We asked Supreme Leader Maurice the Great why the CCC is calling for the tuition strike in the first place. “Northeastern has not single-handedly solved world poverty, ended racism, discovered unicorns, and stopped the pandemic in the 24 hours after we complained via Twitter and created several Change.com petitions” explained Maurice.

As for the goal of the tuition strike, Maurice said “If the university has less money, we’re pretty sure they’ll spend more money on the things we want, like discovering unicorns or saving Chicken Lou’s.”

When asked to comment on what they planned to do in the face of this formidable, voluntary, freshman-only tuition strike, Northeastern simply asked “There’s a tuition strike?” They then proceeded to roll around on the floor in laughter when they realized tuition deposits had already been made. They had no comment on the unicorn situation. 

After much backlash over the posts, most CCC clubs quietly removed the posts from their social media accounts in the middle of the night, denied ever calling for a tuition strike, and canceled any dissenters who mentioned otherwise. To cover up their mess and distract the masses, the CCC replaced the posts with calls demanding that President Aoun be more transparent and issue specific, profuse, and frequent apologies.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1

articles.name: business-major-turns-to-mechanized-enhancements-to-reach-30-under-30-goal
articles.title: Business Major Turns to Mechanized Enhancements to Reach 30 Under 30 Goal
articles.brief: A DMSB student has developed a study tool integrated into the body of desperate students. What could go wrong?
articles.text:
Boston, MA – “ARGHHH!!!” 


The screams of Northeastern students echoed through the tunnels as they ran to escape. A monster had been released in the basement of Dodge Hall. 


“Get it away from me!!!” 


As a student ran past, a Husky Husky correspondent who accidentally found themself on site caught a glimpse of a mechanical organism which faintly resembled a human. Due to our cowardly nature at the Husky Husky, the correspondent fled, but not before snapping a photo to use as evidence.


The “monster” was in fact the mishap of D’Amore-McKim student Jake Willis who wished to prove to his parents that he, too, could become an entrepreneur. As all business snakes wish to optimize profit with occasional human sacrifices, he founded a product that would lure a large market of desperate students: a study assistant that is fully integrated into a human body. Once the excruciatingly painful surgery... erm, installation, was completed, the experimentee was set free to begin the beta testing. Witnesses of the liberated victim did not respond kindly and fled on sight.


In an exclusive interview, Willis explained his controversial business and attempted to reassure us that everything was indeed under control. 


“Study4Me is an integrated study tool that syncs photographic information to your brain. With a simple system of wires and an implanted camera, you’ll never have to read a book again – just look at a page and you’ll absorb it. I mean, I never studied anyway, but this way I won’t have to hold the devil’s paper for longer than a minute!” The Husky Husky is questioning how a student at such an angelic university could compare a textbook to the devil.


“My test subject, good ol’ Patrick here, just had a small hiccup,” Jake “Big Stonks” Willis continued. “Instead of attaching the camera lens to the outside of his head, I pointed it at his brain. Maybe he doesn’t like the whole marshmallow look. Nothing to worry about, I took Fundies 1 [Note: This was taken P/F. Willis did not pass.] and am extremely qualified to ensure the safety of this procedure. We will continue into Phase II immediately.” When asked about why Study4Me hasn’t yet overtaken the likes of Apple, Tesla, and Microsoft, Willis shook his head before continuing. “These are tough times in business. Big tech companies continue to dominate the playing field, and up-and-coming geniuses like myself now need to find new ways to climb to the top.”


However, the public outcry suggests that Willis has become too adventurous in his strive to be listed on Forbes’ 30 under 30 list. 


D’Amore-McKim student Alex Poroshenko was outraged by Willis’ actions. “How did his two remaining brain cells create such an ingenious business? And he listed himself as a CEO on LinkedIn?! That was my idea! I wanted to be the first DMSB graduate that didn’t become a corporate slave! My father will have to repeal the planned multimillion-dollar investment while I transfer to Wharton.”


Northeastern ITS seemed to be more intrigued than concerned about the technological reputation of Northeastern. “That… thing! Is it even human? There’s a camera where his left eye should be! It kept winking at me! And the metal wires snaking through the head? It looks more like swiss cheese than a living organism! I would like to take a closer look though...”


When asked why he would partake in such a transformative trial, Patrick was only able to mumble “I need tuition money” before he was dragged back into the depths of Dodge. 


The Husky Husky declines to follow up on this story. Our four Patreon supporters ensure that we don’t succumb to such desperate income collection techniques.
articles.author: 5f150107d19e260835fecb5a

articles.name: northeastern-vows-to-recreate-the-boston-tea-party-in-attempt-console-disappointed-nuin-students
articles.title: Northeastern Vows to Recreate the Boston Tea Party in Attempt Console Disappointed N.U.in Students
articles.brief: Boston, MA – After cancelling NU.in London and transferring all incoming students to NU.in Boston, Northeastern has unveiled plans to prove to these disappointed students that they do not need Britain after all. While NU.in London students may think the quality of their international experience was tied to the London location, Northeastern has come out with a brilliant solution inspired directly by the good ol’ founding fathers.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – After cancelling NU.in London and transferring all incoming students to NU.in Boston, Northeastern has unveiled plans to prove to these disappointed students that they do not need Britain after all. While NU.in London students may think the quality of their international experience was tied to the London location, Northeastern has come out with a brilliant solution inspired directly by the good ol’ founding fathers.


In a bold entrepreneurial move, NU.in will be rallying students to participate in a legendary reenactment of the Boston Tea Party. As Earnest Earnington, an NU.in overlord, remarked,


“not only will it be an epic team building activity, but this opportunity will also encourage students to learn history through an interactive and hands on approach which, at the end of the day, is what we’re all about here at Northeastern.”


Students will be instructed to write all their complaints on as many pieces of paper as their precious—soon to be harvested—little hearts desire, shred them, and stuff the shreds into makeshift tea bags. These tea bags will then be left on shore as the actual students are instructed to climb into the crates and plunge into the harbour in a fit of patriotic fervor. Aoun will then proceed to personally rescue his tuition money oh sorry *students* from the grasp of the freezing sea.


After completing this riveting swim, the students will be allowed to return to the Boston Harbour during designated times throughout the year and throw the discarded tea bags into the water in an act of collaboration and raw passion. This activity has been approved by UHCS as a positive form of anger management.


For the purposes of racial sensitivity, students will not be dressed in Native American garb during this activity, instead opting to wear state of the art Aoun facemasks and bathrobes as part of Northeastern’s social justice initiative: eNUf.

articles.brief: Boston, MA — As you should all know by now, the Husky Husky and Frisky Husky have collaborated to create a more innovative, powerful, and sexy Frisky Husky Husky Husky®. We heard the cries of the students who claim the no-guest policy will have a detrimental affect on their mediocre, truly vanilla sex lives, but the Frisky Husky Husky Husky® is determined to destroy any excuses you thought you could make about not getting laid this semester...
articles.text:
Boston, MA — As you should all know by now, the Husky Husky and Frisky Husky have collaborated to create a more innovative, powerful, and sexy Frisky Husky Husky Husky®. We heard the cries of the students who claim the no-guest policy will have a detrimental affect on their mediocre, truly vanilla sex lives, but the Frisky Husky Husky Husky® is determined to destroy any excuses you thought you could make about not getting laid this semester. 

For those reasons, we are announcing the Frisky Husky Husky Husky Quarantine Quicky Network©, known as FHHHQQN© (pronounced /fʌkn/), where we will connect you and your bed bouncing buddy with a location on Northeastern campus to bang it out. 

This program will be available to join via the NUGO application, and there will be an option for you to fill out a questionnaire where you can specify what kinky behaviors best define your sexual desires. There will also be a premium version of our software, which will give you the ability to screen future partners based on video footage of their best bedroom behavior. Our top tier AI technology will use these results to pair students up for their Best One Night Escapade (BONE).

After you’ve completed the wham, bam, thank you ma’am process, you will be allowed to leave a rating and review on your partner’s page before they are swiftly blocked and deleted across all platforms. Our program will also utilize the “always on” location feature so that we can make your funky fornication ultra efficient, as well as warn you to GTFO whenever you are within 100 feet of a past conquest. We will also be creating user-specific routes through campus to help students avoid crossing paths with one of the notches on their bed post. Note: if users act too Chad they may need an OSCCR escort in order to move around safely. 

Boning locations will include a screened (or not) area in front of the mormons in Ruggles, for those wishing to show them the true meaning of the devil’s tango. There will be multiple stations in Snell Library for the most studious to knock books, the International Center in Dodge is the place to be if you need to add a global experience achievement to SAIL, and the StWest public bathroom will be made available for those really looking to get down and dirty. Nature-forward folks will do their cave diving in Centennial Common under a pile of leaves, and, come the first snow, we will be setting up an igloo station in Krentzman Quadrangle for those who want an excuse for why it’s so small.

Finally, NU.in students will be separated from the rest of the Northeastern population, for both groups’ safety, and will be left to dunk their dinguses in Copley Square [Editor’s Note: We here at the Husky Husky are not salty about NU.in Boston students getting to live in some fancy hotel. However, if you are one of these students HMU].

We hope FHHHQQN© makes students excited about bumping uglies this fall, and as always we here at the Frisky Husky Husky Husky® wish your sex lives well!

The Husky Husky fully endorses this message and will be thoroughly testing all locations prior to public release of this program.

articles.name: scrooge-mcduck-joins-board-of-trustees
articles.title: Scrooge McDuck Joins Board of Trustees, Bringing Extensive Experience in Unscrupulous Greed
articles.brief: With fall semester fast approaching and students finalizing their last wills and testaments before COVID-19 gets them, Northeastern is laser focused...on making money. As much as humanly possible.
articles.text:
With fall semester fast approaching and students finalizing their last wills and testaments before COVID-19 gets them, Northeastern is laser focused...on making money. As much as humanly possible. In line with this grotesque obsession with material wealth, Aoun has recruited Scrooge McDuck to join the board of trustees,bringing a much needed greedy eye to Northeastern’s financial picture.

“The experience Mr. McDuck brings to the board of trustees is second to none,” president Aoun remarked at a press conference hosted at Mr. McDuck’s third mansion, before becoming enamored with a fetching solid gold robot and wandering off. Mr. McDuck had some words of wisdom for current students, telling them to “leave all cash and gold in a pile on your desks during room checks,” before high diving into his pool filled with 100 dollar bills.

Mr. McDuck proposed several new policies at his first board of trustees meeting, all meant to boost the school’s profits. Some highlights are the NU.Step program, which charges students 1 cent per step taken on school paths to account for “wear and tear” on the campus. The N.U.Trash program will change all trash cans to a coin operated system, including making trash rooms cost $10 per entrance. The biggest money maker was the N.U.Selfie program, where students must pay $1,000,000 per selfie with president Aoun, and an additional $1,000 per like the post receives on Instagram. These programs are pending a vote to allow Scrooge time to kidnap the families of the other trustees for leverage. 

The D'Amore McKim school of business has taken the initiative onto themselves, adding “additional surcharges” for the upcoming school year. These include charging for usage of the Dodge hall bathrooms, allowing students to buy access to the 3 competent advisors at the school, and raiding the Canada Goose store in the Pru to resell the coats to international students. Along with the revenue from pickpocketing CSSH students protesting these changes, D’Amore McKim expects a 300% increase in incoming cashflow this year. 

So far no plan has been presented for how these new revenues will be laundered to Aoun’s Swiss bank account, with current theories ranging from smuggling cash in the corpses of Fen’s geese to filling the Paws suit with blood diamonds and pretending he’s going to Switzerland for medical care. The Husky Husky will keep you updated on this money laundering scheme, unless Aoun gives literally any money on our Patreon, which would buy our permanent silence.

articles.name: this-stupid-quiz-tells-you-which-dining-hall-food-matches-your-personality
articles.title: This Stupid Quiz Tells You Which Dining Hall Food Matches Your Personality
articles.brief: Boston, MA – Congratulations! It appears you’ve become so desperate for entertainment that you’re now about to take a rip-off BuzzFeed quiz to discover which dining hall food ‘matches your personality’. Although, seeing as you’re taking this quiz, ‘having a personality’ might not be your strong suit.  I suppose we’re both as ready as we’ll ever be… so let’s get this over with.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Congratulations! It appears you’ve become so desperate for entertainment that you’re now about to take a rip-off BuzzFeed quiz to discover which dining hall food ‘matches your personality’. Although, seeing as you’re taking this quiz, ‘having a personality’ might not be your strong suit.

I suppose we’re both as ready as we’ll ever be… so let’s get this over with.


Be sure to keep track of your points along the way. The HuskyHusky is waaaay too broke to afford a real quiz. 


A = 1 point

B = 2 points

C = 3 points

D = 4 points




It’s finals week and you’re on the third floor of Snell when the neanderthal sitting across from you starts making a facetime call, shrieking with laughter, and shoving a bag of chips down their throat. What do you do?

  1. Storm over to them, rip the chip bag from their hands and eat the rest as they watch in horror 
  2. Keep looking at your phone studying and ignore them
  3. Get up and leave, you’re definitely gonna fail this final anyway. Time to hit up your old buddy Jack Daniels to relieve your pain
  4. Nothing. It is what it is


Three minutes and twenty-six seconds into your first Fundies lecture you realize you’re up shit creek without a paddle (read: business major). What do you do?

  1. CHEGG it up baby 
  2. Drop the class instantly and switch your major to poetry
  3. Accept your fate, take the massive L, and massacre your GPA
  4. Have Daddy call in a few favors, maybe he’ll buy a library or something? 


How did you spend your first semester at Northeastern?

  1. Stealing condoms from UHCS that you never used
  2. Kissing the boots of frat boys/sorority girls in a failed attempt to make friends
  3. Sitting alone in your dorm room, repeating “I’m fine, everything is fine” over and over to yourself
  4. Getting piss drunk, sunburnt, and bitter on a Greek beach


For your first coop you’ll…

  1. Land a job at Spotify after embarking on an Indiana Jones-esque adventure to retrieve the long lost iPad from an ancient tomb underneath the Snell library 
  2. Waste Wayfair’s time by getting blitzed on company beer while selling trafficked child slaves window panes
  3. Surrender yourself as an indentured servant to an influential and important consulting firm (read: support McKinsey’s war crimes)
  4. Write code in absolute silence —reeking of Khoury College— as you rake in a meager $1,875/hr salary (with company-sponsored Roman-style feasts, helicopter Ubers, and cocaine)


You’ve (somehow) found yourself on a blind date and discover that they’re from BU. How do you react?

  1. Do a spit take all over their face and sprint away while screaming Stacy’s Mom at the top of your lungs 
  2. Nothing. Who cares? 
  3. This is the first (and probably last) date you’ll go on this year… pretend like everything is fine
  4. Instantly assume they’re broke and GTFO. Can you imagine paying less than $70,000 on tuition? 


When crossing Huntington always…

  1. Cradle your Amelia’s burrito like you’re holding a newborn. Why else would you even be on that side of campus?
  2. Giggle like a 6-year-old girl as you jaywalk in heelys
  3. Blast Kendrick’s ‘Bitch Don’t Kill Vibe’ in your headphones, tighten your blindfold, and twerk your way across. Assuming you’re turned into a hood ornament on some poor fool’s Lexus, it’s time to pay off your student loans with this civil suit
  4. Stare down Marino and chug the remainder of your pre-workout drink (the standard mix of creatine, ketamine, tiger semen, 8 scoops of protein, and a pinch of severe body dysmorphia). 


You’re catching up with an aunt that you haven’t seen in many years. She asks, “how do you like Chicago? I hear Northwestern is a great school!” How do you respond?

  1. Turn to a camera that isn’t there (ala Jim Halpert) and give it your best ‘well, fuck me’ face
  2. Politely remind her you to attend college nearly 1000 miles away
  3. Nod like a bobblehead until the conversation finally ends. 
  4. Scoff at her woeful ignorance and flex your coop harder than you ever have before.


Imagine Northeastern is a fighting game: choose your class

  1. Ass eatin’ Aoun 
  2. Jawbreakin’ Jehovah's Witness
  3. Cement Crackin’ Coop Advisor
  4. Roundhousin’ RA




Now it's time to tally this bitch up!


8-14 points: 

A generous, steaming helping of Stwest’s one and only Lobster Dinner


15-21 points: 

A single piece of week-old IV Sushi —filled entirely with moldy carrots and a single piece of cucumber that tastes like shitty toothpaste


21-27 points: 

A Steast cookie crammed hastily down your throat that elicits a sensual moan and a brief escape from the nightmare that is your life.


28-32 points: 

The pathetic, flavorless Mac and Cheese served in IV’s Indian section. Grow up. Make a plan. Get your life together. 



Disclaimer: The HuskyHusky in no way endorses Northeastern Dining Services’ claim that their dining halls serve ‘food’.
