articles.name: four-years-and-hundreds-of-thousands-of-dollars-later-biology-major-still-cant-find-the-clitoris
articles.title: Four Years and Hundreds of Thousands of Dollars Later, Biology Major Still Can't Find the Clitoris
articles.brief: We reached out to a fourth year biology major to explain why your woman always seems pissed after you rock her world.  “It’s called the clitoris..."
articles.text:
Boston, MA – It’s a scene which has played out across millions of bedrooms everyday.  You lay back in your bed, satisfied after another successful sex having.  You turn over to look at the girl you just performed sex upon to see how blown away she was by your sexual prowess and statistically average penis.  However, hark!  The expression of veritable euphoria and baffled bewilderment is nowhere to be found.  Instead there is only the blank stare of bland boredom and a distasteful disinterest.  You notice her melancholy.  Perhaps she is upset because of hormones, pink taxes, wage gaps, or perhaps she’s still really upset One Direction broke up.  Well, women are not troubled by any of those things (except the One Direction thing). We reached out to a fourth year biology major to explain why your woman always seems pissed after you rock her world.

“It’s called the clitoris. It is an elusive bone found somewhere on the female body approximately near the prostate,” explains Mal Le’Able, the biology major in question. “And I am dangerously close to finding it.”

Mal has been conducting extensive research on possible whereabouts of the clitoris, but as of yet he has failed to grasp it.  He is working alongside his girlfriend and lab partner Neva Khaim who desperately aids his search for the evasive muscle.

“It's on the tip of my tongue,” exclaims Mal.  “I’m so close, I can feel it.”

“Well I can’t,” responds Neva glumly.

“We have been running many clinical trials to see if any man can find the clitoris based on what major they’re in,” says Mal.  “Unfortunately through our testing we have found that almost no one can find the clitoris, especially my fellow biology majors.  In fact, our tests have shown that not a single biology major can find the clitoris.  The same goes for the entirety of the Khoury College of Computer Sciences.  Unsurprisingly, the only students who could reliably find the clitoris everytime were those with a combined Business Administration & Communications Major, with a concentration in Marketing and a Minor in Media Production.  The results were truly breathtaking.”

“Only breathtaking for about half the participants however,” clarifies an exasperated Neva.

Mal has encouraging words however.  “To those who are unable to find the clitoris, know that you are not alone, and, while your girlfriend may not, we feel you.”

A shrinking majority of us here at the Husky Husky believe that while Mr. Le’Able’s research is important, the most important thing when it comes to relations between a man and a woman isn’t whether or not someone is able to find this mythical point, but rather that sex is about coming together.  Not literally of course, but metaphorically.  And perhaps that is the answer to this mystery; maybe the clitoris isn’t a thing to be found at any one point on the female body.  Perhaps the real clitoris can be found in the bond you share with those around you.  So, my advice is to stop worrying about finding your girlfriend’s clitoris, but rather look within and find the clitoris inside yourself.
articles.author: 5f064a770a96e90833098013
articles.attr: WTF is that

articles.name: top-10-reasons-why-i-raw-dog-celery-and-you-should-too
articles.title: Top 10 Reasons Why I Raw Dog Celery and You Should Too
articles.brief: Hear me out. While celery may be the scourge of our dinner plates, it can be the new star of your fantasies. Here’s why...
articles.text:
Boston, MA-It’s a tale as old as time: “Eat your vegetables and you’ll grow up big and strong!” Maybe our versions differ in the amounts of kicking and screaming, but it’s the same story regardless. Always some cunning lie to stop us from flinging our Zoopals plate across the kitchen. Of all the vegetables on the plate, there was always one that was particularly egregious. 


Celery. 


Broccoli, peas, brussel sprouts, those greens are all passable. But celery? It’s stringy, smells like death, and flavored like rainwater with a crisp sudsy aftertaste. How anyone finds joy in this excuse for a vegetable is beyond me. But all hope is not lost. You see, as I’ve grown older, I’ve discovered an unexplored use for this leafed fiend. A feature everyone should know and cherish.

It makes a mighty fine lover. 

Hear me out. While celery may be the scourge of our dinner plates, it can be the new star of your fantasies. Here’s why:


1. It's conveniently shaped

  • Tubular and hollow, yes please.

2. It's green

  • Biodegradable, so no need to worry about crispy socks any more!

3. It's portable

  • Just tell people it’s a snack for later. It’s technically true! We are not responsible, however, for any social consequences of claiming such.

4. You don't need a condom

  • No womb to speak of!

5. It releases pent up anger

  • All that veggie hatred channeled into a stringy hate-fuck.

6. It holds everything!

7. You can add whatever condiments you want

  • Peanut butter, ranch, mayo. This celery is your oyster. If you’re feeling especially spicy, go with some sriracha. 

8. Celery sucks ass

  • Fuck celery

9. Vegans will love you

  • 6/9 vegans agree

10. It’s good for weight loss

  • You know how it burns calories when you eat it, well it’s the same way when you beat it up. 


You don’t have to be a dietician to know that veggies are good for you. And after reading this, you know just how right they are. I cannot tell you how to wield your new knowledge, only that you’ve been armed with an immense power. Go forth and ravage celery.

comments.name: Anon
comments.content: Fuck celery. All my homies hate celery.

articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f
articles.attr: Quench your thirst and go green!

articles.name: aoun-now-assembling-database-of-compromising-student-photos
articles.title: Aoun Now Assembling Database of Compromising Student Photos
articles.brief: "Over the course of the next month, I’ll personally be assembling a collage of compromising photos of every student on campus. I’ll get you at your most vulnerable moments, and you’ll never see me coming,“ Aoun stated in a press conference.
articles.text:
Boston- Arriving at Stetson West at one am for the third consecutive night, undeclared freshman Sophie Langley drunkenly stumbled into her dorm with no intentions other than missing her 10:30 a.m and blaming it on her “brutal” twelve credit schedule. Tottering over to the mirror for that night’s fifth and final selfie, she might have glimpsed something flickering in the nearby window, but thought nothing of it.

 But when she switched off the lights, and turned to the window, she was met with a horrific sight. Standing there, in all his glory, was Joseph Aoun- all 68 inches of him. Raising his finger at her and uttering an ear piercing shriek, Aoun snapped a photo of her, and scampered off into the night, leaving nary a trace of his presence, save the traumatised freshman.

At a press conference early next morning, Aoun introduced to the student body what the young Sophie had already been privy to: the implementation of a new program called NU Aoun Sights You. “I’ve had enough of snotty freshmen asking for photos every goddamn time I step out of my ivory tower,” Aoun told approximately ten thousand students and faculty outside Krentzman quad. “Calling me a meme, saying you want to have my children, asking me when I’ll let your families out of my lair? I mean, some of you little shits really think we’re equals!”

Pausing for a brief moment to personally manhandle some hecklers shouting nonsense about “privacy” and “rights”, Aoun continued on with his proclamation. “Anyway, I’m turning the tables. Over the course of the next month, I’ll personally be assembling a collage of compromising photos of every student on campus. I’ll get you at your most vulnerable moments, and you’ll never see me coming. “

“You could be coming home late after getting absolutely shitfaced at Mission Hill, or right in the middle of stuffing your faces with crap from IV like the disgusting swine you are. I might even snap some shots in Cabot while you’ve got a swab up your nose and your mouth dangling wide open. What’s for certain is you won’t be pleased when you find that the new 4 by 5 inch student IDs I’ll issue, which you must wear around your necks at all times, will include all these photos. Each and every photo will make it into my database, with which I shall do whatever I please.”

Aoun went on to describe the harsh punishments awaiting anyone who attempts to evade him. “Of course, no one seriously believes they can hide from me forever, but should anyone get any ideas about delaying me, I will be most displeased. Those misguided persons will find themselves locked out of every building and hissed at by faculty as they pass. I have personally ordered NUPD to beat the living shit out of anyone not wearing their new Husky ID, or who doesn’t show up on the Aoun database. You have been warned.”

However, Aoun ended the conference explaining that the program would not apply to N.U.In students, citing his utter  fear of Brett Josphe, of whom he is “scared shitless”.

comments.name: That's My Kink
comments.content: Thankfully, I sent all my most compromising photos to Aoun in advance

articles.name: northeastern-builds-zeppelin-in-a-bid-for-aerial-superiority
articles.title: Northeastern Builds Zeppelin in a Bid for Aerial Superiority
articles.brief: From the construction to the fleet of helicopters, it’s making the studying I never do impossible. Since campus can’t possibly get any louder, Northeastern has decided to construct something special to complement ISEC 2...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Recently, campus has been a cacophony of sounds. From the construction to the fleet of helicopters, it’s making the studying I never do impossible. Since campus can’t possibly get any louder, Northeastern has decided to construct something special to complement ISEC 2.

In the past few years, Aoun has been pushing hard to steadily increase the balloon budget. However, there has been a startling lack of visible balloons this fall semester due to the cancellation of Fall Fest and Orientation. To satisfy his urge for aerial superiority, President Aoun commissioned a coordinated drone performance—a robotic upgrade on regular balloons. To finish dominance in the Boston sky, President Aoun has purchased the pinnacle of aviation: a zeppelin.

When asked to comment on why a zeppelin was the right choice, Aoun said: “I asked my secretary to find a balloon to match my ego and they said this was it! Plus, it’ll be a perfect way for me to look down on my underlings from above.”

Most undergraduates are confused about the use for such a vehicle. But they just haven’t thought about the marketing potential! Normally, Northeastern’s marketing materials only serve to spam Bostonian’s eyes at ground-level. Now we can also reach their ears with the sound of giant propellers churning to propel our aerial monstrosity ever-closer as we manifest our aerial destiny.

Check back with us in two weeks as we document the first of the NUZeppelin’s adventures.
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Aoun Christening his new Zeppelin

Closing thoughts:

Well, that was boring. The fly stole the show to be quite honest. God knows whether or not next week’s debate will happen, but no matter how it plays out you can rely on the Husky Husky to bring you the best news. Thank you for sharing these fleeting moments with us as we watch the world burn. Have a good night everyone.

articles.name: resmail-a-harrowing-expose
articles.title: Resmail: A Harrowing Exposé
articles.brief: I found it. I finally found it. For three long years I’ve waited for my fundies textbook to arrive. And I’ve finally found it. But at what cost?
articles.text:
Boston, MA--I found it. I finally found it. For three long years I’ve waited for my fundies textbook to arrive. And I’ve finally found it. But at what cost?

Making the trek to Speare Hall, I know what awaits me. As the hours tick by, and the line grows shorter, I finally make my way to the desk for the daily task of begging for my package. My head is hung; I can’t even stand to look the mail worker in the eyes. His voice is sadistically smooth and oddly familiar. He savors each and every word, while it torments me

“Did you get an email?”

I didn’t. He knows I didn’t. He revels in this euphoric feeling of power and control he has over me. Still too afraid to make eye contact, I instinctively stare at the only package in the room.

His.

Judging from the size of the bulge, that might very well be my textbook in his pants. I am mortified. And yet, why do I recognize it?


Of course.

Aoun.


Only now do I look up to meet his gaze, he stares back, relaxed and definitely aroused.

“Maybe that is your package,” he says, reading my mind. “Why don’t you come over to this room and sign for it?”

He slowly backs away from the counter and into a dark room, beckoning for me to join him. I approach cautiously, with weak knees and heavy arms. My sweaty palms reach for the doorknob, as I can feel heat emanating from the other side of the door. I hesitate, unsure of what to do. Until that voice licks my ears again.

“Come see my true form.” He beckons, seemingly from all around me. “And find all the mail you could ever dream of.”

I turn the knob and open the door, only to be greeted by a large dark room, empty save for a large pile of mail.

And Aoun, the mighty lizard king, laying upon it. 

He wraps himself in letters sent by anxious parents. I see amazon boxes strewn about, with holes cut and stuffed with tuition money, rudimentary fleshlights for his personal gratification.

“Your textbook is my favorite,” He bellows, “The pleasure I derive from a freshman’s textbook, knowing the fear and anxiety you have endured without it is...” He pauses, clearly edging, “...Exquisite,” He purrs, with a sick, scaly smile.

I try to back away, but his tail quickly blocks the door.

“And where do you think you’re going, little one? Don’t you want your precious textbook?”

I didn’t. At this point I wanted nothing but to report the incident on SAIL immediately. This was not integrated learning. But I had come too far. I slowly approach the pile of letters, climbing over violated boxes covered with sticky golden scales. His forked tongue flickering, he welcomes my scent as I draw near, smoke venting from his nostrils faster and faster. The purell he was using as lube permeates my nostrils with it’s terrible stench.

“There it is,” He said.

And there it was indeed.

My textbook, torn and traumatized, laying precisely five feet and eleven inches from him. My fingers trembled as I firmly grasped it, almost in a trance. His heavy breathing slowly brought me back to reality. I looked upon him once more, his lower body now glazed with sick satisfaction.

“You have satisfied me. For now.” He motioned, relaxing his tail and freeing the doorway.

I left Speare, clutching my textbook as if my life depended on it. I shake, passing by students still in line, unaware of the horrors so near. I finally enter the safety of my room, still speechless.

My roommate notices my arrival. 

“Thank God they finally fixed the mail, I better get down there before it closes.”

I stared at him as he walked out the door, unable to find the words to warn him or to cry out. And there I was, alone, with nothing.

Nothing but my textbook.
articles.author: 5f8121f52796d045b7167969

articles.name: linkedin-down-on-account-of-ransomware-attack-business-students-and-professors-impotent
articles.title: LinkedIn Down on Account of Ransomware Attack, Business Students and Professors Impotent
articles.brief: Earlier this week, the online service that allows business majors to masturbate over Excel endorsements, LinkedIn Corporation™, announced a ransomware attack that has temporarily disabled their software and, reportedly, many user’s libido.
articles.text:
BOSTON, MA — Earlier this week, the online service that allows business majors to masturbate over Excel endorsements, LinkedIn Corporation™, announced a ransomware attack that has temporarily disabled their software and, reportedly, many user’s libido. What the company initially expected to be a brief downtime for their product has turned into what can only be described as a "Pregnant Virgin", a cluster fuck that’s left people wondering how this deviant breached the system in the first place, not to be confused with a "Trump Presidency".

The future uncertain, many LinkedIn users are worried how they’ll cope without this virtual pacifier they’ve sucked the teat of for so long. One such user and self-proclaimed beta-cuck, Poos E. Slayer, is worried about maintaining the professional relationships he has built on the platform.

“Her name is Jennifer. She messaged me for the first time a few months back as a LinkedIn employee looking to get a feel of my experience as a user. It was immediately clear, however, that what she really wanted was a feel of this Diiicccckkk! Ever since I confronted her about it with a nude, she has been playing hard-to-get, always giving me responses like ‘I’m sorry, I don’t have that skill yet’ or ‘Would you like me to connect you with someone else?’. With the service shutdown, I am worried she will forget what my dick looks like.”

After the interview with Slayer, further research by the Husky Husky staff revealed Jennifer was in fact an automated chat bot.

Beyond damaging otherwise flourishing relationships, the LinkedIn ransomware attack is also threatening higher education as we know it. Wharton, Kellog, Booth, Sloan, D’Amore McKim*... Many top-tier business schools are struggling maintaining curricula otherwise focused on optimizing a student’s LinkedIn persona. Without the ability to demonstrate accounts containing adequate buzzword counts and quintessential job acceptance posts, many professors are unsure how to prepare their students for the ‘real-world’ in the interim.

Northeastern University professor at the D’Amore McKim School of Business, Tom**, fears if the LinkedIn blackout lasts much longer he may have to resort to legitimate teaching.

“Yesterday I demonstrated to my class a ‘free market’ by setting up a free lemonade stand next to a group of kindergartners selling lemonade to raise money for a sick classmate. Tomorrow I plan on watching ‘The Wolf of Wallstreet.’ But after that, I worry I may be forced to violate school policy and teach the dark arts…” Tom then whispered what sounded like “supply and demand”.

2020 has been a challenging enough year in its own, and it sure as hell doesn’t make it any easier when you are told you can’t show off your my-only-experience-is-lifeguarding-but-I-will-call-it-wet-leisure-assistant-to-sound-official LinkedIn profile. So hopefully, sooner rather than later, the buisiness majors of the world will get their porn back.


* Editor's note, please forgive the oversight of the writer for including D’Amore McKim as top-tier business school

** We are unable to identify Tom by surname as he reportedly “forgot [his] last name a couple years ago. Coincidentally, it was around the time [he] stopped using business cards.”
articles.author: 5f28bde8d19e260835fecb99

articles.name: day-trading
articles.title: Northeastern Day Trading Club Accidentally Strikes it Rich
articles.text:
Boston, MA – The stock market is all the rage these days as students try to beat the only thing growing faster than their depression — debt. We interviewed a group of Northeastern frat boys, the Pon Z Traders, who are trying to strike gold with their innovative new trading strategies.

These frat bois, led by Mernie Badoff, have an extensive background in picking up chicks, chugging beers, and getting laid. According to them, this makes them perfect to “totally fuck up those wall street dorks.” They have taken their weekly alcohol stipends of $500 for the past 3 months and put them towards some totally righteous stocks in order to pay for their future rager.

However, their luck hasn’t been going too well. When asked how their past trades went, Badoff said: “We had invested in VAPE and DKS, but they both pussied out as soon as we gave them our hard-earned booze budget. Now we don’t even have enough money to throw our own parties anymore, and sex isn’t the same now that I can’t afford my ED medication.”

Two days after this interview was conducted, Badoff reached out to us. Apparently, they stole the remaining year’s beer budget to go all in on their latest gamble: the SEX stock ticker. Apparently PornHub has decided to make an IPO and all the horny teens from all across the world have invested heavily. Badoff has estimated a 42069% return on investment, and plans on blowing all the money on literal blow at their next rager.

articles.name: op-ed-reslife-please-ask-ras-to-contract-covid-19
articles.title: OP-ED: ResLife, Please Ask RAs to Contract COVID-19
articles.brief: Who would be responsible for reaching out to these potential bioweapons? Apparently, ResLife thought it would be wise for RAs to do this—in person no less. We couldn’t agree more.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – As was shared in an October 2nd email, a small number of students have failed to complete their COVID-19 testing at the required intervals. 

Yeah. That’s right. While you manage to juggle a D1 varsity sport, five classes, a part-time job, a committed relationship, and a fantasy football team without missing a single COVID-19 test, some lazy numbskulls think they’re too good to do their part while we navigate the deadliest pandemic in a century. (Yeah, I’m talking to you Lawrence. You’re not “too busy with frat stuff.” The test takes 5 minutes. You spent 7 hours playing die last Monday.)

According to the email, students behind on their testing were to be notified of their non-compliance and receive instructions on how to get tested. And who would be responsible for reaching out to these potential bioweapons? Apparently, ResLife thought it would be wise for RAs to do this—in person no less. We couldn’t agree more.

The job of an RA is fraught with danger. Pushing the button to open the door while proctoring can cause finger cramps. Walking into a dusty apartment during room checks can induce nasal congestion. Yelling “ResLife, open up!” over loud party music can lead to a sore throat. When one signs on to be an RA, they are clearly consenting to a life of danger.

That’s why we should send them in to round up all the anti-testers. They deal with danger every day, and this is a reasonable extension of their duties to the Northeastern Community. RAs knew when they applied for the job that they would be handling potential biohazards. This is what they’re paid to do! You don’t get to live in a cramped single in IV and eat Steast chicken without putting your life on the line every now and then. 

Look, I’m not saying it’s optimal, but someone has to confront these anti-testers face-to-face. We just don’t have the technology yet for people to be able to talk to each other in real time over mobile devices from the safety of their own homes. Someone needs to take on this risk to protect the pack, and RA Russian Roulette just seems like the fairest way to do it. 

Oh, but don’t let them do room checks yet. Those are far too dangerous.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: An RA puts his life on the line to confront Lawrence

articles.name: bostons-real-estate-brokers-to-be-tried-as-war-criminals
articles.title: Boston's Real Estate Brokers to be Tried as War Criminals
articles.brief: In a recent press briefing, Boston’s Mayor Marty Walsh announced his intention to reign in the scourge of real estate brokers plaguing the city
articles.text:
Boston MA—in a recent press briefing, Boston’s Mayor Marty Walsh announced his intention to reign in the scourge of real estate brokers plaguing the city. 

“Real estate brokers might be the greediest bastards in Boston, with the exception of Northeastern’s Board of Trustees,” Walsh said with a grin, “that’s why I am proud to announce that Boston will be the first city in the nation to treat brokers the way they deserve… as war criminals”. 

In their official press release, the mayor's office stated that collecting a broker’s fee would soon be classified as a violation of the Geneva Convention. The document also compared the thieving little shits brokers to the notorious ponzi scheme operator Bernie Madoff. It cited one key difference, “we didn’t publicly execute Bernie Madoff”. 

Walsh explained how real estate brokers are a subhuman race, possibly sent by God to punish mankind for its sins. A typical broker is both dumber than a D'aMore McKim student and (somehow) twice as evil.

Walsh pointed at an image of a high-end Mission Hill residence: a cockroach infested shack formerly occupied by a frat (who’s members are now on trial for hate crimes). He explained that this property charged a brokers fee of 72 months of rent, a kidney, and the tenants first born children. 

He also noted the property was so disgusting that some Northeastern students had caught chlamydia just by being within a twenty foot radius.

Walsh shook his fist at the sky, veins bulging from his forehead, and let out a guttural scream, “I WON’T TAKE THIS ANY LONGER!”

A reporter interjected, “Just how will you punish these fucking degenerates?” Walsh cracked his knuckles and giddily replied; “If it isn’t clear, we’re going to kill 'em all”. 

Walsh paused and stared down at the reporter, his face expressionless. He gravely whispered, “the streets will run red”.

After a beat, Walsh continued, “ehh… or maybe we’ll force them to attend Boston University. That’s probably worse.” The Mayor’s Office later added that brokers could also be sent to a ‘NUternment Camp’ operated by Northeastern University, which will force the broker scum to toil away on ISEC 2.

Some members of the press raised their concerns about the executions. Namely, social distancing will prevent the public from gathering around the hangman’s noose and cheering as each broker meets their untimely end. The mayor assuaged these bloodthirsty constituents by promising to stream the hangings live on Zoom. 

Walsh concluded by bellowing out to the crowd, “Fuck the New Deal... this will be the greatest government program of all time! Let’s hang ‘em all!”


*Disclaimer: The Husky Husky fully endorses any retaliation readers may take against their brokers. We don’t have shit to help you with legal fees, but will definitely cheer you on in court.
articles.author: 5ed14cacde0849334e412202
articles.attr: Mayor Walsh hopes to eradicate the scum responsible for broker's fees

articles.name: nuzeppelin-prepares-to-rain-death-upon-bus-campus
articles.title: NUZeppelin Prepares to Rain Death Upon BU’s Campus
articles.brief: Mere weeks ago, we discovered the plans for a giant NUZeppelin. This big boi balloon has just finished construction and is currently gearing up for aerial combat in the Boston skies...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Mere weeks ago, we discovered the plans for a giant NUZeppelin. This big boi balloon has just finished construction and is currently gearing up for aerial combat in the Boston skies. Aoun will be personally commanding the armada of balloons and drones from his luxury suite, and has put us in charge of procuring supplies in exchange for this exclusive article.

We are obviously going to be loading up some fuel for the engine: our tuition dollars. Not as good of a cause as going into Aoun’s pockets, but burning money is a once-in-a-lifetime felony that not many can experience and we couldn’t pass up the chance. 

Now that we’ve ensured we’ll be able to fly, we need to get some food to sustain the army of minimum-wage students manning the NUZeppelin. We sourced the absolute best quality slop from the top-rated local gulag, and each spoonful will be offered for a single meal swipe!

NU student Felix Cutler said: “I mean, it’s definitely disgusting, but hey, at least it’s not from Stwest!”

After making sure everyone got their weekly spoonful of slop, we had to get the most important things: weapons! As any self-respecting zeppelin aficionado would know, in order to achieve our aerial dominance we’ve dreamed of for so long, we need to arm ourselves with a variety of armaments, including: harpoons, tar barrels, boiling oil, trebuchets, bazookas, and slingshots. 

The slingshots in particular will be helpful when we cause BU students to lose the little brain function they have left as we rain down pennies of doom from the skies above their campus. Even with an accuracy of 1%, a single NU student’s tuition is enough to massacre the entirety of their student population.

We suspect they might attempt to retaliate by throwing frisbees and paper airplanes at us, so we have engineered a pattern for our drones to fly in that will serve to confuse and distract them: Aoun’s face. They will be so overwhelmed with Aoun’s sheer greatness relative to that of their President Brown that they’ll simply faint and fall to the ground, realizing the magnitude of the mistake they made by not just committing seppuku when they found out BU was their only option.
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: NUZeppelin firing at BU hot air balloon

articles.name: media-studies-major-creates-change-org-petition-demanding-northeastern-make-school-easy
articles.title: Media Studies Major Creates Change.org Petition Demanding Northeastern Make School Easy
articles.brief: Northeastern media studies major Cam Plainer has recently created a Change.org petition demanding that the Northeastern administration make school easier.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Northeastern media studies major Cam Plainer has recently created a Change.org petition demanding that the Northeastern administration make school easier.

“It’s not fair that there’s a pandemic and I still have to watch movies for two hours every week as homework. Plus I have to write a graded self-reflection paper! That’s too much work to do during these unprecedented times” said Plainer, a media studies major.

“Northeastern has completely set us up for failure” said Supreme Leader Maurice the Great, president of the Communist Clubs Coalition. “Investing a measly $50 million in allowing students to return to campus, creating an option for students who want to be remote, providing state-of-the-art testing, instructing professors to be understanding and work with students—these are just red herrings to distract you from the fact that Northeastern is an evil empire that has failed to single-handedly solve world poverty, end racism, discover unicorns, or stop the pandemic.”

Plainer says she is concerned about the mental health of students, especially ones who have to take hard classes like Movies 1000. “Northeastern has not hired at least three licensed therapists for each student. That’s an outrage. After all, a school’s purpose is to become a medical institution.”

Several students have expressed concerns about the structure of classes during a pandemic. “It’s outrageous to ask students to come in person. In-person classes are clearly harder for students with disabilities or those struggling with mental health challenges. It’s also unacceptable to ask students to learn online. Online learning is clearly inferior. We need some sort of hybrid system, something flexible that would give students the option to choose the type of learning that would work best for them.” 

Supporters on Change.org have included a number of profound reasons for signing:

“My friend Thomas asked me to sign it” writes Patrick McDonald.

“I have problems with authority figures” states Diane Levine.

“I went drinking last weekend instead of studying and bombed a midterm. Need a pass/fail policy to help me manage the stress of this event!” says Lawrence Castro.

Luckily, this story might have a happy ending. In her petition, Cam Plainer writes “I, for one, am appalled to have to identify with a university that failed its students in one of the most challenging periods of our lives.” To help her with this problem, we have started a Change.org petition asking her to transfer to the University of Alabama at Birmingham so that she can identify with a far superior university.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: Cam Plainer creates a petition to help her overcome the struggle of Movies 1000.

articles.name: nightingale-minotaur-gores-5-in-entirely-unforeseeable-accident
articles.title: Nightingale Minotaur Gores 5 in “Entirely Unforeseeable Accident”
articles.brief: “We could never have expected this in a million years.” Said Dan Mackleroy, a senior administrator at Northeastern Student Housing. “Gorefang was a sweet minotaur - and he only had the slightest tendency to fall into a dark and vengeful rage at the faint scent of blood."
articles.text:
Boston, MA – This Tuesday, 5 missing NEU students were finally found, their bodies strewn across the labyrinthian corridors of Northeastern’s Nightingale dorm. The students, who’s pallid corpses were rent so utterly beyond recognition that only dental records could confirm their identities, were believed to have been killed by Nightingale's new mascot, the “Gorefang, the Impaler”.


“We could never have expected this in a million years.” Said Dan Mackleroy, a senior administrator at Northeastern Student Housing. “Gorefang was a sweet minotaur - and he only had the slightest tendency to fall into a dark and vengeful rage at the faint scent of blood. We’re only confident of one thing at this stage - this was not Northeastern’s fault.”


Parents of the dismembered students, however, are blaming Northeastern. One NEU parent in particular, Lisa Vinod, is considering a lawsuit.


 “I just don’t think it’s fair to have a Minotaur dismember 5 students in a fit of hemoglobin fueled rage - and then charge them tuition for the rest of the semester. We were told drenching my little Kyle in lambs blood was supposed to keep the monster at bay while Kyle followed Ariadne’s string to his Marketing 2001 class. Now NEU is telling us their policy was to avoid blood?” 


“Look the lawsuit is entirely blown out of proportion,” said Mackleroy, referencing Vinod’s planned lawsuit of NEU. “Did we nurture a Kafkaesque bureaucracy winding around a freshman student body who were trapped in an ever-twisting Labyrinth designed by Daedalus himself? Yes. Were the students almost guaranteed to break the rules? Yes. Did we institute the death penalty to make an example of these students? Yes. I’m sorry, where was I?”


The broader Northeastern student administration has refused to comment on the story. They did, however, ask The Husky Husky to promote President Aoun’s new book: “Escaping From ‘Gorefang the Impaler’: My Experience at Northeastern”. The book, published by Harvard Press, releases this November.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
articles.attr: Pictured: The Nightingale Minotaur promoting vitality diversity at Northeastern.

articles.name: aoun-announces-last-minute-presidential-bid
articles.title: Aoun Announces Last-Minute Presidential Bid
articles.brief: Shortly after seeing the absolute disappointment of Americans everywhere following the first presidential debate, our supreme leader Aoun knew something had to be done...
articles.text:
Want to support Daddy Aoun’s presidential run? Buy his official campaign merch here

Boston, MA – Shortly after seeing the absolute disappointment of Americans everywhere following the first presidential debate, our supreme leader Aoun knew something had to be done. 

When polling the Northeastern student body, he discovered that everyone was going to be voting based on who they hated the least. That’s when Aoun knew that he had something neither candidate has… a chance at being genuinely trusted as a candidate! 

Aoun immediately launched his campaign with the slogan: “Unprecedented Greed at an Unparalleled Speed.” This communicates to his voter base of in-debt students that he is the grand puppeteer of their lives. However, this is clearly a good thing as at least we know what motivates him compared to candidates that we truly know nothing about.

You see, Northeastern is only able to charge a measly 72K a year because the government keeps trying to recoup student debt. How dare these students not be able to easily funnel money into Aoun’s hands without fear of future retribution!?! 

Aoun clearly is running for office for one reason, and one reason only: to make student debt forgivable to students who drop out. “Why?” you might ask. Well, I’ll tell you why. Imagine you’ve paid $300K to Aoun and are told that if you drop out and do it again all that debt gets wiped. Of course, you’d just drop out and try over and over again. This way Aoun maximizes the number of students running on the Northeastern hamster wheel powering his money printer.

Some students have spoken out against this. Here is the statement of James Zheng, a graduate student about to receive his diploma: 

“Clearly, this isn’t a fair method of debt forgiveness. My Masters in Latin cost me a total of $500K and my Starbucks job clearly isn’t going to cover it. I need this more than these incompetent drop-outs. And, almost as bad, Aoun is using the NUPD to manipulate all of our ballots. They’re even quarantining anyone who speaks out against them! Wait, did you hear that? OH FUCK… they’re here! EVERYBODY RUN FOR IT!”

As it turns out, the NUPD officers are actually extremely out of shape and were unable to chase after anyone, so everyone was safe to continue amassing debt.

#Aoun2020

I wish Aoun was my Daddy...

articles.name: aoun-authorizes-use-of-predator-drones-to-compel-remote-students-to-follow-covid-19-guidelines
articles.title: Aoun Authorizes Use of Predator Drones to Compel Remote Students to Follow COVID-19 Guidelines
articles.brief: Boston, MA – The Northeastern University administration made a press release earlier this week via email announcing that they would authorize the use of predator drones as a compliance measure for COVID-19 guidelines for students outside of campus. Aoun’s office explained that the Complete Ubiquitous Monitoring (CUM) system currently used to track students would be weaponized.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – The Northeastern University administration made a press release earlier this week via email announcing that they would authorize the use of predator drones as a compliance measure for COVID-19 guidelines for students outside of campus. Aoun’s office explained that the Complete Ubiquitous Monitoring (CUM) system currently used to track students would be weaponized.

“After the Westin 11 incident we came to a stunning realization. Students can’t sue us if we drone strike them.” said vice president of student affairs Madeleine Estabrook.

The predator drones come courtesy of a joint venture between Raytheon and Lockheed Martin Co-ops. The drones are outfitted with an upgraded version of the CUM that’s currently all over Northeastern and will be able to operate either remotely or using highly plagiarized automated flight and facial recognition software written by Fundies students. In the event that one of the drones encounters a student in violation of COVID-19 guidelines, it will issue a light warning in the form of an AGM-114 Hellfire missile.

The system certainly caught several remote students, who thought they were safe from Northeastern’s COVID-19 restrictions, off guard. “I was at a wedding the other night, then suddenly boom! Party Ruined. It felt like I was back home in the Middle East.” said one of the international students who fell victim to the upgraded CUM. The reception of the new CUM has certainly brought on several different opinions from students. While some call it a blatant violation of human rights, other students view it as a necessary step to maintain order. 

“I do think we need the system. Some students just don’t see the need for social distance when they’re not on campus and need a gentle reminder.” said basement dweller Arthur Johnson. Johnson later confirmed he hadn’t seen the light of day since March 17th.

Despite the controversy among those who feel the upgraded CUM system is either too much or not enough, most students aren’t even aware the system is in place. When asked about the system most students replied with a variation of “What email? Oh! You mean the that end up in my spam box?” among other common excuses. With noticeable spikes in COVID-19 cases, the weaponized CUM system is certainly going to have plenty of opportunity to prove worthy of the $2.3 BN development and deployment costs.
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21

articles.name: northeastern-expand-tunnels
articles.title: Northeastern to Expand Tunnels Under Huntington Ave
articles.brief: Earlier this week, Northeastern made a surprise purchase from the city of Boston. President Aoun and his clan of inner-city gentrifiers bought the rights to tunnel under Huntington Avenue...
articles.text:
Boston, MA - Earlier this week, Northeastern made a surprise purchase from the city of Boston. President Aoun and his clan of inner-city gentrifiers bought the rights to tunnel under Huntington Avenue. Unfortunately, this demolishes any remaining hope of the city improving the Green Line and actually putting the T underground like a normal subway so it doesn’t have to wait for traffic at stoplights and be casually passed by Tour de France wannabes.

After hearing noise complaints regarding the construction of ISEC 2 from students living near Columbus Avenue, Aoun believed the students on the west side of campus felt left out of the city campus experience.

“We’ve had quite a few complaints from students living in International Village and on Columbus, so I wanted to ensure there was an equal clusterfuck of noises happening on both sides of campus,” said Aoun, “and these new tunnels won’t look like your high school hallways either. These tunnels will be #covidproof. I’m writing a book about them too.”

To clarify the President’s statements, campus Narc-in-Chief Madeleine Estabrook followed, “the tunnels will be a vast twenty feet wide, so we still expect students to appropriately social distance.”

However, It is also our understanding that the queue of students preparing to use the tunnels will be waiting in a pre-existing five-foot-wide hallway. One that does not satisfy university social distancing requirements.

“Some things you just can’t control,” continued Estabrook as she stood in a crowd of about 300 students outside of Cabot waiting to take her 3rd COVID test of the day. “But students who fail to follow our social distancing requirements in the new tunnels and around campus will promptly be suspended and dismissed from their housing. Yes, even off-campus students.”

Northeastern recently struck a deal with the mayor of Boston giving the university supreme power and the ability to banish whomever they please from city limits for not following university COVID guidelines. 

“If a student even looks in the direction of another student while in the new tunnels, I can assure you they will be sleeping in a box on Mass Ave by the end of the week,” she finished.
articles.author: 5ed84098de0849334e412225
articles.attr: President Aoun single-handedly digs the new Northeastern tunnel.

articles.name: northeastern-day-traders-lose-big-in-shocking-3-correction
articles.title: Northeastern Day Traders Lose Big in Shocking 3% Correction
articles.brief: On the morning of October 28th, members of the Northeastern Day Trading Club watched in horror as the world was rocked by the biggest stock market crash in nearly a month.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – On the morning of October 28th, members of the Northeastern Day Trading Club watched in horror as the world was rocked by the biggest stock market crash in nearly a month. 

Since its founding earlier this fall, the club’s irresponsible, short-term market plays have reached bigger and bigger gains. Their investment thesis: “Stonks Only Go Up.” Now, for the first time in their several weeks of investment experience, stock charts were red. Reactions varied from shock to utter disbelief to suicide-inducing panic. This wasn’t supposed to happen – stonks were only supposed to go up!

Yours truly, the self-appointed Husky Husky market correspondent and heir apparent to Warren Buffet, attended the club’s emergency meeting Wednesday afternoon. Once they were done dumping their entire portfolios at a loss, we were able to reach out to a few members for interviews.

“This is the next Great Depression! Get out before you lose everything!” one member commented. [Editor’s note: The member was down 3%].

Another panicked investor told the Husky Husky, “They said this stocks thing was free money! What happened to ‘stonks only go up’?”

Some club members, like fearless leader Mernie Badoff, depended on their trades as a source of income. “How will I be able to afford booze now? I might have to… get a real job! I don’t even know how to do that!” said Badoff.

Several students were busy drafting a 1-star review for popular gambling trading app Robinhood. The review read, “App is broken. UI changed to this weird red color, and all my money disappeared from my account. Please fix!!!”

Other members of the club prayed for forgiveness at a makeshift altar decorated with photos of Elon Musk and Jerome Powell. Still more began selling all their possessions outside to make back some of the tuition money they had “invested” in TSLA calls.

Market futures point toward a partial recovery tomorrow, and by next week, this “Great Depression” will be forgotten. Nevertheless, at the rate the Day Trading Club is gambling away their life savings, I wouldn’t be surprised if the Ruggles Dollah Lady ends up with some company.
articles.author: 5f9cd18642eacb6a8bb46504
articles.attr: Pictured: Northeastern traders losing life savings

articles.name: spooky!-co-op-fired-for-dressing-up-as-nudist-for-office-halloween-party
articles.title: Spooky! Co-op Fired for Dressing up as Nudist for Office Halloween Party
articles.brief: Raytheon’s Halloween costume party took an unfortunate turn when third-year mechanical engineering major Tay Kitoff dressed up as a nudist.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – All co-op students look forward to office parties, especially when the company provides adult beverages. But Raytheon’s Halloween costume party took an unfortunate turn when third-year mechanical engineering major Tay Kitoff dressed up as a nudist. She has since been fired, but she will receive credit for the co-op if she logs the moment on SAIL. 

“Everyone always goes as like a slutty kitten or a slutty nurse or something, which is just super boring” said Kitoff. “I wanted to be different and creative, plus my budget was kinda small. So I went with nudist! Doesn’t look like my coworkers appreciated my cost-consciousness though.”

Surprisingly, OSCCR will not be taking any action against Kitoff. “She wore a mask and stayed at least 6 feet away from all partygoers, so we really have no complaints. You can show your rack if you protect the pack!”

Raytheon’s human resources department sent out a short statement on the incident. “Look, we know dress codes have become more relaxed since quarantine. Zooming in your pajamas is all well and good, but you can’t come into work naked. Your birthday suit does not count as business attire.” 

Kitoff is also facing criticism from several nudist colonies. “Our culture is not your costume!”

It looks like Kitoff will land on her feet though. The severance pay from Raytheon wasn’t bad, and she’s already received invitations to several 2021 Halloween frat parties.

comments.content: "You can show your rack if you protect the pack!". This is pure gold

articles.name: student-set-ballot-drop-off-box-on-fire-for-warmth-not-voter-suppression
articles.title: Student Set Ballot Drop Off Box on Fire for Warmth, Not Voter Suppression
articles.brief: In a set of shocking events last Sunday, a ballot drop box was mysteriously set on fire at Copley Square. The Husky Husky has taken it upon itself to solve this great injustice to democracy by forcing one of our countless indentured servants to investigate the situation.
articles.text:
In a set of shocking events last Sunday, a ballot drop box was mysteriously set on fire at Copley Square. The Husky Husky has taken it upon itself to solve this great injustice to democracy by forcing one of our countless indentured servants to investigate the situation. 


After some precise research and a very confidential consultation with NEUGigs, the Husky Husky has finally been able to pinpoint the culprits identity. As it turns out, the arsonist was not a MAGA Cultist, nor a campus republican, but a confused Californian NU.in student—Daisy Sunflower—acting in a spurt of snow related panic.


Since NEU Gigs generously provided us with Daisy’s NUID, phone number, home address, and SSN, the Husky Husky figured we might as well reach out for an exclusive interview. Speaking to us directly from the Westin dryer that President Aoun personally locked her in as punishment, Daisy gave us a very hot take.


“I mean ya, voter suppression is kinda not great but I’ve never seen snow before and didn’t realize it was like cold COLD you know? Massachussett’s will turn blue anyw—


The rest of her sentence was cut off when the dryer mysteriously turned on.


Due to legal issues regarding interviewing the subjects of Aoun’s impending cyborg trials and fear for our own safety, our research couldn’t be taken any further, but we are glad to have contributed what we could.


As a final note, The Husky Husky strongly urges Californians to utilize BU students as firewood, not ballot boxes.
articles.author: 5f3c703c2796d045b71678c9

articles.name: buckle-up-motherfuckers-its-election-day
articles.title: BUCKLE UP MOTHERFUCKERS, IT'S ELECTION DAY
articles.brief: Alright fuckers. We’ve waited all year for this shit, clenching our assholes and praying to Jesus that nothing else comes along and finishes us off. Well, that ends today! Or maybe today ends us! I hope you're ready...
articles.text:
Alright fuckers. We’ve waited all year for this shit, clenching our assholes and praying to Jesus that nothing else comes along and finishes us off. Well, that ends today! Or maybe today ends us! I hope you're ready.

So what absolute chads are vying to lead the shit filled dumpster fire formerly known as the United States of America? Entering from stage center-left, you know him, you don’t love him but at least find him passable, it’s JOE “is this really the best we could do?” BIDENNNNNN! His profound blandness has proven extraordinarily popular, confirming that deep down America wants our politicians to shut the fuck up. His record of questionable policy positions and gaffes is longer than a CVS receipt, but its 2020 y’all so nothing matters!!! Radio-carbon dating to determine his age is still forthcoming, but I give him a 6 out of 10 (chance of surviving 4 more years).

Entering from the right, we have the absolute alpha DONALD “hehehe Cheeto man” TRUMPPPPPPP! He fell ass-backward into this job 4 long years ago and has been throwing random shit at the wall like a horny orangutan ever since. That shit keeps hitting the wrong button over and over again, although that's China's fault if you really think about it. It's a great tragedy he can't evade rape accusations as well as he evades taxes. I give him a 1 out of 10 (chance of dragging the US into fascism).

So when will we know the winner by? Will Trump steal the election? What about mail-in ballots? All great questions for you to fucking figure out on your own. I’ll be halfway through a handle of Everclear before polls even close. Can’t worry about the fate of democracy if you’re getting your stomach pumped at Mass General! But when I awaken from my drunken stupor and look out upon the scorched remnants of our once mediocre civilization, I can only hope America made the right choice. 

#Kanye2020
articles.author: 5eae0e221d76bb6ac5fe449b

articles.name: ruggles-lady-brings-new-toll-booth-to-northeastern
articles.title: Ruggles Lady Brings New Toll Booth to Northeastern
articles.brief: If you’ve been at Northeastern for a while, you’ve probably seen her when you make your frightening jog across the dangerous bridge at Ruggles Station. Whether she’s sitting on a bench, yelling at a Dunkin employee, or just waiting to pounce on the first unsuspecting student that passes by, there’s no way you’d miss our favorite Ruggles Lady...
articles.text:
Boston, MA – If you’ve been at Northeastern for a while, you’ve probably seen her when you make your frightening jog across the dangerous bridge at Ruggles Station. Whether she’s sitting on a bench, yelling at a Dunkin employee, or just waiting to pounce on the first unsuspecting student that passes by, there’s no way you’d miss our favorite Ruggles Lady.

Unfortunately, due to corona, Ruggles Lady was forced to temporarily vacate her post in March due to public health guidelines. (Looks like she follows the rules better than at least 11 of our favorite NUin students). However, she has recently finished her social distancing preparations and has officially arrived back at Ruggles.

But with the nation facing a critical coin shortage, her days of panhandling from students on their way to class is over. Instead, Ruggles Lady has entered the world of contactless payment and installed a toll booth at the entrance of Ruggles. This booth is complete with walls, a plastic partition, and a sniper tower to enforce the tolls. 

To enter Ruggles, one must now wait in the 2-hour line, deposit the traditional $20 Ruggles Lady Harassment-Avoidance Fee, and then proceed onwards. 

However, that’s not all! To gently encourage passersby to pass through her booth, she has hired the Ruggles Jehovah’s Witnesses to flank both sides of the Forsyth traffic loop to corral students into the booth.

If you have the $20 for the toll, then the worst is behind you. However, the unlucky few college students whose parents won’t fund their expensive escapades will be forced to steal a stranger’s ATM card and withdraw $20 from their accounts, plus $30 as an inconvenience fee to be paid directly to Ruggles Lady.

With this new setup, Ruggles Lady has multiplied her revenue more than tenfold, growing from raking in a measly $180/day to a ground-breaking $2K/day. When asked if she would use this money to get an education at the school whose students’ money she extorts, she responded; 

“I can literally make 2 grand a day by hanging out in a public transit stop. What the fuck do I need an education for? While I might wear these rags on duty, I actually live in the mansion next to Aoun’s. We often have tea and compare our techniques of stealing money from students.”
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Ruggles Lady manning her toll booth

articles.name: breaking-engineering-student-happy
articles.title: Breaking: Engineering Student Happy
articles.brief: Boston, MA -- The Northeastern campus was rocked on Tuesday when third year mechanical engineering student Andrew Roberts, who asked to remain anonymous, allegedly woke up with an optimistic outlook on the day and “happy thoughts”. The horrifying incident was immediately reported by Carol Livermore, his fluid dynamics professor and mandatory reporter.
articles.text:
Boston, MA -- The Northeastern campus was rocked on Tuesday when third year mechanical engineering student Andrew Roberts, who asked to remain anonymous, allegedly woke up with an optimistic outlook on the day and “happy thoughts”. The horrifying incident was immediately reported by Carol Livermore, his fluid dynamics professor and mandatory reporter. 


“It was shocking,” said Livermore, who was still shuddering from the incident. “I looked over a sea of gray and teary faces over Zoom, as per usual, only to be met with a cheerful and vibrant face I could hardly recognize.” 


Thankfully, Roberts was sent to UHCS for immediate drug testing. 


“We had to lock our doors and hide under the desks,” said UHCS, “But we were already doing that. Thank Aoun we had these safety protocols in place.” Condoms were thrown at the student until he left.


No Husky Husky reporter was able to meet with Roberts, as he was flocked with pre-med students hoping this strange illness was both contagious and terminal. Others were more sceptical.


“He’s just having a psychotic break.” Said local dollar lady, “I see plenty walking through here, usually a bit more twitchy though. Now about that dollar?”(The Husky Husky reporter did not have a dollar, but offered two Husky Husky interns instead). 


The issue persisted throughout the day, with multiple calls to the NUPD reporting a student walking upright and confidently through Centennial.


“We questioned him multiple times,” said local officers Patricia Walsh and Thomas Fucurio, “He swears up and down not to be a business major, and we eventually had to let him go.”


Andrew’s roommates finally put our fears to rest when they told us that at approximately 4:19 am, while studying, his sickeningly good mood and positive attitude had finally subsided, leaving behind the empty husk of a student they all knew. President Aoun is planning on releasing a statement Friday, promising to never let this tragic event happen again.
articles.author: 5f8121f52796d045b7167969
articles.attr: POV: Always Has Been Meme

articles.name: 1-guest-policy
articles.title: Tips & Tricks on How to Abuse New 1 Guest Policy
articles.brief: Recently, the Northeastern administration has decided to relax their restrictions on guests in your room to allow for 1 guest from the same residence hall to enter your room at a time. Therefore, I have supplied some great tips and tricks on how you can use and abuse this new allowance to hang out with people in your dorm, and maybe even make your very first friend!
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Recently, the Northeastern administration has decided to relax their restrictions on guests in your room to allow for 1 guest from the same residence hall to enter your room at a time. Unfortunately, my editor said this isn’t noteworthy since everyone who has a social life had already been ignoring the restrictions. However, since you’re reading my articles, I’m pretty confident that you don’t fall into that category. 

Therefore, I have supplied some great tips and tricks on how you can use and abuse this new allowance to hang out with people in your dorm, and maybe even make your very first friend!

Tip 1 – Invite over your RA:

While your RA might not be your friend, that doesn’t mean you can’t have them over! One sure-fire way to get your RA to take a walk to your room is to send them an anonymous message that you are having a party in your room. Won’t they be surprised when it turns out it’s a slumber party especially for them!

Tip 2 – Eat with your Neighbors:

When your RA is busy with classes, you’ll need someone else to binge-drink with. Your neighbors might normally avoid you (after all, your snoring keeps them up every night), but I’m confident that with hard work, persistence, and shameless begging, you will be sure to have your neighbors over for a nice homemade dinner of al-dente ramen.

Tip 3 – Proctors are your friends:

What if your room is a bit of a mess after your hardcore self-care sessions earlier this morning? Maybe your roommate drove you out after finding your totally normal commemorative photobook with pictures of them sleeping? Either way, you’re sure to need to find someone to chat with in the meantime. 

Proctors are contractually obligated to stay at their desks, so feel free to just meander down to the proctor station and chat them up for an hour or two. Sure, they’ve got earbuds in and are playing League Of Legends, but they’re definitely listening to you!

Tip 4 – Invite Yourself Into Someone’s Room:

Sometimes, there’s just no one around willing to hang out with you. Not because you’re weird or anything, just because they have bad taste. Anyway, in a situation like that, just find someone heading to their room and follow them in. Make sure they don’t notice you until you’re in, and then just relax in a chair and read a book as you wait for them to make you dinner. 

You’ll get a nice ambient noise of the NUPD sirens as they arrive to take you away, but in the meantime, you will get your court-assigned therapist’s prescribed dose of human interaction from the residents of the room you’re in as they beg you to leave.


Make sure to try out all four of our Aoun-Approved tips to have a great time with your fellow residents. If, for some reason, these god-tier tips don’t work out for you, just remember that you wouldn’t have ever had friends anyway, so you didn’t lose anything regardless!
articles.author: 5ee693b7de0849334e41224e
articles.attr: Frat house being responsible with no guests past their 50 residents

articles.name: nuin-students-hang-clotheslines-between-buildings-because-none-of-the-dryers-work
articles.title: N.U.in Students Hang Clotheslines Between Buildings Because None of the Dryers Work
articles.brief: Boston, MA – Dryer wait times have become unbearable in the Westin, an inexplicable phenomenon that has absolutely nothing to do with the fact that there are about 3-5 working dryers on a good day. Desperate times have evidently resulted in desperate measures, with many N.U.inmates stringing up clotheslines between the Westin and nearby buildings to avoid the hellscape that is the Westin laundry room.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Dryer wait times have become unbearable in the Westin, an inexplicable phenomenon that has absolutely nothing to do with the fact that there are about 3-5 working dryers on a good day. Desperate times have evidently resulted in desperate measures, with many N.U.inmates stringing up clotheslines between the Westin and nearby buildings to avoid the hellscape that is the Westin laundry room.

An intrepid, dashingly handsome (and did I mention single?) Husky Husky reporter reached out to an N.U.in student for her perspective. The student, who requested to remain anonymous, told the Husky Husky, “By the time I got a dryer and finished my laundry last time, I hadn’t seen the sunlight in days.” 

The student gestured to the clothesline spanning between her 20th floor window and the adjacent Marriott, “Now that I have the clothesline, I can finish my next load of laundry before the end of the semester!”

When asked why she appeared to be alone in a double room, the student’s eyes welled up, and she stammered, “my roommate… [sniffles] ...there was an accident…she was trying to get her clothes off the line...lost her balance...I miss her so much! [crying]”

While the students seem enthusiastic about their new solution, Copley residents and the hotel administration are unimpressed. Complaints ranging from “Those stupid clotheslines block our view,” “Those dumb kids smashed my window trying to anchor a clothesline to the building! That should be illegal!”, and “These panties just fell on my head” are increasingly common among displeased locals.

A spokesperson for the N.U.in program told the Husky Husky, “We are aware that many students feel hung out to dry by the laundry situation, and while we hate to be the wet blanket, we must draw the line. We aren’t going to throw in the towel until this problem is ironed out – we expect any students involved to come clean. Students, feel free to drop us a line with any questions.”
articles.author: 5f9cd18642eacb6a8bb46504
articles.attr: Nothing says "classy hotel" like clotheslines dangling out of windows (Image credit: Clax)

articles.name: record-breaking-25-of-incoming-freshman-are-confused-northwestern-applicants
articles.title: Record-Breaking 25% of Incoming Freshman are Confused Northwestern Applicants
articles.brief: When we asked St. Paul native Kim Deal when she realized she had applied to the wrong school, she looked curiously at the Prudential Tower as seen from Huntington Avenue and responded “This isn’t Chicago?”
articles.text:
BOSTON, MA - The Northeastern University Office of Undergraduate Admissions announced this morning that 25% of the incoming Class of 2024 enrolled at Northeastern because they thought it was the Chicago-based Northwestern University. While this group usually makes up a significant portion of the freshman class, it has never risen above 20%.


For virtually the entire history of the two universities, a number of students intending to apply to one have erroneously applied to the other, realizing their mistake too late. During the 20th century this number was small, but the advent of internet-based applications have seen this number skyrocket in recent years.


First-year Frank Black from Evanston, Illinois, explains “I was so excited to bike from my home to campus every day to avoid housing costs, but then I took another look at my acceptance letter and found out I had to spend $72k and move to Boston.”


When we asked St. Paul native Kim Deal when she realized she had applied to the wrong school, she looked curiously at the Prudential Tower as seen from Huntington Avenue and responded “This isn’t Chicago?”


President Aoun offered his remarks on this startling uptick in a speech this afternoon: “We are extraordinarily happy to welcome our new students from the midwest. Even if this is not the campus they pictured when they filled out their application, we are confident that they will be wonderfully successful here at North*cough*stern.” When asked if he will take any measures to prevent this confusion in the future, Aoun responded “Absolutely not! We need as many kids as we can get who aren’t from New fucking Jersey.”


“Due to the COVID-19 pandemic,” explained Aoun, “we will be unable to meet with Northwestern’s President Schapiro this year in a neutral location to exchange students in a one-for-one, prisoner-of-war type deal as we have in years past.”


“So you midwestern freaks are here to stay, ” he concluded, “hope you like chowder.”

comments.content: Truly inspiring the generosity seen during these tough times.

articles.name: northeastern-adds-3000-new-and-unique-campus-locations
articles.title: Northeastern Adds 3,000 New and Unique Campus Locations
articles.brief: Since giving students the option to stay at home for the fall semester, Northeastern University has been taking steps to ensure that remote learners don’t get too comfortable in their own homes.  Or, what used to be their homes.
articles.text:
Your House, USA – Since giving students the option to stay at home for the fall semester, Northeastern University has been taking steps to ensure that remote learners don’t get too comfortable in their own homes.


Or, what used to be their homes. Utilizing obscure passages from the Northeastern Constitution and the Quibi terms and services, the university has claimed the houses and land of each of NEU’s 3,000 remote learners through eminent domain, a process that is irreversible because of Northeastern’s status as a non-profit, “fuck you” institution.


Since carrying out this territorial coup de grâce, the university has been hard at work ensuring that students follow strict COVID-19 guidelines. Watched by drones and surveillance cameras (“So much for being robot-proof,” said one anonymous RA), students must now wear masks when walking from their childhood bedroom to the shower they don’t share with anyone, and maintain healthy social distancing from their parents when eating around the dinner table. If students fail to complete their Daily Wellness Check, learners will find themselves face-to-face with a projected warning from president Joseph Aoun, who seems to always appear just as they are about to begin… violating November’s traditional no ‘private-time’ practice.


The Northeastern Student Housing Affairs Rights Team (referred to as NUShart) has filed a purely symbolic lawsuit on the students’ behalf, alleging that the move violates the 3rd Amendments rights of students, since the proctors that now sit outside of each of the 3,000 new residence halls technically count as soldiers of the Northeastern government. Through séance, we were able to reach the ghost of James Madison for comment. Visibly excited by the news, he said “Finally, that one hasn’t been used in centuries. I told them it would be important.”


There have been mixed student reactions to the move- many dissidents have self-immolated in protest, while some have drafted a letter of complaint to the administration. The letter, drafted by third-year English major Camera Hoff, explains that the university should not take steps to make students at home give a single fuck. 


“I stayed home because of my severe asthma, but now that I’m here, I do not want to hear a single word about protecting the pack. I am the m*therf*cking pack,” Hoff said.


 Other signatories of the letter agree. Noah Comment, a first-year Political Science major in the NUStart program, said “While I’ve never had the chance to exercise my right to have guests in my room, I know this will be the year. Please. Someone. I’m so fundamentally broken and alone.”
articles.author: 5fb33fd142eacb6a8bb4652c
articles.attr: Pictured: Remote Students Having Fun in Class (Credit: Diogenes)

articles.name: northeastern-hr-department-professors-are-worth-less-than-garbage
articles.title: Northeastern HR Department: Professors are “worth less than garbage”
articles.brief: In a leaked internal email last week Northeastern University’s human resources department revealed their comprehensive plans for forcing convincing professors to teach in person during the spring semester.
articles.text:
Boston, MA– In a leaked internal email last week Northeastern University’s human resources department revealed their comprehensive plans for forcing convincing professors to teach in person during the spring semester.


This is a shocking turn of events given the University Administration’s history of completely avoiding major scandals and legal battles concerning its Covid policies. Nevertheless, the entire email reads as follows:


“Dear Meat Puppets,


After analyzing recent patterns of Covid-19 at Northeastern, we have come to two major conclusions- The number of Covid cases on campus is directly correlated with Frisky Husky funding and, more importantly, the added profits from housing and tuition far outweigh the cost of replacing professors who will likely be “incapacitated” from the virus.


For this reason and because of the added experiential learning for epidemiology majors, we have decided to force all staff members to return to campus in the coming semester. We understand that this will be a scary transition for many professors, and we promise this decision was made with heavy hearts and the purest intentions- these being profit, money, and greed.


To anyone concerned for their health, please do not worry- We at Northeastern always try our best to foster a safe, comfortable atmosphere in the workplace. We are proud to say that we will be paying 5% of the funeral costs for any professor who dies from Covid while working on campus!


If any professors still refuse to teach on campus, we want to say that we understand and appreciate your concerns, and eagerly await your resignation.


Sorry if you die lol, not my problem!”  


This email truly puts this decision into perspective and makes it abundantly clear that Northeastern University makes the wellbeing of its staff its utmost priority. After all, when has Northeastern ever valued its money more than its education? Certainly not when deciding to pay the heads of its administration over $1 million more than its average professor! I, for one, am proud to be attending such an empathetic and altruistic center of learning.

articles.name: oped-i-wear-canada-goose-its-not-about-status-its-about-killing-geese
articles.title: Op-Ed: I wear Canada Goose. It's not about status, it's about killing geese
articles.brief: Geese are nothing more than feathered rats and I am the exterminator of the skies.  I’m a proud owner of an $80,000 Canada Goose ‘I’m-Better-than-You-and-I-Know-It” jacket. There is way too much stigma over how ‘expensive’, ‘attention whoring’, and ‘bourgeoisie’ these jackets are. Those descriptions might be true, but my fellow NU students are missing the point.
articles.text:
Geese are nothing more than feathered rats and I am the exterminator of the skies. 

I’m a proud owner of an $80,000 Canada Goose ‘I’m-Better-than-You-and-I-Know-It” jacket. There is way too much stigma over how ‘expensive’, ‘attention whoring’, and ‘bourgeoisie’ these jackets are. Those descriptions might be true, but my fellow NU students are missing the point. 


Sure, I want to flex on broke bitches on my way to class but this jacket represents a bigger goal. I want to see every last goose on earth burn in hell. 


Now I’m just like everyone else at this school, a real down to earth guy. Like you, daddy’s oil money paid for a new building so I could dutifully spend five years getting piss drunk in stingy mission hill frat houses, cheating on 1000 level accounting courses, and unironically using the phrase ‘brodie’ (studying finance). 


I simply cannot believe that every living soul at this school doesn't wear Canada Goose. I mean, there is NOTHING stopping you from dipping into your trust fund.


Oh god, they’re so fucking warm too. I can barely stop myself from dropping to my knees, throwing my head back, and cackling like a witch when I see some broke ass bitch shiver in the cold.


But I digress. The geese are the real enemy here. They. Are. Evil. 


Science proves that geese feed on cigarette butts, lost dogs, and fear. Their soulless eyes--black and lifeless, like a shark--strike terror into all who see them. 

Geese have razor sharp teeth too. THAT’S REAL. LOOK IT UP. 


If their ugly and monstrous appearance wasn’t bad enough, their minefield like shitting behaviour turns the fens into the aftermath of a civil war. 


Whenever I take a stroll through the fens, protected by my Canada Goose Jacket of course, I make it a habit to grab a goose by the neck, swing my body in a circle with the power of an olympic hammer thrower, and yeet that bitch towards Comm Ave. 


I know what you're thinking, “Isn’t it more fun to punt geese like a football?”. The tangled mess of bite marks on my legs can assure you, it's twice the fun but twice the danger.


Physical combat can only do us so much good. Every Canada Goose jacket is made using dozens of geese corpses-- which is metal as fuck. So please, buy a Canada Goose jacket. You’ll stop being poor and help slaughter the filthy sky demons that have plagued us for too long.

comments.name: goose game goose
comments.content: wow killing the lgbt community I see

comments.name: Not_MissionHill_frat
comments.content: Dude my dad has tech money not oil money. Get ur shit right. If I was oil money, I’d be some dumb republitard.

comments.name: Frack me Goosy
comments.content: I can assure you that punting a goose is well worth the scratches. They never see that shit coming

comments.name: Oil Baby
comments.content: As an oil baby, I support this wholly despite not wasting my money on a Canada Goose Jacket.
