articles.name: 2021-beanpot-canceled-over-goya-bean-controversy
articles.title: 2021 “Bean”pot Canceled over Goya Bean Controversy
articles.brief: Cancel culture has claimed its latest victim—the 2021 Beanpot.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Cancel culture has claimed its latest victim—the 2021 Beanpot. After Goya CEO Bob Unanue’s outspoken support for President Trump, many have boycotted the bean company. To avoid being inadvertently associated with Goya beans, the 2021 Beanpot has been canceled. 

“We just couldn’t risk any public backlash over being associated with beans,” said Jay Bush, a spokesperson for the tournament organizers. “The cancellation of Harvard’s season wasn’t really a factor in this decision. We were just going to sub in UMass, an arguably more prestigious school. And COVID-19 wasn’t a concern either. Northeastern is the only school whose students show up to the Beanpot anyway, so social distancing in TD Garden would have been easy. We were just concerned about our public image with this whole bean controversy.”

Progressive groups at various schools threatened to Tweet in outrage for a week or two if the Beanpot if the tournament was held. 

“Holding a tournament associated with be*ns is incredibly insensitive, especially in these times,” said Supreme Leader Maurice the Great of the Northeastern Communist Clubs Coalition (NUCCC). “Any remote association with G*ya is a racist macroaggression, and we were prepared to take radical steps to fight such injustice.” 

Cam Plainer, chief strategist for the NUCCC, outlined the menacing plan that scared organizers away from hosting the tournament. “We had several Change.org petitions ready to go, and we even had a vicious MySpace post ready to send to our 53 followers. We’re glad the tournament has been canceled in 2021 to avoid the need for such drastic measures.”

Tournament organizers are hopeful the controversy will have subsided enough that the 69th Beanpot can be held in 2022. Nice.

comments.name: Aaa
comments.content: Wait...this was supposed to be the 69th Beanpot? Out of all the things COVID has taken from us, this is the most devastating...

articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: Beanpot organizers wary of being associated with Goya.

articles.name: campus-contrarian-sad-to-see-end-of-trump-presidency
articles.title: Campus Contrarian Sad to See End of Trump Presidency
articles.brief: “While I didn’t support all of his policies,” said the third year business major, “I’ll sure miss getting a rise out of my peers by dick riding him in every class discussion, just for laughs.”
articles.text:
Boston - In a wholly unsurprising turn of events, campus contrarian Derrick Tulowitski expressed his sorrow last Friday with the upcoming end of the Trump presidency.

“While I didn’t support all of his policies,” said the third year business major, “I’ll sure miss getting a rise out of my peers by dick riding him in every class discussion, just for laughs.”

“That is, unless Rudy and Sidney unleash the kraken, blow up Georgia, and #stopthesteal.”

Derrick, who identifies as an “anti SJW”, says that “triggering the blue haired girls” had become a bright spot for him in a dark world. 

“Northeastern's always been a cesspool of beta males and snowflakes, but it feels like it's gotten worse in the last year. Ever since Aoun failed to condemn ANTIFA and the BLM rioters in his anti-racism statement last June, I’ve felt my kind is a dying breed on campus,” the maverick told our correspondent. “I’m probably one of the last freethinkers left.”

“Besides maybe the ‘socialism sucks’ protestor,” he added.  

For Derrick, Trump’s defeat means the end of sneering at campus protests, and making snide remarks to anyone who will listen about flyers plastered around campus. His few friends voiced their concerns about his future wellbeing.

“I just don’t know how the kid will function,” said Kevin Darowitz, Derrick’s roommate. “He was so happy on election night before all the mail ins got counted. He kept talking about how he was gonna dunk on everyone in his 8 AM. Now he’s been spending the last few weeks sending me all these Project Veritas videos about fraud and shit. It’s really unhinged, I’ve taken to staying at my girlfriend’s place more than usual just to get away from him. “

While Derrick seems to have moved marginally closer to accepting the results of the election, he doesn’t seem to have settled on any new stand ins for a personality

“Owning the libs has been my entire life! What am I supposed to do now? Get a girlfriend?”

At press time, Derrick was said to have resorted to Aoun simping anytime someone criticizes admin policy, attempting to fill the Donald sized hole in his heart.
articles.author: 5f5ac7db2796d045b7167922
articles.attr: Poor Derrick overdoses on copium in Krentzman

articles.name: final-death-toll-for-no-nut-november-surpasses-243
articles.title: Final Death Toll for No Nut November Surpasses 243
articles.brief: The rising dawn of December 1st will bring with it the end to a barren time. After a hard month of withdrawal from onlyfans, e-girls, and simpery, boys and men alike can bask in the glory of their retained virility. The risk  for some, however, proved to be too great. At time of publication, 243 fellow soldiers have lost their spunk. Some local students have begun to question whether the cost was worth it.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – The rising dawn of December 1st brought with it the end to a barren time. After a hard month of withdrawal from onlyfans, e-girls, and simpery, boys and men alike can bask in the glory of their retained virility. The risk  for some, however, proved to be too great. At time of publication, 243 fellow soldiers have lost their spunk. Some local students have begun to question whether the cost was worth it. 

“I just thought it would be a fun challenge to do with my friends,” Reginald Sellibate told The Husky Husky floating amidst the graves of his bros. “Honestly, we didn’t think we would make it past the first 5 hours.” Mr. Sellibate and his friends decided to tackle No Nut November together, and for a time, the homies were dry. It only took until the end of the first week before their efforts took a grim turn.

“Chase was the first to go.” Mr. Sellibate told us, his stoic divinity betraying nothing of his emotion. That fateful night of November 12th, Chase Cashew passed away in his sleep. He was taken by a wet dream. The cause of death? 

Drowning.

“He was so young, but it was just his time, I suppose.” By the time the end of the month rolled around, the rest of Reginald’s posse would also succumb in similar fashion. Mr. Sellibate was the only one to survive and reap the benefits of his discipline. His incorporeal form was truly blinding to behold. Reginald’s raw energy became overwhelming as the interview went on - 3 interviewers lost their ability to perceive the physical realm - so we cut our time short and left him to his transcendence. 

Brady Buckets was another brother lost to the jissom void. We got into contact with his now single girlfriend, who has chosen to remain anonymous, to hear about his final escapades.

“We thought it only applied to masturbation! When he came over I couldn’t help myself.” After months of lockdown and built up tension, the young couple couldn’t pass up their chance. 

“He just came and went. This isn’t what I meant when I said I would suck his soul out!” 

God bless you, Brady.

Our condolences to those of you who have lost a loved one. You can rest easy knowing they died as they lived. 

With no regrets.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f
articles.attr: Mr. Sellibate celebrating his ascendance over the graves of his homies

articles.name: student-government-sets-out-to-slightly-improve-inane-part-of-student-life
articles.title: Student Government Sets out to Slightly Improve Inane Part of Student Life
articles.brief: Northeastern's esteemed student government is launching a new initiative just for you!
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Northeastern students, as we know, complain about everything: 

“University health services are terrible!”

“I am 179K in debt in an increasingly unstable job market!”

“Northeastern has actively participated in the gentrification of nearby communities and continually finds ways to steal money from both students and the city of Boston!”

Yadda yadda yadda. Why can’t they be happy with their experiential education?

Well never fear, huskies, for the powers up above have heard your pleas. Northeastern’s ever faithful student government has taken it upon themselves to address absolutely none of your concerns! 

“This has been in the works for a long time,” Connor McCormick, undisputed president of the student government, told The Husky Husky. “It is with pride and joy that we announce the beginnings of the council for ethical hand sanitizer!” 

As he spoke, McCormick motioned with his hands as if to quell our excitement. “I know, I know. This is a big step for both the SGA and for students alike! With this, we can get our foot in the door with the administration and maybe get some more ambitious policy going. Who knows? Maybe in five or six years, the administration will consider creating a council for the hand soap dispensers!”

The administration could not be reached for comment. Reportedly, they were too busy disbanding the hand sanitizer council.

This just goes to show: Northeastern is a small underfunded university. We at the Husky Husky fully expect, and hope, the administration curtails such pompous use of the meager endowment in the future.
articles.author: 5ea89c3fb7e61d16ce967c1f
articles.attr: Optimal decisionmaking at work

articles.name: northeastern-emails-wrapped
articles.title: Northeastern Emails: Wrapped
articles.brief: Just days ago, social media accounts were flooded with vivid imagery: Spotify Wrapped. But know what is even more annoying? The greatest hits of this year’s Northeastern emails. Here’s what emails my inbox couldn’t get enough of in 2020.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – Just days ago, social media accounts were flooded with vivid imagery: Spotify Wrapped. Sure, being in the top 99% of BTS or 0.00001% of White Noise 24 Hours listeners is super duper inspiring knowledge that all of your followers must know. But know what is even more inspiring? The greatest hits of this year’s Northeastern emails. Here’s what emails my inbox couldn’t get enough of in 2020: 


Bookstore Sale

Wow, another sale for a $600 sweatshirt? Yesterday’s BOGO 1% off sale hasn’t even expired yet!


ACTION REQUESTED – Overdue for a COVID-19 Test

Why should I, a CS major, get tested? Can’t get COVID-19 if I never leave my room! But if this is a free offer to get penetrated… I guess my nasal cavity will suffice!


Canvas Recording

Take a shot every time you receive a [recording available] email. You’ll stop dreading the Grade Changed: 0/100 notifications once you die of alcohol poisoning. 


Important Scam Resources: Please Read

Are you telling me that Penn Facilities Real Estate Services isn’t really offering me a co-op? But they told me that I was special! 


NU ALERT: (NATURE OF ALERT) issued for (LOCATION)

Very informative. A+ content. I feel exponentially safer now.


Northeastern Billing Statement

Had to fish this one out of my junk mail, but it doesn’t seem that important. I’m not a finance major, I don’t know what this concept of ~money~ is. 


Northeastern University Plus One Program 

No thanks. Send to trash.
articles.author: 5f150107d19e260835fecb5a
articles.attr: Pictured: #2020NEUWrapped

articles.name: students-for-justice-in-palestine-disband-after-galactic-federation-rules-settlements-legal
articles.title: Students for Justice in Palestine Disband After Galactic Federation Rules Settlements Legal
articles.brief: “The existence of an outside arbiter strong-arming us into accepting settlements is a total game changer we haven’t faced before, and thus there is no reason for further action.”
articles.text:
Boston- In a stunning turn of events, Northeastern’s Students for Justice in Palestine has announced its dissolution Tuesday morning, following the Galactic Federation’s decree that West Bank settlements are totally legit.

“It is our grave duty to announce that our movement, to put it bluntly, has failed,” the group put out in a statement. “The existence of an outside arbiter strong-arming us into accepting illegal settlements is a total game changer we haven’t faced before, and thus there is no reason for further action.”

The move comes in the wake of an announcement from Haim Eshed, former head of the Israeli Extraterrestrial Sorcery department, that extraterrestrials exist, have been in contact with the United States and Israel for years, and have given their blessing to the West Bank settlements.

The last time we communicated, they didn’t say much, and I wasn’t really able to understand what they were saying,” admitted Eshed. “Actually, I couldn’t understand any of their language, but when their eyes glowed and the room shook with fury, I took that as a tacit endorsement.

“We knew for years that the settlements had to happen, but we figured it would be good to sit on the rationale for a while. But after a little bit, people were starting to get the wrong idea that maybe they weren’t justified. Rest assured. The Federation said it’s chill.”

The SJP’s dissolution comes as a shocking conclusion to a month of vigorous campus debate (i.e. shitposts on Wild Confessions) on the subject. The Husky Husky reached out to one representative of the SJP, a Palestinian native who wished to go nameless, lest she invoke the wrath of the Galactic Federation. She voiced dismay at SJP disbanding, but expressed the futility of its goals.

“There’s really no place to go from here. What are we supposed to do, Boycott, Divest, and Sanction the entire Galactic federation? Resisting the will of the entire political establishment of the United States was one thing, but we dare not move against representative Gunray [of the Federation]. I’d rather live under an apartheid state than an apartheid intergalactic empire.”

When reached for comment, the Northeastern Students for Israel expressed their satisfaction with the ruling. 

“After decades of the being told settlements violated the Geneva conventions and international law, we are happy to have the approval of a body that doesn’t subscribe to the puny laws and morals of mere mortals,” said the group representative. “Furthermore, we hope the Galactic Federation will provide the ‘only democracy in the Middle East’ with some well needed space nukes.

“We’ve certainly been lacking those.”

At press time, the Federation had issued a second statement, declaring its support for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s leadership from now until the end of time.
articles.author: 5f5ac7db2796d045b7167922
articles.attr: The Galactic Federation declares unflinching support for Bibi's agenda.

articles.name: 10-northeastern-cs-students-suspended-for-not-cheating-in-fundies-final
articles.title: 10 Northeastern CS Students Suspended for Not Cheating in Fundies Final
articles.brief: In a stunning display of academic fraud, 10 Northeastern students were discovered early this morning having not cheated on the finals for CS2500, colloquially known as “Fundies”.
articles.text:
Boston, MA - In a stunning display of academic fraud, 10 Northeastern students were discovered early this morning having not cheated on the finals for CS2500, colloquially known as “Fundies”. The student’s submitted work was discovered by proprietary detection software to have been entirely original code, not stolen from either previous students or StackOverflow. 


“It was horrible,” wrote CS2500 Professor Ben Benanke in his OSCCR writeup “I couldn’t just assign them whatever grade the kid they cheated off got. I had to review each assignment individually and judge it based on the grading standards.  Well, I say ‘me’, but obviously, it goes without saying I had a TA do it.”


OSCCCCR responded swiftly, meting out the harshest punishment available to humankind - forcing the students to retake “fundies." OSCCCCCCCR Leader Bob Dimmadome had this to say - “We briefly considered the death penalty - but thought that would be too kind. This way, these students will have to listen to 90 kids bitch all over again about how tough an introduction to CS course is, even though they get partners and access to literally thousands of students who have already passed the class.”


The Husky Husky requested comment from the Justice Department on this blatant abuse of human rights - but unfortunately, the spokesman made no comment, as he was too busy burning bundles of classified paper while muttering “they can never know”.


One of the 10 students, who has requested to stay anonymous, had this to say in his defense: “I knew I was doing the wrong thing, but I just wanted to learn how to code. I don’t deserve this punishment - these kids are literally the worst. They’re acting like their fucking engineers or something actually difficult - it’s just an introduction class”
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
articles.attr: Pictured: The cs2500 academic honesty statement [Credit: Diogenes]

articles.name: redacted-revealed-to-be-the-creator-of-neu-gigs-doxxes-himself-in-huntington-news-article
articles.title: [REDACTED] revealed to be the creator of NEU Gigs, doxxes himself in Huntington News article
articles.brief: Boston, MA – In an unexpected turn of events, [REDACTED] has ousted himself as the creator of the infamous instagram doxxing page NEU Gigs. This came in the form of an article from the Huntington News which was a self fellatio disguised as a profile piece on [REDACTED].
articles.text:
Boston, MA – In an unexpected turn of events, [REDACTED] has ousted himself as the creator of the infamous Instagram doxxing page NEU Gigs. This came in the form of an article from the Huntington News which was a self fellatio disguised as a profile piece on [REDACTED].


The article was quite an impressive piece of self-praise which would even prompt some to think it was a paid piece. This rumor gained some traction given that the article does not mention [REDACTED]’s history of doxxing. To dispel any rumors, we contacted Huntington News who gave us the following statement “Paid Piece!?! No one paid us to ditch journalistic integrity, we did that ourselves.”


More importantly, the article gave us an insight as to what plans [REDACTED] had for NEU Gigs going forward. While [REDACTED] claims he is making an app “like Instagram but for college students” previous experiences have revealed that this is likely a front, as it is common knowledge that the Instagram page NEU Gigs is primarily used for doxxing students that disagree with [REDACTED].


It seems as if [REDACTED] has plans to take his doxxing to the next level and expand not to just other surrounding schools, but rather to every university in America. For this, he plans to code an app to substitute his Instagram accounts which he currently spends 15-20 hours a day on. It is unknown how [REDACTED] plans to do this since he has revealed that he has “no background” in any form of programming and only passed his fundies class after plagiarizing a fellow classmate. If our previous interviews are anything to go by it seems that [REDACTED] will have little success in coding his app given that he thinks P++ and Cython are good programming languages. In addition, [REDACTED] revealed that he would be the sole programmer in his endeavor.


Here at the Husky Husky, we all thought that this was all a joke taken too far. But in the interest of reporting, we have scheduled a second interview with [REDACTED] to further explore new developments.


In a bid to protect our journalistic integrity, our editors have decided to redact the name of the NEU Gigs creator despite his identity being public. Unlike [REDACTED] we strongly oppose doxxing.
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21
articles.attr: The mind behind NEUGigs, [REDACTED]

articles.name: student-somehow-believes-2021-will-be-better-despite-all-available-evidence-to-the-contrary
articles.title: Student Somehow Believes 2021 Will be Better Despite all Available Evidence to the Contrary
articles.brief: “It’s just so hard listening to Josiah talk,” said Elizabeth Tunke, Josiah’s mother. “It’s like he’s still living in 2019 or something - he’s just so positive. Sometimes I wonder if It’s my fault - maybe I didn’t let him watch enough cable news when he was young.”
articles.text:
Boston, MA - Sophomore business student Josiah Tunke is optimistic about the new year, despite the impending doom the world is obviously barreling towards.

“I don’t know - I just feel that the whole Covid-19 thing was just 2020 - and 2021 is a new year,” said Tunke, when questioned about his irrational beliefs. “I just have this feeling that things are going to get better! I mean, I can’t wait to see Biden in the White House!”

Tunke’s rage-inducing optimism also includes a general trust in his fellow humans, positive expectations for his own life, and a belief that Disney live-action remakes will faithfully treat his childhood icons. 

Much of Tunke’s optimism about 2021, in particular, comes from the proliferation of the Covid-19 vaccine. Those with reasonable expectations about the future know that the vaccine rollout will be a bureaucratic shitstorm and the US will be lucky if a dog accidentally gets vaccinated, let alone anyone actually at risk. But not Tunke.

Tunke is confident that the vaccine will make 2021 Covid free.

“I just think that people will be reasonable and get themselves vaccinated. I mean, we’ve had so much time to prepare for this - I really think the rollout will go great this year!”

Tunke’s family, whose home he stayed at over the last month, is at a breaking point.

“It’s just so hard listening to Josiah talk,” said Elizabeth Tunke, Josiah’s mother. “It’s like he’s still living in 2019 or something - he’s just so positive. Sometimes I wonder if It’s my fault - maybe I didn’t let him watch enough cable news when he was young.” 

The Tunke’s only source of hope? Josiah’s upcoming classload includes Fundamentals of Computer Science, known colloquially as “fundies”. 

“From what I’ve heard, that class might finally kill Josiah’s hopes and dreams,” said Mrs. Tunke. “It’s our last chance.”
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
articles.attr: Pictured: Smug student Josiah Tunke talking about his plans for 2021 when "this covid thing is all over" [Credit: Diogenes]

articles.name: westin-11-pardoned-after-clarifying-theyre-just-barbershop-hendectet
articles.title: Westin 11 Pardoned after Clarifying They’re Just Barbershop Hendectet
articles.brief: 11 NUin students, originally suspended for breaking Northeastern’s social distancing guidelines, have been pardoned this week after new evidence has come to light proving their innocence.
articles.text:
11 NUin students, originally suspended for breaking Northeastern’s social distancing guidelines, have been pardoned this week after new evidence has come to light proving their innocence. 

“We were just a barbershop hendectet,” said one of the Westin 11. (For those of you who aren’t musical prodigies, a hendectet is a musical group with eleven members.) “Everyone thought we were trying to party or something, but really we were just jamming out, singing some gnarly a cappella.”

“I mean, I could see suspending us if we were singing Taylor Swift music or something,” said the lead singer, “but we were just letting our vocal chords go wild with some High School Musical (Glee remix, course).” 

Brett Joshpe, lawyer (and secret paramour of Tucker Carlson) who represented some of the Westin 11, is relieved that his clients have been pardoned. “Originally, I focused my defense on disproportionate punishment. But once I saw that Nor’easters music video, I realized that rules don’t apply when a cappella is at stake. Not even the law can resist those sweet, sweet harmonies. Once I figured that out, all I had to do was show Madeleine Estabrook a Tik Tok of my homeboys rocking out sans instruments to some early 2010s J-Biebs.” 

Estabrook was apologetic about the incident. “We are terribly sorry that these 11 students were wrongfully suspended. When we heard that 11 of them were spreading respiratory droplets to each other in a tiny room, we acted swiftly. But what we didn’t consider was that those droplets might have been spread via singing, which is, of course, completely safe. Also, a cappella singers will be first in line to get the vaccine at Northeastern, and we have decided to recognize the Nor’easters as a Division I varsity team.” 

While the Nor’easters declined to comment on the Westin 11, they did have this to say: “We’re really excited to release our new album soon. We hope it goes viral. What comes out of our mouths is priceless, and we want it to spread everywhere. We hope our music takes your breath away.”
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: Westin 11 letting their pipes go wild to "Bop to the Top"

articles.name: huntington-news-reports-events-in-a-timely-unbiased-and-spell-checked-fashion
articles.title: Huntington News Reports Events in a Timely, Unbiased, and Spell-Checked Fashion
articles.brief: While uninteresting on the surface, this journalist was surprised when a report from Huntington news landed in my inbox, somehow avoiding the spam filter. As I hovered over the delete button, I was taken aback by the date on the article: November 26th. 2020. Not only had Huntington News managed to push out a relevant article in record time, they had managed to spell the entire date correctly.
articles.text:
Boston, MA — With another civil and definitely apolitical Thanksgiving come and gone, concerns over transitions between college and home life with the looming threat of COVID-19 have become the centerpiece of media discussion.


 While uninteresting on the surface, this journalist was surprised when a report from Huntington news landed in my inbox, somehow avoiding the spam filter. As I hovered over the delete button, I was taken aback by the date on the article: November 26th. 2020. Not only had Huntington News managed to push out a relevant article in record time, they had managed to spell the entire date correctly. 


Having piqued my interest at this point, I dared to click the connected article link and to my further surprise, was directed to the proper page. I could hardly believe it. A pristine article, published in the same calendar year as the events it reported upon, without a single grammatical or spelling error to interrupt the cold, passionless, and unbiased reporting I saw before me. 


Like enjoying a crisp saltine without the salt, I consumed an informative article void of personal input or BU slurs, with a level of professionalism one would expect from an actual news organization or a well-read seventh-grader. 


We at The Husky Husky have enjoyed the mantle as the frontier of punctual and proper journalism for Northeastern’s students and community, and we honestly couldn’t be more proud. Let it be known that as a writer for The Husky Husky, I am seriously recommending this article from Huntington News to our readers for their learning pleasure, and hope that it will pave the way for more reliable reporting from our Best Buddies at The Huntington News.
articles.author: 5f8121f52796d045b7167969
articles.attr: The Huntington News, Founded by People Who Weren’t Invited to Parties [Credit: Big Cranky]

articles.name: northeastern-students-steal-hundreds-of-gallons-of-serotonin
articles.title: Northeastern Students Steal Hundreds of Gallons of Serotonin in Desperate and Bizarre Heist
articles.brief: Depravity has hit a new low on campus; a group a depressed students stole lab supplies from ISEC just to feel something
articles.text:
Boston, MA—A potent mix of stress, fear, and 9 months of celibacy may have been too much to bear for one group of Northeastern students. On Friday December 4th, a neurochemistry researcher, Dr. Cy Cosis, reported that nearly eight hundred gallons of serotonin were stolen... and consumed inside his lab. 


Officer Pete Tee-Esde of the NUPD verified that a group of unidentified students were responsible for this bizarre crime. NUPD investigators also remarked that the lingering stench of B.O, loneliness, virginity permeating inside the lab means a group of Khoury students are certainly the culprits.  


The HuskyHusky was able to obtain security camera footage capturing the depraved burglary.  


Although the footage is grainy, it appears these students were as ill prepared for a high stakes burglary as Northeastern was to commence classes over zoom. This heist was no Ocean’s 11.


The group stumbled about, stopping every thirty seconds to check canvas and break down into tears. After four hours of searching, the thieves managed to locate Dr. Cosis’s lab, which was locked for the night.


Appearing stumped, the thieves searched Chegg to no avail. They settled on hurling their bodies at the door until the hinges gave way; an act of cathartic self punishment, no doubt. Once inside, the bloodied (and in several cases, visibly aroused) thieves located the serotonin tank and proceeded to guzzle it all.


At one point, a student propped himself atop the tank and performed a serotonin keg stand, lasting an impressive 23 seconds. One can only assume this depressed Chad really missed throwing down with the boys and contracting his semesterly case of chlamydia. 


Though the stolen serotonin is worth thousands, Dr. Cosis decided to not press charges. After pausing between swigs of a mysterious liquid, he explained; “I know what these kids did was wrong but man it could have been worse... if the cops had come Thursday instead of Friday they would have gotten me too”.
articles.author: 5ed14cacde0849334e412202
articles.attr: Security camera footage revealed the burglars celebrating their big score

articles.name: success!-student-uses-sail-to-land-prestigious-co-op-at-sail
articles.title: Success! Student Uses SAIL to Land Prestigious Co-op at SAIL
articles.brief: After months of applications, second-year therapeutic pottery major Benny Arnold has finally found a co-op.
articles.text:
Boston, MA – After months of applications, second-year therapeutic pottery major Benny Arnold has finally found a co-op.

Arnold, who applied to over 40 co-ops, attributes his ultimate success to using SAIL.

“I hadn’t gotten a single interview. It was a really tough co-op cycle,” said Arnold, “but I tried not to get discouraged. I kept seeing ads for this ‘SAIL’ app, so eventually I gave it a try. After downloading the app, I applied for a co-op and got an offer within one minute of applying.” 

The co-op will be with SAIL as a student ambassador. 

Ahate Mijab, the head of recruiting at SAIL, explained what stood out to him in Arnold’s application. “Well, even though his GPA is a 1.9 and he’s on trial for murder in Oklahoma, he was the first applicant we’ve ever had who had downloaded SAIL. He was also the first applicant we’ve ever had. With that sort of enthusiasm for SAIL, we just couldn’t say no!”

While SAIL seemed to work miracles for Benny Arnold, others are more skeptical.

“After Benny told me what happened, I downloaded SAIL to see if it would help” said Gully Bull, Arnold’s roommate. “I applied to a Big Four accounting firm, got an interview, and sent my interviewer my SAIL profile and MyStory graphic. The interviewer told me writing my resume in crayon would have been more professional. He was so disgusted that he called every accounting firm in the US and told them to blacklist me! Now the only co-op I could get was a job laundering money for a prostitution ring in Tallahasee.” 

Stay tuned for a follow-up interview with Arnold in the spring to hear how his exciting co-op is going!
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: A sample SAIL resume.

articles.name: a-fireside-interview-with-my-ra
articles.title: A Fireside Interview With My RA
articles.brief: “Please, come inside.” The velvety voice of RA Thompson enticed me deeper. Even if I had planned to stay in the dorm hall, I had no control once I heard his dulcet tones. I did exactly as he asked - no - commanded.
articles.text:
Boston, MA -- The door was covered in motivational posters, teambuilding flyers, and event advertising. Sprinkled amongst the larger posters were the scattered corpses of a thousand nametags, each tag fleshed in a different tired theme.

Some nametags featured different foods, different sites in Boston, or a thousand other concepts that spoke to the many semesters seen by the door. Between each tag, only the name stood in common: “James Thompson, RA” 

I reached to knock - and hesitated momentarily - before building the courage to knock at the door. The door silently swung open before my fist even touched the layered paper overlaying the portal. 

“Please, come inside.” The velvety voice of RA Thompson enticed me deeper. Even if I had planned to stay in the dorm hall, I had no control once I heard his dulcet tones. I did exactly as he asked - no - commanded.  

His entranceway was sparkling, freshly waxed, and smelling of rugged cedar. I heard crackling coming from deeper inside the dorm. Framed pictures of Thompson were placed tastefully around the walls. In the pictures, other figures seemed to be in the background. Obama, Joseph Auon, George Bush Senior - wait, was that Julius Cae-

“Please, Diogenes, Come into my drawing-room.” My feet led themselves, unbidden by my mind, which had completely forgotten about the pictures. I was now focused on other, more important things. The drawing-room was warm and musky, with a large leather sofa, a wooden desk with two well-filled wine glasses, a roaring fireplace, and a fur rug placed directly outside the fire. 

On the rug was my RA, whose muscular body was fully exposed to the fire’s roaring heat. He resembled Adam - except he clearly felt no shame for his current state of undress. 

The next 3 hours of unpublishable pleasure were a blur. Finally, he finished and got up to leave, my quivering body laying in the warmth of the fire’s final embers. As he walked away, a thought occurred to me.

“Wait.” He paused, his bulky frame outlined against the dark by the softly melting coals. 

“I live off-campus. I don’t have an RA. Who the fuck are you?”
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
articles.attr: Pictured: The well furnished living-spaces of my RA

articles.name: husky-history-frank-palmer-speare
articles.title: Husky History: Frank Palmer Speare
articles.brief: Everyone loves President Joseph E. Aoun, but few people know about Northeastern’s first president, Frank Palmer Speare. Just who was President Speare?
articles.text:
Speare Hall, MA—Everyone loves President Joseph E. Aoun, but few people know about Northeastern’s first president, Frank Palmer Speare. Just who was President Speare?

Big Frank was a product of the ghetto, born in Dorchester in 1869. But he actually spent much of his time on a farm in New Hampshire. According to the Northeastern Archives, his mom was a horse girl, and his dad enjoyed standing on rocks. Farmer Frank later ran a “gentleman’s farm,” which sounds like an old-fashioned strip club where the farmers dressed animals up in lingerie. Maybe this is why Papa Frank calls his horse a “playmate” in a goodbye letter written before his prompt euthanization. Students and faculty used to poke fun at Speare by drawing caricatures of him on his farm (see images above).

Outside of farm life, Sailor Speare enjoyed yachting. He also composed Christian rock music and wrote plays. Among the finest characters from his plays are “Canned-Egg,” “Hair-on-the-Lip,” and “Lonesome Fish-Ball.” He was also an active member of several clubs, including the Bald Head Club. 

He founded Northeastern and started the co-op program we all know and love. He was a pioneer and loved his school dearly. He even let our first mascot, a Siberian husky named King Husky I, live at his house! That is, until King Husky I escaped and “ravaged a neighbor’s chickens.” They didn’t let the dog come back after that.

Here’s where the story gets interesting. In addition to his educational societies and Bald Head Club membership, our man Sexy Speare was a Freemason. And he got his master’s degree in HuMaNiCs. President Aoun places tremendous value on humanics in his book, Robot-Proof, and espouses it as the future of academics. Therefore, we have reason to believe that President Aoun is also a Freemason, with the knowledge of humanics being passed down from Mason to Mason until the world needed it to fend off the robots.

There is a Frank Palmer Speare Society today at Northeastern, with admission granted for making generous gifts to the university. But I imagine that there is also some hazing within this society. Just look at the eponymous Speare Hall, the site where an RD tripped on acid and pooped in the lobby, and where a freshman decided it would be fun to jump two stories, break both legs, and put a video of it on the Meme Collective. Why did these mysterious events happen at Speare Hall? Is it a coincidence that the Underwear Run starts and ends at Speare? The Speare Society’s website says members are “invited to special gatherings throughout the year.” It appears these special gatherings are for hazing and other tomfoolery to honor the memory of Daddy Speare.

Thank you for joining us in this first installment of Husky History! We hope you have learned much about our founding president.
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: From the Northeastern Archives: “Speare’s farming was the subject of several caricatures, created by Northeastern University students and staff.”

articles.name: to-my-dear-ordering-md
articles.title: To My Dear Ordering MD
articles.brief: It only took four words for you to steal my heart. Four measly words.    You have results waiting.   From that moment I received that first email, I was hooked.
articles.text:
Dear Ordering MD, 

It only took four words for you to steal my heart. Four measly words. 

You have results waiting.

From that moment I received that first email, I was hooked. 

Every three days, I awaited the results, sometimes refreshing the patient portal for hours on end, just to see your blessed name. If the daily robot-proofing became too much, I would even schedule my test early. You were my idol, my sunshine, and my only reason to face the cruel realities of experiential learning. 

I never properly thanked you for all of it. Taking the time out of your schedule to personally draft an email informing that I was COVID negative—admirable. Assigning me a unique requisition number so my result could be properly filed—don’t even get me started. I get hot under the collar just thinking about it. Reporting methods and limitations so immaculately— you would think I’m COVID positive, because it took my breath away.

Sometimes you would leave me on read, and my heart would ache in those lapses, but you would always come back. Don’t tell me that you didn’t feel it too. I could feel your untethered desire even through that antiquated patient portal. 

I nearly shattered during winter break knowing that it would be months before I would hear from you again. But after an eon of wondering and heart throb, it finally appeared again. 

You have results waiting.

Alas, imagine my pain when I find a different ordering MD in my lab results.  

Did those months of analyzing my snot mean nothing to you? How can you drop me without so much as a second thought? Where did it all go wrong? 

I can’t believe I was so foolish. Please let me make this right. I’ll supply all the samples you need for your testing, just please, come back to me. Just one more time. 

Most faithfully yours, 

Kneel Bones

comments.name: White-tongue Larry
comments.content: Snot? Then why do they keep asking me for semen samples?

articles.attr: #justhuskythings

articles.name: peace-talks-collapse-as-goose-bloc-breaks-ceasefire
articles.title: Peace Talks Collapse as Goose Bloc Breaks Ceasefire
articles.brief: Yesterday,  a landmark summit was held in the deserted Stwest dining hall to open negotiations between Northeastern and the Goose Liberation Army (GLA). A cessation of hostilities had been called for by the GLA, and they met with King Husky II to discuss peace terms.
articles.text:
Boston, MA — Yesterday,  a landmark summit was held in the deserted Stwest dining hall to open negotiations between Northeastern and the Goose Liberation Army (GLA). A cessation of hostilities had been called for by the GLA, and they met with King Husky II to discuss peace terms.


Students have been found crossing the border on an almost daily basis, occupying goose territory before being driven out or captured. Many goose citizens fear for their safety as students flex their puffy goose-filled jackets. Conversely, the GLA has been accused of trying to bring Measles back to campus. Upon reaching out to one goose soldier for comment, I was instead invited to “Go honk myself”. After notifying him that my body was still recovering from Destroy Dick December, he quickly apologized and added,


“Though we may engage in a bloody conflict with each other, we cannot do so without a degree of civility. The Goose Liberation Army respects the students who do not wear those accursed jackets filled with my kin, and we want to show our support for their goodwill with these perfectly safe, non-biohazardous, CDC brand blankets for the coming winter.”


Reporter’s Note: Despite the many prejudices leveled against the geese and their tactics, this reporter must remark on the comfort provided by these blankets, and the everlasting warmth that my now inflamed eyes and throat give me.


Earlier this month the GLA ambassador, Henry Kissengoose, put forth a message of unifying the entirety of the Fens under the Goose Liberation Army. This would mean a historical alliance between the GLA and the Goosejahideen, an extremist wing of the Fens, who claimed responsibility for the closing of Chicken Lou’s in April and the radicalization of domestic ducks to their cause. Kissengoose called for negotiations to open with Northeastern University, offering safe passage to students through the Fens, in exchange for occupancy of ISECs 4-6.


King Husky II, however, ruffled feathers when he arrived late to the summit in a Gold-lined Canada Goose jacket, with no intentions of meeting the demands of the ‘long-necked seagulls’, as he referred to them.


What was initially a professional debate setting soon devolved into almost unintelligible honking and barking. I interviewed the chief translator at the summit, hoping for a more precise transcript. He had this to say:


“Of course they’re honking and barking, they’re animals. What do you mean you can hear them? Are you on drugs?“


I was, but it hadn’t seemed relevant. The following morning, members of the GLA occupied Stetson West, thus ending the ceasefire, and have since renamed the complex Northgeestern.

President Aoun was called on for a swift response, however he was too busy trying to figure out how to charge the geese tuition.
articles.author: 5f8121f52796d045b7167969
articles.attr: Photo Credit: Goosar al-Assad

articles.name: op-ed-the-devastation-of-the-gme-craze-from-a-4th-generation-finance-major
articles.title: Op-Ed: The devastation of the $GME craze from a 4th generation finance major
articles.brief: My father pulled himself up by his bootstraps. After countless hours of hard work with private tutors (and his parents’ $500k donation), he made it into Harvard. With nothing but superior intellect, elbow grease, and a $40 million inheritance, he founded the next multi-billion dollar hedge fund. His most recent flawless, smart-money plan? Short-sell $GME.
articles.text:
My father pulled himself up by his bootstraps. After countless hours of hard work with private tutors (and his parents’ $500k donation), he made it into Harvard. With nothing but superior intellect, elbow grease, and a $40 million inheritance, he founded the next multi-billion dollar hedge fund. His most recent flawless, smart-money plan? Short-sell $GME.

But thanks to some greedy plebeians on Reddit, it all came crashing down. They bought shares of the same stock we were trying to short out of existence; clearly, they are the ones manipulating the market. Like daddy said on CNBC, random poors who aren’t smart enough to invest are leading a highly coordinated attempt to bankrupt us. 

Even the government is in on it - daddy called Congress and the SEC to bail him out, but they refused! The audacity! Do you know how much we pay them? 

I don’t understand why these degenerates have so much public support. We only caused a market crash that resulted in them losing their jobs, their houses, and their life savings. None of that ever would’ve happened if they just pulled their bootstraps harder.

When these greedy peasants steal our money for trivial things like tuition, healthcare, and utility bills, they inflict untold hardships on us. I’ve been through hard times before: once, we had to take a commercial flight home from Monaco, and I had to sit in a cramped seat next to plebeians for nine hours! I don’t know how they get away with calling that first class. I was also the only one at my Swiss boarding school with a car worth less than $100,000, earning me the nickname “the poor kid.” As you can see, I’m not new to suffering, but the fallout of r/WSB’s greed is on a whole nother level.

Except for our $100 million trust fund, shell charity worth $27 million, and the $10 million PPP loan the hedge fund got last spring, we’re financially ruined. I might have to wear the same Canada Goose jacket more than twice, we’re gonna be stuck with our crappy old yacht instead of the new one daddy promised, we might have to sell our 3rd and 4th beach houses, and with the hedge fund gone, I’ll need to get co-ops at companies that aren’t owned by my father!

Even worse, those capitalist pigs are donating our money to charities like homeless shelters and children’s hospitals. They’re completely missing the point! Those “charities” don’t give you the money back once tax season ends.

Capitalism is clearly broken. “Pull yourself up by your bootstraps” means working two jobs and having less Starbucks, not manipulating markets. Only we’re allowed to do that!

comments.name: Financial Genius
comments.content:
GME TO THE MOON!!!
DIAMOND HANDS!!!

articles.author: 5f9cd18642eacb6a8bb46504
articles.attr: Oh, the humanity! That yacht was my favorite one...

articles.name: breaking-new-husky-pac-will-lobby-the-fuck-out-of-sga
articles.title: Breaking: New Husky PAC will lobby the fuck out of SGA
articles.brief: We’re pleased to announce the Husky PAC(K), a political action committee (k) dedicated to lobbying the ever loving fuck out of the SGA until our every last demand is met.
articles.text:
Well folks, this does it. The SGA has gone too far this time.

This Monday, the SGA blocked our WONDERFUL referendum to put SAIL in Jail, harder than Mitch McConnell blocking our stimulus checks. Despite having (presumed) widespread support amongst the student body, parliamentary skullduggery was utilized to leave it dead in its tracks. 

We briefly considered storming the SGA offices, but high demand for confederate flags and tiki torches has made them prohibitively expensive. Plus, bludgeoning an NUPD officer to death might not endear holdouts to our cause. 

So we’re pleased to announce the Husky PAC(K), a political action committee (k) dedicated to lobbying the ever loving fuck out of the SGA until our every last demand is met. We can’t buy those Nazi flags, but we can buy your senators.

That’s right, we’ll bribe every last senator until the entire council is on our payroll and we become the Senate. Those who do not comply will be wiped out in primary challenges, and those who survive will not be able to function with the boot of our legislative authority on their neck. 

Their well compensated “constituents” will hound them outside their dorms, in their classrooms, on their Zoom calls, and all the way down Huntington Avenue to make their displeasure felt. They’ll suddenly find their NuGo apps mysteriously malfunctioning, and a suspicious number of their COVID tests will come back positive. Try sabotaging our resolutions when you’re stuck in the COVID gulag, bitch.  

And if that doesn’t work, we’ll hire a gang of roving transfer students to institute year long martial law, and the entire Senate will be marched through the tunnels to secret disciplinary tribunals, where they will be summarily executed. We’re still working out the details with Marjorie Taylor Greene, but we’ll give you a hint. It’ll involve Aoun, and a lot of pain. 

We’re a little tilted.

comments.name: Aoun and a lot of pa

articles.name: northeastern-senator-accidently-filibusters-own-bill
articles.title: Northeastern Senator Accidently Filibusters Own Bill
articles.brief: “It’s the third time this week,” said Senator Tina Chen. “We haven’t gotten a bill passed in the last 10 months because people keep on filibustering their own legislation."
articles.text:
Boston, MA - When Student Senator Todd Johnson was told that his “Less Bad Things and Also Racism is Bad” bill hadn’t passed the Senate he was dumbstruck. The bill, carefully calculated to show everyone how good of a guy he was, had support from every senator who had bothered to form a quorum. 

Unfortunately, Senator Johnson’s 5 hour rambling, self-aggrandizing, and often repetitive speech had done the one thing needed to stop the proposal from being passed: 

Senator Johnson had inadvertently filibustered his own bill. 

“It’s the third time this week,” said Senator Tina Chen. “We haven’t gotten a bill passed in the last 10 months because people keep on filibustering their own legislation. The second a Senator gets up to talk, they forget how to stop talking. Before Covid, we could physically restrain them, but with Zoom, we have to wait for them to pause before we can interrupt.”

The Senate, which meets to propose and vote on bills regarding student life, attempted to solve the problem by introducing a bill last Saturday. Unfortunately, the “Stop Filibustering and also Lower Tuition Somehow” bill was filibustered by its own sponsor, Senator David Marks. 

“I just wanted people to know I’m a great guy,” Said Senator Marks. “I made a statement or two about the bill, made a transformative and unprecedented point about how tuition is expensive, and then proceeded to explain how much I loved The Black Panther. You know - because I’m not a bigot. I never expected that  would stop the bill from getting passed.”

The news, however, is not entirely grim. Although the Student Senate has passed no legislation for almost a year - this change of events has had 0 effects on the actual lives of students on campus.
articles.author: 5ea89a82b7e61d16ce967c1a
articles.attr: Pictured: The SGA engaging in rigorous discourse while a sleepy man waits for the bus

articles.name: op-ed-impeaching-trump-will-be-a-slippery-slope-towards-accountability
articles.title: Op-Ed: Impeaching Trump will be a slippery slope towards accountability
articles.brief: If Donald Trump is successfully impeached, we’ll go down a slippery slope where elected officials will be held accountable for their actions.
articles.text:
Look, like all Americans, I completely and totally condemn the attack on the Capitol on January 6th. Even though it was mostly peaceful. And the election was stolen. And these people were patriots. But also maybe ANTIFA. Like I’ve said, I have no love for them whatsoever.

But Democrats in the Senate are on a suicide mission that will only end in catastrophe. By trying to convict President Trump for his supposed “role” in trying to “overturn the election, “ they set a dangerous precedent of cause and effect. If Donald Trump is successfully impeached, we’ll go down a slippery slope where elected officials will be held accountable for their actions. 

I mean give me a break! If we hold this president accountable for violating his oath of office and abusing power, what’s next, holding future presidents accountable when they do the same? This will put us down the path to anarchy. If the founding fathers wanted impeachment to occur for high crimes and misdemeanors, they would have written it down in a foundational document. A constitution of sorts. 

None of this is fair at all! Trump gave a perfect speech, but Dems want to cancel him and stifle his free speech. Look at all the things Trump said before the attack that loony liberals are saying “incited violence.”

“If you don’t fight like hell, you’re not going to have a country anymore.” I mean this is easy. When Trump said you won’t have a country anymore, he was talking about No Country for Old Men. He thought it was a documentary, and was just voicing his concern about the situation of men over the age of 65.  It's an easy mistake!

“You’ll never take back our country with weakness.” This is actually a misquote. Trump actually said “you’ll never take back our court with a weak press.” He was clearly talking about the Washington Wizards, who lost a tight game that day to the 76ers with a weak, half court press. “Everyone knows you gotta do a full court press, get that weak shit outta here!” said Trump.

“Big protest in D.C. on January 6th. Be there, will be wild!” I mean now you guys are just being intentionally obtuse. Had you actually watched Trump’s speech in its entirety, you’d have heard him delivering a moving oration of the children’s book “Where the Wild Things are.” And of course everyone knows the wild things do actually reside at the Capitol, where the Democrats drink child blood and pray to Moloch.

Like I said, a perfect speech. This impeachment trial is a sham. If the radical marxists continue, they risk creating a brave new world where the things you say or do can, in fact, have consequence. It's a slippery slope when political actors are held responsible for their actions.
articles.author: 5f5ac7db2796d045b7167922
articles.attr: The sham impeachment trial of the TRUE winner of the 2020 election.

articles.name: students-caught-throwing-rager-in-ryder-hall-swear-it-was-just-to-boost-sail-profile
articles.title: Students Caught Throwing Rager in Ryder Hall Swear It Was ‘Just to Boost SAIL Profile’
articles.text:
Boston, MA — Several students were caught hosting a large gathering in Ryder Hall last week in violation of NU’s social distancing guidelines. While an absolute rager with booze, bimbos, and bongs might seem like a reckless social event, some are claiming the event was actually an academic endeavor.

“This wasn’t a party,” said Craig Halpin, social chair of Sigma Alpha Iota Lambda. “It was actually an experiential learning opportunity for us to bolster our purple Well-Being Dimension for our SAIL 360 Profiles.”

“We were actually required to throw this large gathering for academic purposes,” explained Sigma Alpha Iota Lambda president Olivia Sharpe. “So many of our professors now mandate the use of SAIL that we had to bolster our Well-Being Dimension in order to pass this semester. With so many Well-Being events canceled or restricted due to COVID-19, we had to create our own opportunity.”

“Look, I know we broke a few rules, but I really had to do cocaine in order to pass this semester. All four of my professors grade us on our SAIL profiles, and this was the only way to boost my purple Well-Being Dimension enough to pass,” said Phyllis Mason.

“Yeah, I had to have unprotected sex with a stripper for the sake of experiential learning,” echoed Stewart Owens. “Getting a rare French STD was a huge win for my Global Mindset Dimension. I know there’s a pandemic, but this was an academic necessity to strengthen my SAIL profile.”

The creators of SAIL declined an interview but provided a brief written statement: “While we do regret the use of our app as a bioweapon, there is nothing more important than one’s SAIL 360 Profile. Anyone who breaks the rules in the name of SAIL will receive a full pardon, membership in Sigma Alpha Iota Lambda, and a SAIL student ambassador position.”
articles.author: 5eae44841d76bb6ac5fe44a1
articles.attr: Sigma Alpha Iota Lambda partaking in a valuable academic exercise.

articles.name: our-last-sail-article-i-swear-please-stop-yelling-at-me-mom
articles.title: Our Last SAIL Article I Swear Please Stop Yelling At Me Mom
articles.brief: “What about all of the other Referendum that promised students money and went nowhere?” Some say we’re using the referendum process as a circus to show off naive demands backed by an untenable negotiating position, that our performative politics diminish the legitimacy and standing of student government. I say that Trotsky fell during an ice-climbing expedition in Mexico.
articles.text:
The Husky Husky (note: “The” is part of our name you journalistic hacks) has come under fire from an unexpected source: Communications Director of Northeastern’s Young Democratic Socialists of America Joshua Sisman. Sisman, for the three of you that don’t follow the minutia of SGA politics, was a sponsor of the Meal Plan Fee Referendum, which beat out our proposed Freedom From SAIL Referendum. While the phrase “don’t beat a dead horse” comes to mind, we must, of course, note our staff is composed entirely of Siberian Huskies -  not horses. 

Traditionally it’s the losers of an election who complain about elections being rigged —not to name any candidate in particular. But even though our proposal failed spectacularly, Sisman cited the SAIL referendum as interfering with his rightful passage of the Meal Plan Referendum. Consequently, we at The Husky Husky are forced to conclude proposing any policy not directly supporting Sisman’s Young Democratic Socialists of America is simply unconscionable. Given this conclusion, we are forced to cede to their ideological superiority — and engage in some good ol’ fashioned leftist infighting. 

We agree that student access to food is imperative. We agree students should be able to rely on Northeastern to guarantee access to food. We agree that the current system of Swipe2Care is insufficient to give students access to meal plans. Our only question is this: Why do the reactionary Girondins of the Meal Plan Referendum demand only a 24% price reduction in meal plan prices when the proletariat students deserve entirely free meals? 

“But Diogenes!” you cry, “How is the SGA supposed to demand Northeastern radically change financial forecasts about a considerable operational portion of its budget? Shouldn’t SGA focus on providing students with tangible outcomes rather than idealistic referendums that have no chance of impacting Northeastern policy?” You, comrade, sound like a Menshevik counterrevolutionary. It doesn’t matter if the policy has viability — it matters if we can imply our opponents don’t empathize with poor students. 

“What about all of the other Referendum that promised students money and went nowhere?” Some say we’re using the referendum process as a circus to show off naive demands backed by an untenable negotiating position, that our performative politics diminish the legitimacy and standing of student government. I say that Trotsky fell during an ice-climbing expedition in Mexico.

Reactionaries may claim that it’s not “detached” to have reasonable expectations for student government and that “feasibility” is an SGA standard for good reason. These same Dengists claim that real change comes from a frank understanding of political realities and not from ideological influenced policy transparently stemming from political affiliation. 

I only claim one thing: A year from now, it won’t matter if the Meal Plan Referendum is passed with a 24% reduction, a 50% reduction, or a 200% reduction. Northeastern students will still be paying the same price for IV pizza — and they’ll probably have to post a picture of it on for their  SAIL profile. 


At Husky Husky, we only regret that we have but {inset number here} lives to lay down for our university- to free it from SAIL.

comments.name: Not Estabrook
comments.content:
Dear Northeastern University Students,

We're excited to see our students engage so passionately in support of their ideas, and welcome constructive discourse. We're concerned, however, about recent reports of "leftist infighting".

Leftist infighting does not appear on the list of University-approved, Covid-safe activities (examples of Covid-safe activities include experiencing our exciting new Virtual Quad, socializing safely - with a mask and without any other people present either physically or virtually, and paying tuition). In fact, discussing the prices of dining hall food or the equitability of Northeastern's housing developments - even virtually - is one of the fastest and deadliest ways to spread Covid.

We ALL need to do our part to #ProtectThePack and keep each other safe - including you! The best tools we have to keep each other safe and complete a successful semester are masks, hand sanitizer, SAIL, and luxury apartments.

Sincerely,
Not Madeleine Estabrook, B.S., J.K.

articles.name: oped-the-biden-administration-must-declare-a-war-on-geese
articles.title: Op Ed: The Biden Administration Must Declare a War on Geese
articles.brief: It’s Time to Get Hawkish About Geese
articles.text:
Politicians love war, maybe even more than they love themselves. Politicians get so war-horny that when they can’t invent a reason to declare one abroad (ahem, Iraq), they wage them at home, to massive success. Case in point: the War on Drugs. 

So seeing as the Biden administration is unable to invade Iraq again—ground invasions would not pass the CDC’s social distancing guidelines—it’s time that Joe declares war on America’s most dire threat: geese

As I’m sure you’ve noticed, America has felt like a real shit hole lately. Our goose problem isn’t helping. Each year, geese produce a staggering amount of poop: enough to fill 26,455,804 Olympic size swimming pools. That's more shit than floods my Northeastern inbox every day. 

The goose situation is beak. I mean bleak. I’m shocked most people don’t realize that at any moment a motivated group of geese could grab you with their weird rubber feet, fly thousands of feet into the air, and drop you to your death. 

Granted, that’s unlikely. But it could fucking happen. And you’ve always known that too. 

Some realities are just easier to ignore. 

But if you hadn’t considered that very real possibility, you’re welcome. Keep it in the back of your mind during your next stroll through the Fens. 

So Biden, what's the hold up? If you thought Trump was an existential threat to American values and society, I’d implore you to take a long look at the turbo-shitting daemons that have stalked our nation since its founding. 


Goose Elimination Kills Two Birds with One Stone

With complete control of the House, Senate and Presidency, the Dems have a golden opportunity to p̶a̶s̶s̶ l̶a̶n̶d̶m̶a̶r̶k̶ c̶l̶i̶m̶a̶t̶e̶ l̶e̶g̶i̶s̶l̶a̶t̶i̶o̶n̶, r̶e̶p̶a̶i̶r̶ A̶m̶e̶r̶i̶c̶a̶’s̶ d̶a̶m̶a̶g̶e̶d̶ r̶e̶p̶u̶t̶a̶t̶i̶o̶n̶ a̶b̶r̶o̶a̶d̶, a̶n̶d̶ d̶e̶f̶e̶a̶t̶ C̶O̶V̶I̶D̶-̶1̶9̶ do what I say and purge the geese. 

Luckily, exterminating America’s geese accomplishes all of Biden’s major policy objectives AND makes me happy. 

Keeping Americans Safe: Slaughtering the nation’s geese will keep the country safe from a terrifying mob, lingering in the background of society, whose actions threaten the very foundations of democracy. Sure, there might be a group of fascists too. But geese are worse than fascists. At least fascists can't fly. 

Fighting Climate Change: Goose shit generates more greenhouse gasses than transportation, agriculture, energy production, and the fashion industry combined. Do you really want your grandchildren to live with a dystopic climate AND geese? One crisis is more than enough. 

Ending the COVID-19 Pandemic: Alright, you got me. I’ve no clue how killing geese will end the pandemic. At least it’ll pass the time while we wait for the vaccine? 

Repairing Political Culture: At some point in their lives, all Americans experience the same horrifying feeling of stepping in goose shit. Addressing this shared trauma will unite us as a people and usher in the Roaring Twenties, part two.

Strengthening our Foreign Policy: I mean, these are CANDIAN geese, right? 

Making Me Happy For Once: This is perhaps the most important of Biden’s policy objectives. I, as a knower of all things and a person with enough free time to write articles like this, have the right to make policymakers cater to my every whim. 

So mark my words, if there’s still a living goose on U.S soil by January 21st 2024, the Biden administration will have cooked the goose.
articles.author: 5ed14cacde0849334e412202
articles.attr: The US can finally use Predator Drones without violating human rights!

articles.name: i-heart-dunkins
articles.title: I ❤️ Dunkins: A Virtual Quad Romance
articles.brief: When I first laid eyes upon the message in my inbox, I knew it was the start of something special. I had already gotten the daily “Instructure Canvas Notifications,” “Time to schedule your next COVID test,” and the usual hundred or so “recording available” messages, so this new email had to be something great.
articles.text:
To my dearest polka-dotted bean,


When I first laid eyes upon the message in my inbox, I knew it was the start of something special. I had already gotten the daily “Instructure Canvas Notifications,” “Time to schedule your next COVID test,” and the usual hundred or so “recording available” messages, so this new email had to be something great.

But when the email read, “Announcing the new Virtual Quad experience,” I must admit, my love, I had my doubts. I thought for a moment that it might be a half-baked effort to pretend things were normal instead of actually addressing student mental health. No, Northeastern would never do something like that – it just had to be good!

My excitement was palpable as I created my perfect little bean. I could barely contain my anticipation now – it was like I knew you’d be there waiting for me.

However, the virtual representation of the Snell quad in which I found myself was totally empty. My dear, it was emptier than Outtakes on a Tuesday afternoon, and I was more alone than an engineering student on Saturday night.

“Where was everybody?” I thought. How could this possibly have gone so wrong? I would have cried, but there was no sobbing emoji. My hand was shaking as I prepared to close the tab and end my little bean’s short life, but then, in the center of the quad, you appeared.

Your polka-dot pattern was entrancing, and the soft, monochrome tone of your face was the most beautiful thing I had ever laid eyes on. It was love at first sight. The way you moved around the quad, graceful as though you were levitating off the ground, was mesmerizing; the way you seductively whispered “1st 1st 1st” was completely irresistible. I threw up a heart emoji, and from the moment you spammed it back to me, I knew that I was yours and you were mine.

Together we zipped around our virtual paradise, floating on air (ok, maybe that was because the graphics were done in MS paint), and I could just tell you were the one for me, my dear. Exhausted, we fell into each other’s conspicuously absent arms. I had finally found the love of my life. 

    Trying to spark a conversation, I said “I ❤️ Dunkins,” and in one instant, you destroyed our relationship of countless minutes. You replied, “I ❤️ Starbucks” – I quiver as I write those ugly words. I felt betrayed and heartbroken. I cannot believe that a bean so lovely and charming as you would have feelings for such an objectively inferior coffee chain, and now I have to bear the guilt of having loved a Starbucks drinker. 

My heart was broken, it’s true, but I can enjoy my Dunkins iced coffee in peace knowing that my depression, burnout, and isolation have all been solved thanks to the Virtual Quad.


Yours truly,

Blue bean with red stripes

comments.content: please come back :( i'd give all the starbucks in the world to spend another minute on the virtual quad with you

articles.name: goose-liberation-army-to-sign-peace-treaty-with-northeastern-administration
articles.title: Goose Liberation Army to sign Peace Treaty with Northeastern Administration
articles.brief: Boston, MA - In a zoom press conference this afternoon it has been announced by the Northeastern administration that a peace treaty with the Goose Liberation Army (GLA) could be signed as early as next week.
articles.text:
Boston, MA - In a zoom press conference this afternoon it has been announced by the Northeastern administration that a peace treaty with the Goose Liberation Army (GLA) could be signed as early as next week. 

The announcement comes after a turbulent time in Northeastern-Goose relationships with the memory of a GLA-occupied Northeastern still fresh in the minds of many. After the events of March 2020 where the conflict reached a boiling point once the GLA invaded a desolate Northeastern and was promptly chased out by a reborn King Husky. a standoff developed. The Northeastern administration was forced to establish an exclusion zone on the border of the fens. With the GLA arming its border preparing to attack any student that crossed into their territory bearing a Canada Goose jacket tensions remained high.

The Covid pandemic developed the situation in a variety of unexpected ways as the administration grew to have bigger concerns than the Fens Geese. This however, has appeared to benefit both sides as they have finally come to an agreement to establish peace. The details of the agreement are still being kept in relative secrecy by the administration. However, insider information provided by NULeaks points that the agreement involves sacrificing a number of Canada Goose jackets every semester to appease the GLA, a cost international students have deemed acceptable.
articles.author: 5ea89c67b7e61d16ce967c21

articles.name: historic-peace-treaty-with-the-goose-liberation-army-signed
articles.title: Historic Peace Treaty with the Goose Liberation Army Signed
articles.brief: Boston, MA - After several peace talks and far too much speculation by Huntington News reporters, the Goose Liberation Army (GLA) has agreed to sign a peace treaty. The announcement and subsequent signing of the peace treaty took place at the future site of ISEC V. Both President Aoun and the leader of the GLA signed the historic agreement ending a decades-long conflict between the Fens Geese and Northeastern University.
articles.text:
Boston, MA - After several peace talks and far too much speculation by Huntington News reporters, the Goose Liberation Army (GLA) has agreed to sign a peace treaty. The announcement and subsequent signing of the peace treaty took place at the future site of ISEC V. Both President Aoun and the leader of the GLA signed the historic agreement ending a decades-long conflict between the Fens Geese and Northeastern University.

The groundbreaking agreement establishes a number of conventions that both sides must adhere to. For Northeastern students, this means that they will now be safe from geese while crossing the fens for Target runs at midnight. Students will still need to fend themselves from the ravenous attacks by Berkelee student acapella groups. Thus the Husky Husky still recommends students carry standard issue M240 machine guns with armor-piercing rounds to deal with wild acapella groups. However, the peace accords signed guarantee fellow huskies will not meet the end at the hands of the infamous fens geese ever again.

So what’s in this for the GLA and the fens geese? Well, Northeastern has promised to sacrifice 2 students who own Canada Goose apparel every year. The Northeastern administration has already made a list of students in possession of Canada Goose apparel and will choose the two sacrificial students at random. Preparations to make this event into a university holiday are expected to start soon.

With the decades-old conflict now over, a wave of much-needed relief has swept Northeastern students. “I’m so glad that it’s over, I was left behind last March when Northeastern evicted everyone. I didn’t see the email so I was horrified when the Geese invaded” said Jim Collins, a 9th-year business student. It is safe to say that with the conflict over, Northeastern has become a little less of a major shitshow.

articles.name: cyber-attack-shuts-down-linkedin-damore-mckim-professors-unsure-what-to-teach
articles.title: Cyber-Attack Shuts Down Linkedin: D'Amore McKim Professors Unsure What To Teach
articles.brief: "I didn’t drive two separate corporations to bankruptcy without learning how to think on my feet. I quickly adjusted the lesson header and taught an impromptu class titled ‘Hiding your Third Divorce from the Board of Directors’."
articles.text:
Boston, MA - In a daring cyber-attack that shocked recruiters, unemployed “entrepreneurs”, and pretentious people writing their own words as quotes - Linkedin was forced to temporarily shut down access to its website Friday. But one group, in particular, was hurt worse than most: professors at Northeastern University’s esteemed business school - D’A’mor’e Mc’k’im. 

“It was awful”, said Jerome Tibalt, an adjunct professor at D’Amore McKim. “I showed up in the morning and pulled up LinkedIn - you know - to show my students how modern workplaces operate - and nothing came up. How are students supposed to understand LinkedIn’s advanced futuristic interface if I don't teach it to them? 

Other professors were forced to rapidly adjust to the classroom without LinkedIn. 

“I was in the middle of a LinkedIn lesson when the website suddenly crashed,” Said Tim Eric, a Professor Emeritus at Northeastern. “But I didn’t drive two separate corporations to bankruptcy without learning how to think on my feet. I quickly adjusted the lesson header and taught an impromptu class titled ‘Hiding your Third Divorce from the Board of Directors’. I love Tenure.” 

Students, however, were excited about the change in programming. Dan Barlin, a Third-Year Business Administration and Marketing student, was in class when the crash occurred.

“Professor Tibalt was sharing his screen when he suddenly started shaking and gibbering incoherently.” Said Barlin, tears streaming down his cheeks. “We could all see his LinkedIn wasn’t opening - but I was more concerned about the foam streaming from his mouth. At one point he just screamed the word ‘NETWORKING’ and collapsed from his desk.”

articles.name: blood-soaked-aoun-announces-northeastern-no-longer-has-a-housing-problem
articles.title: Blood soaked Aoun announces Northeastern no longer has a housing problem
articles.brief: Boston, MA - Today, at a sudden press conference, A blood-soaked Aoun announced that Northeastern no longer has a housing crisis, as he has, with the help of the administration, completely eradicated the problem. President Aoun was noticeably winded and gave of a rather unsettling aura of excitement. When a Huntington News reporter asked him if the solution was permanent, Aoun responded with “Oh yeah, it’s pretty permanent.”
articles.text:
Boston, MA - Today, at a sudden press conference, A blood-soaked Aoun announced that Northeastern no longer has a housing crisis, as he has, with the help of the administration, completely eradicated the problem. President Aoun was noticeably winded and gave off a rather unsettling aura of excitement. When a Huntington News reporter asked him if the solution was permanent, Aoun responded with “Oh yeah, it’s pretty permanent.” 

Husky Husky correspondents asked about the solution used to solve the housing problem but Aoun did not reveal anything other than that “the IV basement will be closed for a little while.”

It’s safe to say that whatever Aoun has done to resolve the housing crisis has certainly worked. With shorter lines at dining halls and around campus students have praised Aoun for solving the Northeastern Housing crisis. “It’s nice to finally have that gigantic 7-person suite at West Village all to myself,'' said Michael Fraiser, a seventh-year business major. “I’m just happy I can finally move out from my dorm under the Green Line on Huntington Ave,” said Amy Counter, a third-year Whale Astrology major.

Not all students welcomed the change, as a number of SGA members lodged a complaint stating “the solution presented by the Northeastern administration does not solve the housing crisis of surrounding universities and is very classist.” These complaints were obviously ignored by the administration, much like everything else SGA does.

comments.name: Concerned Student
comments.content: I very much appreciate Aoun for this great initiative!
